reviews.text: I don't know what kind of sadist wakes up in the morning, and becomes a tow truck company/impound. The miserable women who answer the phone are literally all extremely rude as hell.

reviews.name: Bob Schaffer
reviews.text:
Their vehicle dumped hydraulic oil all over the street in front of my neighbor's driveway and he's pissed. He told me to get it clean up.  I called them and asked them to clean it up the receptionist told me all the drivers were out so they would try and get over by 7:30 this evening to clean it up or tomorrow morning. It's 3:30 in the afternoon right now.  I asked them if I could work a deal with them and clean it up instead of the $70 charge for Towing. She said she would get the owner. I asked him the same thing over the phone and he replied that it was only a $2 bag that need to be thrown down to clean it up and he would take care of it when he had to drive available maybe this evening or tomorrow morning. Neighbor is still pissed and now it looks like i have to go get some absorbant and clean up those fools mess. Again, oil was from tbeir truck,  not mine.

Update:
A driver came by and cleaned it up by 5 this evening,  but probably only because I wrote this review  so I'm giving them an extra star.

reviews.name: Kim
reviews.text:
Best recovery group!
If you find yourself off-road regularly, save their number in your phone in case you need it.
Don't forget to check out their YouTube channel, to learn more about their recovery techniques.

Ben and Caleb were awesome 🤘

-Nord
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you!! Love the review!

companies.name: CN Towing Recovery / Heavy Duty Equipment transport In West Valley City UT / Servicio De Grúa En West Valley City UT
Snowy Mountain Research and Recovery LLC

reviews.name: Joseph Mitchell
reviews.text: There is absolutely a reason these people get 1 star. Unprofessional. Cuts you off. Doesn't explain anything. Treats you like garbage over the phone because they have your vehicle as collateral. Extremely disrespectful. Im calling walmart corporate.

reviews.name: Tyler Brooks
reviews.text:
1 star because 0 isn’t an option. First, they towed my roommates car AGAINST HOA protocol at 2 AM. Thankfully, our HOA was able to get them to release the vehicle, free of charge.
I accompanied my roommate to pick up the vehicle (not only because he needed a ride, but the way they spoke to him on the phone was… rather threatening) & we were greeted with the most rude, disrespectful & confrontational employees.
While my roommate was inspecting his vehicle to ensure there weren’t any damages, one of the employees called me over (from the gate where I was waiting) to “come get your friend & get him & his truck off the property immediately.”
Confused as to why this sad excuse for a man had become angry, I asked what was wrong with checking for damages.
The second employee came huffing & puffing out of their… trailer? to inform me that they had “given my friends truck back, free of charge (even though they took it when they weren’t supposed to) & that we needed to leave the property.
I suggested they try being nice & that they needed to relax. The (man) employee started stomping his feet towards me as if he wanted to fight (lol) & told me he would call the police if I didn’t leave the property (as if they hadn’t just told me to enter the property to get my friend).
Some really fun words were exchanged & it made for a really fantastic Saturday (sarcasm intended).

Don’t give the poor excuse for a company the time of day & definitely don’t give them a dime (unless you like feeling as if you may be assaulted). They are some of the most disrespectful people I have come across. Reading the other reviews, I’m not alone.

Also, another employee once tried to fight another one of my roommates a while back due to him trying to tow his vehicle because he was parked IN MY DRIVEWAY WHILE HE UNLOADED HIS CAR.

-1 trillion out of 10.

reviews.name: Allison Foust
reviews.text: I had an awful experience with Snowy Mountain/Central Valley/Atomic Towing in Salt Lake City. First off, the signage where my car was towed from is confusing and can easily be misinterpreted—be very careful about where you park in this city! When I went to pick up my car, I was met with some of the rudest and most unprofessional employees I've ever encountered. One of the guys had his foot propped up on the dashboard and was scrolling through his phone, completely ignoring me as I tried to ask him questions about the situation. He didn’t even bother to look at me or acknowledge my concerns. The lack of basic courtesy and professionalism was shocking. I’d recommend avoiding this company if you can. They clearly don’t care about their customers.

reviews.name: Adrienne McElwain
reviews.text: Backed into my kids play set and then told me he didn’t care if he broke my things because he was the boss and he delivers 1500 buildings a year. When I called and complained to my husband that he needed to come home because this guy was breaking stuff Daren (he) said if I said he was breaking things one more time he would start charging me $150 an hour and call the police to come do a report and charge me the entire time they were there so that I had to pay for saying that. Straight up extortion to not report my bad experience and threatening me with my husband on the phone! Not only horrible customer service but he flat out threatened me. Filing a BBB report.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: 30 years in business and never had a more difficult customer.

reviews.name: Jacob Pointon
reviews.text: 245 dollars..... 245.... My car was towed as I parked in front of my condo.. Picked up July 3rd ( closed the forth but answered the phone) charged a 5 % fee for using a debit card. Owner was too busy with a private phone call to even engage in conversation. A nightmare.

reviews.name: Josh Wayne
reviews.text: I had booked the driver Jose with Snap Towing through the roadside assistance feature on Allstate app. The informed me the cost of the tow was $66 more than my coverage which I was fine covering. After Snap was awarded the tow, the driver called to inform me it would not only be the extra $66 but there would be an additional $40 i would be charged so he could “cover the cost of gas to take his truck back to base”. He did this outside of the Allstate app via phone call which seemed fishy. After confirming with Allstate all I should expect to pay was the cost of the tow and not for his return trip, I declined his services when he didn’t wish to discuss whether that $40 was reasonable. If I had asked him to drive me to the middle of no where I wouldn’t be as upset, but towed to Orem from West Valley is not so far fetched or out of the way in my opinion.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Josh!
Thank you for your feedback. Requesting deadhead miles is a standard practice in our industry. Each company we partner with, like your insurance company in this case, has their own protocol. Sounds like the dispatcher knew what to request but made the request to the wrong person. That tells me he needs a refresher and more training. We apologize for the confusion and appreciate you reaching out.

reviews.name: Amy Montgomery
reviews.text: Service was excellent!  Price was great! Communication was the best I’ve had from a tow company. Very professional and quick. We had another tow company scheduled and 3 min before the scheduled time (30 min after calling for a tow) they postponed for an hour and 20 min later. 🤦🏽‍♀️ we cancelled service and called Snap. Have a price over the phone and stuck to that price. Was to my location quickly. Tow truck was nice, not beat up like some others. Sent verifying pic once the vehicle arrived to its destination. Would definitely call Snap again!!

reviews.name: Holly Roman
reviews.text: This company refuses to answer the phone. I can never get anyone to answer I had to wait multiple days to get my car back! This company is a scam! Called multiple time before 5pm and no one answered. Says 24 hours but obviously moneys more important then my bills!

reviews.name: Wyatt Dean
reviews.text: 10/10 experience, and overall great guy, owner picked up the phone and we had the car out in less than an hour super amazing guy, super helpful and professional. If you need towing I highly recommend them.

reviews.name: Mike Lisa Clarke
reviews.text: Our SUV became stranded on I-15 left of HOV lane, very dangerous spot. Ulises the owner of North State Towing quickly answered the phone and was on his way. He kept us updated often where he was which was very helpful. He had us get out of our vehicle and in his tow rig immediately for safety. He loaded our vehicle with care and got us home safely. Fantastic person, wonderful to chat with him. Highly recommend North State Towing and Ulises.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: thank you for this awesome feedback, this is my motivation to keep providing good customer services ,

reviews.name: Emma Christopherson
reviews.text:
My car broke down in the left turn lane of a busy intersection.
I panic googled and after getting a bunch of 'we're totally slammed' or 'we don't have anyone in the area', I came accross Ulises number.
He answered the phone quickly and gave an accurate and relatively speedy ETA. He called me when he was 5min out to confirm he was close, and was very kind through the whole process!
Highly recommend!

reviews.name: Xander Summers
reviews.text: Super fast and responsive on the phone. Got the job done fast and right the first time. Thank you again.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: thank you sir for choosing our team to help you with your vehicle.

reviews.name: Rick Johannes
reviews.text: Mark went out his way to help me find my phone that was lost in my car after an accident. Definitely went above and beyond since he wasn't the guy that towed my car.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Glad I could help.

reviews.name: Christopher Knorr
reviews.text:
Towing companies don't usually top the charts when it comes to businesses that people have fond opinions of. Any day you meet a tow truck is probably a bad day. That being said, JDK has some especially bad business practices.

Most towing companies will charge a storage fee to keep your car in their yard. That's fine, otherwise they'd just end up becoming a junkyard. JDK really goes the extra mile to make your life difficult with their hours, though. All their listed hours (at time of posting) are 8AM-5PM. Most people work those hours, so taking time off of work is tricky and ultimately results in more time that your car is sitting in their lot making them money while they do literally nothing. No one is at the yard during business hours, so they require you to call 30 minutes in advance so that someone will come unlock the gate (a further complication to encourage longer occupancy).

Here's the real kicker though: all their listed hours are wrong. They won't come unlock for you at 8. They'll claim to not be open until 9 if you talk to them on the phone. So, if that causes you to miss some work while you sit and drum your fingers, too bad for you. But great for them if you decide to try for a different day: that's just more money in their pocket.

Basically, towing companies are financially incentivized to make access to your towed vehicle as difficult as they can and to provide the worst customer service possible. All of these things are common among towing companies, to be sure, but among them JDK is King. I highly recommend them to anyone looking to lose a little extra money and waste some more of their precious time.

Oh, and if any police departments with contracts or business relationships read this: Drop JDK please. It reflects badly on you that these guys are your default business partners who you call up when responding to a crash. I'm sure there are more honest towing companies out there who deserve the business.

reviews.name: Nikki Corona
reviews.text: My husband hit an elk on his way to work at 3 in the morning while I was asleep and not answering my phone, Shep’s picked up and was in his way to tow our car before I even knew what had happened.  Fast, and easy to work with.

reviews.name: Justin Boylan
reviews.text: Kevin was quick to answer the phone when I needed a tow. Great service.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Glad we could help!

reviews.name: Rylee Reynolds
reviews.text: loved this place so much. they were so gentle with my car and with a reasonable price. so friendly on the phone and when picking up my car. i asked for a tow and they instantly got to my car the same day! would recommend to anyone who needs a tow!

reviews.name: Nathan Booda
reviews.text: The best experience I've seen. Marvin is very knowledgeable and easy to get to know. The woman on the phone was so polite, helpful and reassuring. Very affordable in a tight situation. 10 0ut of 10. Big murse towing for the win
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Nathan - Thank you for your wonderful review!

reviews.name: Beth Cadet
reviews.text: Great experience, great people, knowledgeable, fast & friendly! Even the girl who answered the phone was so kind and helped calm me down in a stressful situation. Thanks guys 10/10 recommend.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Beth - Thank you for the kind words and recommendation

reviews.name: Allyssa Fisher
reviews.text: My car was towed with this coming and they were really easy to work with. Talking with them over the phone was a little hard because we were on the side of the highway, so, the address they tried to bring the car to was a little off. But Kelly the driver called me to make sure he found the right house and that it was left in a good place.

reviews.name: Casen Lembke
reviews.text:
I literally had the best experience. They responded super fast! The customer service on the phone was so kind and I could tell they cared about my situation.

Very very helpful, would use them again.

reviews.name: Bryant Thacker
reviews.text: I've used this company for towing a few times, and have had no complaints. The most recent time, I called, they told me the price on the phone, I gave my location and they were there pretty fast. The 2 men who came got the car on quickly, we decided where to take it, I asked if they could drop me and my daughter off at my house which was not too far out of the way, and they did it. They were kind and we even had some small talk on our way to my house. The car got to where I needed it, I paid them and it was quick and easy. It is sad to see the negative reviews, especially when I had  great experience. Hopefully those who need to get their cars towed will consider them.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you so much for your nice review and for your support!

reviews.name: Kaylee Conlin
reviews.text: I would have given them 4 or 5 stars, overall, I feel like I had great service, but there was an incident, that makes me question it. Verns towed my vehicle to their shop. I was helped by Clint. I had sent the actual key, of the key fob so, I could lock the vehicle. There was another, fully working, key fob lost in the vehicle, at that time, you could just get in the vehicle and start it. I was leaving the vehicle to be towed so, I locked it with the physical key and hid it. They were told about the lost key and where to find the hidden key. I received a phone call an hour and a half or so to closing time, stating they weren’t able to “start” my vehicle, they tried and the vehicle said, “no key detected”. I knew this was an untrue statement (I had been starting the car, with the lost key, in the car, for over a week at that time) I decided to play along and say how that was crazy and is he sure, could he try again? He said, he tried a few times and nothing. He then wasn’t going to be able to get to my vehicle until possibly the next day when I couldn’t get him a key. Already dealing with an extremely stressful situation without a vehicle or transportation, I was frantic and wasn’t sure how I was going to get him a key on top of everything else at the time. I then called Clint back and reminded him, he had the physical key and he could just put it into the ignition! He called me back about 30 minutes later with a diagnosis. With clearly a “quick” diagnosis, why the run around for absolutely no reason?? I KNOW there was a working key that was in the vehicle at the time and it was a lie that it was saying, the key wasn’t being detected. It worked before I sent the car and worked after, as well as, worked for the next mechanic shop it went to. Again, why the run around?? Just makes me question, if they being fair and honest.

companies.name: Roadside Assistance Salt Lake City | Roadside Tech

reviews.name: James Peirce
reviews.text: We are dealing with my father’s car which would not jump start and needs to be moved by city request. I called Greg. He gave clear expectations of service on the phone, arrived promptly, and was delightful to work with. Highly recommended.

reviews.name: James Egan
reviews.text:
Rescue Rangers was the company initially assigned to respond to my request for roadside assistance through my insurance company, I spoke to representative on the phone to get a sense of how long I'd be waiting for someone to arrive. The representative was apathetic and unhelpful. He simply said he'd have the driver assigned to the case give me a call. I called a few more times over the next hour because no one responded. I ended up canceling my initial request for assistance to see if I could get another company assigned to my case.

Fortunately, Roadside Tech was assigned and they were great. They came within 20 minutes, which was shorter than the initial estimate, and quickly solved my problem. Call Greg at Roadside Tech, if you want to save yourself a headache.

reviews.name: Alec
reviews.text: The man who answers the phone number listed (maybe the owner) is a huge piece of work if you can even get him to answer. He was confused, angry and unpleasant. The woman who actually helped us was great.

reviews.name: Valerie Eastmond
reviews.text: I was so pleased with this company! My car broke down on my way from Tooele to West Jordan Advantage was very helpful and kind on the phone and arrived very promptly. I received exceptional service and would highly recommend this company.

reviews.name: kyle ehlers
reviews.text: The guy on the phone was completely rude I scheduled an appointment to get my truck and he just got a snippy with me for no reason

reviews.name: Shawn Whiting
reviews.text: My truck broke down on the side of the highway on a Saturday while towing my 33' Toyhauler.  I had called several differing towing services who said they couldn't pull both.  I call Beehive Towing and Josh answered the phone right away.  He didn't have any flatbeds available for a lengthy period of time, but came out with a regular tow truck. He was prompt and friendly and towed the truck to the repair shop, the trailer to its storage, and drove me to my home.  He was professional and charged a fair rate for service.  Great service!

reviews.name: Amy Zirneklis
reviews.text: Beehive towing has been called 5 times over the course of the last 8 hours to report two different vehicles parked in a no parking zone. Two times was the phone answered and one of the calls the representative was informed that this area is secondary to any other call that they will get and hung up in the mid-way through the call. His tone was harsh and demeanor, frankly, unprofessional.

reviews.name: Brooklyn Boehme
reviews.text:
I couldn’t have imagined worse customer service, I finally had to hang up on Rachel when she started yelling at me over the phone for asking for a video recording of the towing.
I was also told over the phone that “there are several signs all over the place” but I have pictures and videos of the area to prove otherwise. The immaturity and poor attitude of every employee I interacted with was appalling.

Phrases used by both Rachel and Kaden I’ll list here:

“I could have refused to release their car because of the way they acted.”

“I’m going to need you to give me your car keys for our protection.”

“I’m not give you the recording because it’s mine and I don’t want to.”

“It’s actually not your car, it’s your mom and dad’s car.”

“Asking me to send you a recording of the towing is the same as me asking you for a picture of your driver’s license or social security card.”

reviews.name: Cassandra Burns
reviews.text:
I'm sad giving 1 star is the lowest I can give. I had so many issues with this company that it's almost hilarious. If you are looking for a tow company, this is the last one you ever want to see. Save yourself some time, frustration, money and having to hold back the urge to strangle someone. Go with a different company. ANY other company is better than this one. And here's why.

For starters, we called an hour ahead of time to make sure someone would be there so we could pick up our car after accidentally leaving our car in a no overnight parking zone. So we called at 2pm, let them know that we would be there at 3pm and they said that would be fine. We got there just before 3:00 so we wouldn't keep them waiting. We waited for 35 minutes for them to even show up. The man claimed he got held up at another site which I was willing to believe if he didn't have a girl that he brought with him and was flirting with nonstop while we waited to get our car. After being made to wait after setting up an appointment and watching a man, who was suppose to be working, flirt with the girl he brought, we were so done. When we had called earlier they had informed us that they only take cash. It was $208 so we pulled $210 from our bank. We gave the man the cash expecting our $2 of change. He had nothing to break the $10 with. He didn't have $2 of change for the cash they told us to bring. Then he said it should have been exact cash that we brought. They did not say that on the phone and if they are a company that takes only cash, they should have the means to give change to a degree. They didn't have $2 dollars. so we thought, "okay, whatever. It's $2 we are fed up with these people, let's just leave." So we got our car and left. We got home and started trying to remove the writing on our windshield. That stuff wouldn't come off for anything!! Razor blade, Windex, acetone, nothing. It took a few hours to get the majority off by continual scraping and there's still some on there. I don't know what they used, but the car got towed at night and we picked it up in the afternoon, so it shouldn't have had too much time to bake on to the windshield.
Needless to say we were livid with these people. The towing and need to pay are normal and what we get for being parked in the wrong area at the wrong time. But having an appointment time and still waiting a half hour, getting crap for customer service, watching him flirt with his girl on the job, not getting change for the cash they say they only accept, and having to scrape at our windshield for hours just to have the majority of it removed is definitely not okay. I wish they had a customer service line I could call and have something done about their employee, Ken, who was the worst man we could have worked with and maybe got some sort of compensation for being made to wait for our appointment and most likely using the wrong material to mark our car (because it was definitely not normal windshield chalk) and for not having change on hand.

If I ever need a tow or any help with my car, they will be the absolute last on my list. I'd rather push my car 20 miles on my own then call them for even a 1 mile tow.

Absolutely the worst tow company out there. If there's an option of going with someone else, do yourself a favor and go with the other guys. It will save you a world of time, money, anger and frustration.

reviews.name: Fortune Service
reviews.text: We had a really bad experience with this couple. We called them up and were waiting a total of 7 hours for the service to be completed. They have like 2 companies: The Mobile Tire Guys and Roadrunner, who picks up the phone. The service wasn't completed correctly. After they were done, we tried to call them to discuss what our next step would be, but they are ignoring us and are no longer picking up the phone.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Sir I am sorry if our coolant delivery took a bit longer than you expected it to, however your complaint completely confuses the heck out of me because I have no clue what repair we didn't do correctly? First of all you called us at 433 pm and we left your site at 718pm. While that is longer than we like for our calls to take, it definitely wasn't 7 hours. Second, we were specifically asked to bring 6 gallons of coolant. What did I do? I delivered you 6 gallons of coolant. You must be the driver and not dispatch because dispatch only requested for the delivery which is why you were charged a discounted rate from our normal weekend rates for semi trucks. Typically for a road service call you are going to pay a callout fee plus a 2 hour minimum. Even if the service only takes 5 minutes to complete. I didn't charge you this minimum charge even though you were in the mountains. I literally charged you the cost of the coolant and a fee to bring it out there. So maybe you should get with your dispatch team and find out why they didn't ask for someone to come out and FIX your truck instead of just asking for a  delivery of coolant, which is the only thing they asked us to do. As a matter of fact we even suggested to you what the issue might have been and that at minimum you should replace your radiator reservoir cap. Did anyone want to do that? No. You just wanted to get on down the road instead of paying someone to actually repair your truck. I even told you that you needed more than that 6 gallons of coolant but you said it would be fine and you'd take care of it later.  Take better care of your truck and maybe you won't have these issues.  I'll be darned if I'm going to sit here and let you tell a bold faced lie about us not repairing something properly when we didn't repair it at all!!! That's not what we were called out there to do!! On top of that, we didn't receive a single call from you after we delivered the coolant. So I'm pretty certain you are confusing us with another company or maybe you were calling us from a different number, because I have no calls from your dispatch after we left. And if I didn't answer the phone to a number I didn't recognize, it's because we were too busy to take any further calls. If you're going to have to wait longer than 2 hours for us to show up I'm going to complete the calls I already have lined up and then call customers back to see if they still need assistance instead of having them wait forever on me and then leave a complaint like you did anyways.   Lastly Mobile tire guys is a  completely different company that we used to partner with, but no longer do for over a year now, so you really should get your facts straight before telling completely inaccurate and irrelevant information to people. If you're going to take the time to write a review, the least you could do is be truthful and not just pick and choose bits and pieces to tell someone. You literally didn't call us back a single time after we left. I suspect the reason that is the case is because we delivered the coolant you asked us to deliver and there were no next steps to be had other than the ones we suggested you all do while we were there. We literally took the time to come up and take a look at your truck when all we were hired to do is deliver coolant, yet you make a complaint on here like we were supposed to repair your truck for free apparently. You really think you would've paid someone as little as we were paid and they would come out and repair your semi truck for that small amount? You've got to be kidding.

reviews.name: Andy Zhao
reviews.text: They answered my phone call when nobody did. Came here as soon as they could and got the problem solved. I highly recommend them.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Andy. Glad you persisted calling "24hr companies" even though no others answered at all.  We're always here 24 7 365. If we don't answer we Will return your call asap. Car Lockouts, Jump starts,  battery delivery,  tire repairs/ replacements,  minor Mechanic work,  and yes even home Lockouts. If you ever need any of these again we will be here for you.  Thanks for being a great customer and we truly do appreciate your review.  It means the world to us. Take care!

reviews.name: amy atnip
reviews.text:
Terrible company!!! Call/wait for anyone else- you will save a lot of time and headache!
My daughter had a flat tire so I called around looking for a tow/roadside assistance company. They were the only ones I could get a hold of - should have been my first clue.
They said they would be there in 35 min and it would cost $65. When they got there they sent me a bill for $72.64.
The tech said that the stem was broken and that they would have to take the tire to their shop to fix it. I asked, "Can you just tow it to a tire shop?" Their response was, "Oh it will be much faster if we fix it and it will only take 2 hours." (This was at 7:46 pm).
I asked, "How much it will cost" Their reply was $129. Again I asked for them to take it to a tire shop and just leave it there for the morning.

At 9:18 Pm I received a bill for $149.35, I paid it thinking that they were done and that my daughter could pick up the car. My daughter waited up all night to get a notification that is was done, but nothing. I texted them at 11:41 pm and they texted back that the phone had died and they were still working on the valve.
I texted them saying It would have been better to take it to a tire shop.
I received a text at 2:20 am saying they will have it done first thing in the morning. And that this is still faster than a tow.
7:23 am asked them if they were able to fix it?
Tried to call at 8:24 am.
My daughter finally got a text at 10:39 am (not first thing in the morning) stating that the car was done.
Apologized for the "delay" and that they couldn't text us back because their phone was "lost"- how did they text me and tell me it was dead?

By the time they put the tire back on the car my daughter had to walk to pick it up because her friends were working or in class, AND the car was dead!!
ALSO the air pressure gauge is still on!!!
IF they would have taken it to a tire shop -like I asked several times it would have cost $15!!!!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
Ma'am I sincerely apologize.  As I explained to Emily we literally couldn't have gotten it done any faster.  The reason I didn't answer your calls is because I had lost my phone hence the reason when we reached out to you it wasn't from the original number we'd been talking to you on. .  I literally didn't find it until sometime between 1 and 3. Anyways again I do apologize.  We're there any other companies available to help Emily? No.  Did she receive the help she requested to the best of anyone's ability at that point?  Yes. When I got to the parts store they told me the wrong information as they also did over the phone.  Long story short by the time all was said and done O'Reilly told us that the sensor we purchased (which i didn't even charge you for)  "didn't say that it didn't fit Emily's vehicle," which according to them meant "it fits."  Actually that was not correct.  So by the time we FINALLY  got the sensor as well as a few others "just in case" as I knew parts wouldn't be open if we ran into an issue, and then got ahold of our typical tire guy that handles manually breaking the bead, he didn't want to work.  So my husband and I literally  text you after midnight once we saw it wasn't the right sensor.  
 The only option was to order a new one in which was quoted as a 3-4  day wait.  I honestly can't apologize enough and I'm truly not trying to just make excuses but we did the best that we could with what was available.  We got her vehicle moving again which wasn't able to be done when we arrived. So yes it took Alot longer than what it should've but between my hubby getting out of the hospital icu the day before nearly needing a blood transfusion and me having a 103.5 degree fever there wasn't any logical way for us to get it done sooner. I've fired my tire guy as this is the second time he's left us stranded knowing we had a customer relying on us.  Thankfully your daughter wasn't sitting in her car waiting all this time.  I had told her it would be at least a couple of hours because we have to do it by hand and wanted to show up earlier than expected after dealing with the parts store.  
Maybe I misunderstood but I never heard you ask us to tow her anywhere.  If I had I would've told you that we don't offer towing services.  Only soft services. 
Lastly you were quoted the price we charged you. The"extra" is tax. If you are tax exempt is be happy to refund the tax with the proper tax-exempt info.
No open tire shops to tow her to so why drop it off with no valve stem in it, leaving her stranded?That wouldn't have been fair to her especially after all that waiting.  Regardless how long it takes us to repair something for a customer we go above and beyond what ANY normal person would put themselves through in making sure that our customers aren't stranded without their vehicle and need to go to someone else.   Considering the point we were at it wouldn't be right nor fair to tell her to pay a tow truck in the am,  so we competed what we started. 

Again I honestly can't stress how very sorry I am that it took so long but had yall not used us you'd have been waiting for the car for 3 days unless you were able to run down that exact sensor.  Considering the parts stores couldn't help, you'd be paying dealership prices.   Maybe a long wait but she drove off today.  So I'm sorry but hope this proves how much pressure we're able to take on making CERTAIN our customers vehicle was drivable when we left. 
If that's "terrible service" then maybe I should stop doing my job and just let others get towed. Had you had any questions or if you have any questions you're more than welcome to call me anytime about this.  Would've actually been nice to be able to explain everything to you before getting completely blasted in a review like I just stole the money and didn't do anything.  

Regardless she'd have been stuck all night without the vehicle.  Thankfully she was safe and at home. 
 Hope you have a blessed day.

reviews.name: Repairs Dispatch
reviews.text: Do not call them, they are liars, 45min for them is 6h, on top of that worst tech ever, maybe good for bicycles. They charge us $1248 but truck broke down after 3 miles, we had to pay for another road service because thy don't answer the phone
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Hi , we apologize that you are disappointed with your unlucky situation. We directly asked you  what do you  want us to do for you. #1 come up to your  driver in the mountains and assess why the semi broke down ..or #2 go up there at 2am past echo canyon and fix the broken part that your  driver is saying is the problem?? And you  chose #2 because you needed that truck back on the road asap. You said you lost enough time already and you  need that driver going... and on toP of that their was radiator fluid all over the engine bay and you  told us don't  worry about that, and the 3 really bad tires on the semi we showed you  metal sticking thru the rubber and you  again  said no please  just fix the problem I sent you  out for... so we do hope that you  learn the difference  between a broken part !! And the cause of the broken part because knowing the difference will cause you less headaches in the end...I could post the photos and the videos I took on the job but for now we will be grown up about  fixable issues and not be petty. When you called us back because your driver had broken down again in West Valley City which is surely more than 3 miles from the other side of Parleys in Echo, we told you guys that we had gotten another call and were working on a tire change and would be happy to come assist you with the new issue you stated you were having but you'd have to wait until we completed the job we were currently working on at the Wyoming border. You chose to call someone in town to come assist you which is your prerogative. So don't pretend like we just weren't willing to come out. However don't blame us when we did what you asked us to do. You even got 1.5 hours of labor that you weren't charged for yet you're still unhappy with the solution provided. You asked us specifically to repair the fuel line. The clip had broken and we did exactly that , replaced the fuel line onto a new clip. You didn't want us assessing any issues. You made that very clear. If you wanted us to determine all issues that needed repairing you should've stated so when we asked,  instead of ignoring every recommendation we made. I am sorry that you feel like you didn't receive 5 star service as we strive to always provide one. If you want something fixed properly in the future, I'd recommend allowing the professionals to do their job instead of telling them what you want done based on what your driver tells you is the problem, or you'll continually have issues like these. We can't make you fix everything we can only make suggestions. Its ultimately up to you whether to fix them or not. Lastly the only thing that took so long was waiting on the International Parts Store to open. How do you expect us to repair your vehicle if we don't have the parts required to do so? We're sorry for your frustration but one must be able to accept their own fault in certain problems rather than trying to make another company look bad for their own decisions . Hope you have better choices made in the future. And good luck to you.

reviews.name: Nick Siddoway
reviews.text: We just got off the phone with quite the smart alec employee. We were asking for a quote to tow a vehicle from my finance’s parents over to an auto shop. Being people that still have common sense, we knew we had to let the company know the address. The employee answering the phone was short, rude, and overall unprofessional. This first interaction will be the last. This job was going to go to a family mechanic that uses your services very frequently. Guess we will have to let them know how they treat their customers. Quite the shame. The kicker of this entire situation, we were on the call for 60 seconds. 60 seconds is a short time to lose your patience on a customer. With all the choices of towing companies in Utah, DON’T choose this one.

companies.name: A.J's Custom Body & Paint and Towing

reviews.name: Marcy Schroeder
reviews.text: My roadside assistance contacted them for a me. After 2 hours I called them but they claimed no one contacted them for a tow. Called my insurance company back. Less then 10 mins after I got off the phone with AJ’s they notified my insurance company they went out to tow me and I wasn’t there. When my insurance company tried to call them back they wouldn’t answer the phone.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Marcy, i have looked into this and we didn't receive a call about towing you until you called. We didn't receive a call from your roadside assistance. We apologize about this, we never want to leave anyone on the side of the road. We take our service seriously and strive to be quick in our response. We apologize again.

reviews.name: Bolinas Road
reviews.text: These guys are amazing. We were traveling from out of town coming through Price towards Colorado and had a deer vs us accident which took out four of the windows on our van as well as did a significant amount of body damage. I called AJs at 10:30 at night thinking I was going to leave a message and Joe answered the phone. He had me come in the next morning and took care of me right away. I did not have time to wait for the van to be repaired and since it was drivable he helped me find someone near my destination that could service me as well as secured my windows enough for me to safely get back on the road. Really nice helpful people at this shop. I was super shaken up when I got there and they made me feel so much better and I cannot thank them enough. They really went out of their way to take care of us. Highly recommend.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you so much for your kind words. We were so glad to meet you and help you. Those dang deer can ruin a trip in a hurry. We pray everything goes well for you on your way to Telluride and then onto Oregon.

reviews.name: Julie Barnson
reviews.text: My daughter and her brand new husband got stranded on the way to their honeymoon when their alternator broke.  They called seven other towing companies, and found out that while all of them said they had 24 hour service, none of them answered their phone.  Finally looking for tow trucks in Price, 45 miles away, AJ answered.  He came and got them at 3am.  He fixed the car before they were even awake the next morning, brought the car to them at the hotel they found, and left an envelope with  a congratulations on their wedding.  He had a scout activity early that morning, and needed his sleep, but he took the time out to take good care of the newlyweds.  Thank you, AJ!!!

reviews.name: Lauren BV
reviews.text: Our clutch gave out almost 40 miles out of town. After a harrowing phone call with the insurance (the only good thing being the towing company they hired), the towing was an immense relief. Ike was kind and helpful with giving us advice on the car, and we had a lovely conversation. He then informed us that the mechanic selected by the insurance is shut down and took us to a local mechanic with great reviews. He also offered to drive us to the motel. Such a great way to ease the pain of a highway breakdown.

reviews.name: Justin kidd
reviews.text: Thanks a whole Bunch to Chris and the guys at Smokin J Diesel! These guys were lifesavers! We were in Price Utah for a Mountain Bike Race when we Broke a Leaf Spring on Our 5th Wheel Camp trailer. It was 6 o’clock pm on a Saturday night and they answered there phone. They were so helpful, they gave me the address to there shop told me where I could leave it for the weekend and said they would have it fixed up 1st thing Monday morning. Chris was great and so friendly when I picked up the trailer! Work was fast Professional and just Perfect! Thanks to Chris and crew!! Definitely recommend these guys!

reviews.name: Mallory Averett
reviews.text:
Was passing by a trucker in need, stopped by to see if I could help, driver needed to get down to phone service.   Once we got down to cell phone service called these guys, hands down best customer service!

Thanks guys!

reviews.name: Robin L Freeborn
reviews.text: The bill is close to the amount paid for the vehicle. That is robbery. Quoted a price that was reasonable until we showed to pick it up. And still doesn't run. Took two days to limp it 4 hours to home. Could have had it towed for so much cheaper. The price quoted over the phone was a blatant lie. This is a price gouging and a swindling crook. Avoid this business at all costs. I am reporting it to the BBB I guess because the sheer amount of indignity. Horrific.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Robin we are sorry to hear about your poor experience, we made a phone call during your service visit regarding the cost, letting you know what we were into the project, we’re given the go ahead to keep going with work.  We also made him very aware that the motorhome was not going to make it to its destination. It had major issues. Which were clearly communicated.

reviews.name: Glenn Leewright
reviews.text: 24/7 means 24/7 with these guys. I blew a radiator on a Friday night and limped into their shop Saturday morning after having a phone call with the owner who assured me that if I needed a radiator they would make it happen!  They did!  Nothing is cheap on these big rigs but I feel they treated me very fairly. I am happy to have made their acquaintance and will definitely use them again if needed. Eli and the guys did an awesome job for me and got me back on the road!

reviews.name: Beccy Bingham
reviews.text: really quick and easy process to get an abandoned vehicle off of our property. They didn't answer their phone for me but I got a text and was able to work through their steps on my phone and it was great! Car was gone the next day

reviews.name: Zach Ashton
reviews.text: Zero stars if I could. They towed me cuz I wasn’t in the right spot. That’s on me. But when I went to pick up my car they gave me a time, then were 40 minutes late. Then he parked on the other side of the parking lot and made me walk to him. Then the check out process took about 20 minutes. And he was on a personal call the entire time. Then he took a picture of my credit card with all the numbers visible (I understand now that my name needs to be on the card, but you absolutely do not need the cvv) on a personal phone and sent it in a text. I get that you have no incentive to please your “customers,” but at least be decent people

reviews.name: Patrick hervey
reviews.text:
Lone Star Towing moves faster than a teenager discovering incognito mode.

I parked at 11:59 PM. My baby was being born. A literal human was exiting another human. I ran inside, screamed “It’s crowning!” and 30 seconds later, Lone Star was outside screaming, “It’s towing!”

By the time I cut the cord, they’d already cut the parking violation ticket, hooked my car like it was their high school crush, and dragged it away with the passion of someone who gets a little too excited about chains and tight spaces.

Called their office to explain the whole "new life entering the world" thing. The woman on the phone had the empathy of a brick wall and the voice of someone who probably yells “I’m just doing my job” during awkward Tinder dates.

Look, I get it — rules are rules. But y’all towed me with the urgency of someone trying to win America’s Next Top Sociopath.

If pettiness were an Olympic sport, Lone Star would be on the podium, wrapped in a Texas flag, making out with my impounded Corolla.

Would not recommend — unless you’re into domination, humiliation, and paying $325 to walk home from the maternity ward.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Patrick,

We’ve read some creative reviews in our time, but this one may take the cake — or at least the AI-generated trophy. If this was written with ChatGPT, well played. If not, and this was all you, then we salute your future in fiction writing.

As for the towing: our team enforces the rules set by the property owners we work for. We don’t tow out of spite or speed-rush competitions — just timing, clear signage, and standard procedures.

If a real baby was born in the middle of all this, congratulations. If not, it still made for an entertaining read.

– Lone Star Towing

reviews.name: Richard Zambrano
reviews.text:
TONIGHT ON JULY 4 THIS COMPANY WAS TOWING CARS FROM ALL AROUND FREEDOM BOULEVARD AND UNIVERSITY PARKWAY  NOW I BEEN GOING TO THESE PLACES FOR 5 YEARS ON A ROW I HAVE NEVER SEEN  ANY TOW COMPANY TOWUNG CARS ON JULY 4 MAKING OUR CELEBRATION DAY A NIGHTMARE THEY NEVER LEFT A PHONE NUMBER OR SOMETHING TO CONTAXT THEM WITH  THESE PEOPLE ARE BAD PEOPLE WE GOT BACK TO FIND OUR CAR WASNT THERE NOT MORE LIKE WE ALWAYS DO . THEY WERE TAKING ADVANTAGE OF THE HOLLIDAY TO MAKE MONEY FROM POOR AMERICANS .PATHETIC WORTHLESS COMPANY YOU GUYS SHOULD BE ASHAMED OF THE COMPANY YOU RUN BECAUSE YOU GUYS ARE INSIULTING AMERICANS BY DOING THIS NASTY JOB ON A JULY 4 .THEY SAY ITS CLOSED TODAY JULY 4 BUT NOPE I HAVE VIDEO TO PROVE THEY  WERE HARRASING PEOPLE WHO WAS ENJOYING THE 4 OF JULY . NASTY RATS...

REGARDING YOUR RESPONSE THE CAR THAT WAS TOWED WAS PARKED ON THE PARKING LOT OF AMERICA FIRST THERE WASN'T ANY GUEST OR  PEOPLE TRYING TO ACCESS THE BANK ON THAT HOLLIDAY  I AM SURE YOU GUYS WERE JUST DRIVING AROUND MAKING EASY MONEY THAT DAY BECAUSE YOU GUYS WERE LOVING IT AND ALSO YOU WERE THE ONLY TOWING COMPANY DRIVING BACK AND FIRTH THAT DAY .
LIKE THERE WAS NOT TOMORROW SO DONT GIME ME THAT EXCUSE ABOUT HOTELS BECAUSE THE ONE I SAW YOU.GUYS TAKING WAS FROM THE AMERICA DIRST PARKING LOT AND THE BANK WAS CLOSED THAT DAY .
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
Thank you for your feedback, and we’re genuinely sorry that your celebration was interrupted. Our team was indeed called out on July 4th by a local hotel, whose paying guests were unable to park due to others using their lot without permission—likely attending the same event you were. Our drivers, too, spent the holiday away from their families to uphold parking agreements and ensure spaces were available for the hotel’s actual guests. Signs at the entrance clearly state that it’s reserved for hotel parking, so anyone celebrating nearby would hopefully understand this.

We’d encourage you and others attending public events to use designated parking options to avoid future surprises. Our goal isn’t to disrupt holidays but to honor the agreements made with our clients who rely on us to keep their parking available for those it’s intended for.

reviews.name: lisa Draper
reviews.text: They were very unhelpful. Did not tell us over the phone cash only was accepted. Had to drive all the way back into town to get cash. Will nickel and dime everything.  Once we came back with cash, then told us it had to be exact. Strange how a place that deals with cash only, is unable to make change. Make sure you have a witness with you for all transactions with this business!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
Thank you for sharing your concerns. I’d like to clarify a few details regarding your experience.

Firstly, while our company shares office space with the repossession company, we were not the ones who repossessed the vehicle. It seems there may be some confusion regarding which company is responsible, and I encourage you to ensure any online reviews are directed to the correct business.

Regarding storage fees, our company, like most in the state, adheres to DOT guidelines and charges $40 per day for storage. I’m not sure why they offered you a discount, but I did hear him mention that he was only charging you $20, which seems like a pretty good deal.

The repossession company made an exception in your case by scheduling the release on short notice to help avoid further storage fees, which is not typically done without 24-hour notice.

Again, while we were not directly involved in the repossession or payment process, we hope this helps clarify some of the concerns. If you have further questions, we recommend addressing them with the company that handled the repossession directly.

reviews.name: Jamie King
reviews.text: Was towed while moving into an apartment. The gentleman on the phone spoke about their driver several times. Come to find out that he was the driver. Even in person he referred to himself as the driver. Same exact voice smh. Definately preditiory and there are ZERO signs nor information in the paperwork about the tow company.

reviews.name: Kira James
reviews.text:
My daughter recently had a car towed that was registered in both her father's and my name. Like many young people, she was nervous to tell us at first lol but eventually realized she needed to contact us after learning that Swift would only release the vehicle to the registered owner.

Ingrid made the whole experience surprisingly positive. She was kind, upbeat, and made us laugh with her fun personality. Jeremy was also incredibly helpful over the phone, answering all of my questions with patience and professionalism.

Towing cars and dealing with customers isn’t an easy job, but both Ingrid and Jeremy made it a smooth and pleasant experience. I truly appreciate their help, and my daughter has definitely learned her lesson (lol)!

reviews.name: Hayley Baker
reviews.text:
RUDE!!!!
My issue is not that my car was towed. That is my own fault for not seeing the signage. My issue is the service I received.
We went in, cash in hand, ready to pay. We get up and we realize that the car was registered in my significant other’s father’s name. We saw this on their sign in the front. The person at the counter was EXTREMELY rude. Saying “I told this to you over the phone” they did not. When I explained this to him he just said “giving me an attitude won’t get your car back”. I walked out and slammed the door. What kind of company allows their workers to talk to customers in that way. Mind you, customers who are having a pretty crappy day.
On my significant others return with their dad, the person at the counter made a remark completely unprovoked saying “oops don’t want to piss this one off again”.
We both left the office of this company in tears not because of the car but because of the service. I advise anyone going in not to say a word at all because chances are, these workers will make fun of you, be incredibly rude, condescending, and overall terrible people.

reviews.name: Mecha Wilde
reviews.text:
If I could give zero stars, I would.

Swift Towing operates with zero room for error—any misunderstanding or mistake, even unintentional, and they’ll tow your car without warning. Their signage is extremely specific, but that doesn't mean the process is fair or transparent.

In my case, my truck was towed under the claim that it didn’t have a parking pass, even though it did. The issue? I was misinformed (not maliciously) about which pass was which—there’s one for opening the garage door and another for actual parking, and apparently, you're supposed to have both visible. My truck had been parked there on and off for almost exactly two weeks with no prior notice or warnings. They never left a single note or tried to contact me before towing it.

Calling them was even worse. I had basic logistical questions, but the person on the phone was incredibly rude and dismissive. One of the reps even told me I didn’t deserve to have my truck back because I “obviously don’t care about it.” Seriously? That’s not just unprofessional—it’s cruel.

To make matters worse, when they towed my manual truck, they disengaged the parking brake and didn’t put it back on when they dumped it in their yard. They’re extremely lucky they parked it on level ground and that the wind didn’t pick up, or that could’ve turned into a dangerous situation.

Swift Towing doesn’t care about your vehicle, your time, or the risk they put others in. If your apartment complex is contracted with them, be extremely cautious. I wouldn’t trust them to tow a toy car, let alone a real one.

reviews.name: Stetson Gagne
reviews.text: Had my vehicle towed due to my own negligence unfortunately but the guy on the phone was very helpful and to the point of what was needed and how much it would be. We set the appointment and the driver was on time and very easy to deal with to get my vehicle out of their yard.

reviews.name: Ralph Vernor
reviews.text: This is not the phone number for the Utah associated towing, I called and they are some call center. Make sure you are calling the real Associated towing in Midvale Utah to avoid any issues.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you Ralph for this review!  We have been in contact with Google the number has been changed back to our number. The 801-816-0555 sorry for any inconvenience hope we can help you in the future.

reviews.name: Carson Passey
reviews.text: I was in a multiple car accident on the freeway during rush hour.  The office personnel kept me on the phone and careful helped me give them the directions. I was a little shocked and wasn’t able to communicate efficiently.  Their driver Troy also called and made sure I was ok.  Troy is a expert driver and has driven professionally for over 30 years. He helped me move the car, made sure we didn’t leave any parts behind and then helped with the paperwork.  Professional outfit and a professional crew.  I am just glad I called them!!

companies.name: Orem Auto Towing | First Aid Towing

reviews.name: Wade Gray
reviews.text: Armando was quick, efficient and safe.  He arrived soon after I called, was polite, gave me pricing over the phone and was true to his word.  He even turned the truck around so the drop off was facing the right way on the street.  I would recommend his services.

reviews.name: Terina Silva-Lavulavu
reviews.text: Armando was quick and friendly.  He gave me a flat price over the phone which was about $30 less than the competitors.  I'll use First Aid Towing again, thank you!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you!

reviews.name: Kate Beeson
reviews.text: Armando was courteous, timely, professional and a good guy. He quoted me 20 minutes when we spoke on the phone and arrived in almost exactly that time frame. My car was loaded quickly and efficiently and he found an even closer shop than I had had in mind when he arrived. I rode with him and my car and he drove safely and courteously making small talk the whole way. My only complaint is that he couldn't bill my insurance so I had to pay him and submit the receipt for reimbursement but that hassle is small overall when I consider the great service I received. Highly recommend.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for your referral.

reviews.name: Jd Tueller
reviews.text: Armando picked up my call on the first ring and arrived to tow my vehicle within the time frame he estimated. He communicated well via text and phone and was very friendly. It’s also a plus that they accept Venmo payments.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you!

reviews.name: Michael Zaro
reviews.text:
Armando was great. He answered the phone right away, showed up fast, and took care of me for a good price.

Hope I don't lock myself out again, but if I do, I'd give him a call first.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you!

reviews.name: Joe Dawg
reviews.text:
I am a big rig trucker. I was pulled out of service at the weigh station on US 6 near Price Utah because of wear to some very serious high pressure air lines located under the rig.

I called Chris at Landon and he was attentive to my problem right on the phone. Within thirty minutes he sent out a young, very sharp tech, I believe his name is Brent. This kid was smart, very polite, and highly knowledgeable about my repair issues. He knocked them out very fast and efficiently, signed off my DOT violation and had me on my way for a very fair price that included their mobil service and mileage.

These guys at Landon are now my “go to guys” whenever I’m in the area.

Hats Off!

reviewContext.Services: General repairs & maintenance, Service not listed

reviews.name: Liz Flanery
reviews.text:
Gene!  you are a gentleman and such professional kind,safe driver, your dispatch person who answered the phone was equally awesome.
Thank you for all you do and dealing with things and people that some  don't appreciate.
I will always call you first if I ever need tow services.
Thank you

reviews.name: Ethan Vincent
reviews.text: I've never had a faster or more efficient tow experience! Broke down on I-215, they were there within 20 minutes. In the past, I've had frustrating tows because of phone tag, bad phone service, etc. We were able to do a lot of the communication over text and I shared my location directly. It made everything really easy. The price was also literally half of what I've paid in the past. These guys do good, quick and honest work.

reviews.name: summerlyn B
reviews.text: I am a single mom and due to my daughter's car going out unexpectedly, and us being new to the area, it left me feeling a bit unsettled. I got the phone number to High Point Towing from a friend and I am so glad I did. Jorge was nothing less than amazing, he went out of his way to help us and went above and beyond, and for a price that was far less than anything else we had quoted. It is so refreshing to find a company that gives grade a service without costing a fortune. I don't ever leave reviews but I felt that I really needed to give this company a shout out. Thank you High Point Towing thank you Jorge!!

reviews.name: hannah rands
reviews.text: I was a little nervous on the phone but this business is very fast and friendly.  i got my car towed next day with no stress. They were on time and friendly and sent photos of the car safely at its destination. Lots of piece of mind going with these guys. No extra surprise charges either. Happy all around with this business

reviews.name: J.R. Wilson
reviews.text: These guys are on the ball. One phone call and there less than 30 minutes. Towed right to my house without any damage. Tow truck driver was polite and assisted professionally. Use these guys for sure!

companies.name: C and T Auto Body and Repair

reviews.name: D J
reviews.text: I have gone in multiple times and have filled out multiple forms describing what I need fixed and requesting a call back as to the cost yet have never received a single call which has lead me to doing the work myselfand making mistakesthat couldhave and should have been prevented if I just got a phone call. The only reason it's three stars is cause the guys at the shop are personable. The lady who's supposedly incharge of scheduling things on the other hand, never calls and is hardly ever in the office even if it's the middle of the day.

reviews.name: Amy Mac
reviews.text: i cannot say enough good about C and T Towing , particularly Jake , who rescued me and my vehicle on a remote mountain pass where we were stuck in deep mud and snow. He was calm, reassuring and knew exactly what to do in what was - for me-  a very stressful experience. In the dark, he rigged up a 3-part tow, after driving 2 hours on a very muddy and dangerous road. After a quick 20-minute job, he escorted us 16 miles to the highway and we settled up at a very reasonable rate. I have saved C and T's info in my phone and it will be my first call when I need help when  in the Price area. I would recommend this company to anyone and in fact, already have. Thanks again, Jake, take care!

companies.name: Bailout Tow and Transportation, Light and Heavy Duty Towing

reviews.name: Ari Ioannides
reviews.text: I tried to fill out a request on the web site and did not get an answer, but when I called they were helpful and on time. They also have an easy way to pay using your smart phone
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Unfortunately we don’t always get them via email, but so glad you reached out and had a good service. Thank you so much

reviews.name: Tishara Gray
reviews.text: They were very nice and professional. Answered the phone quickly.

reviews.name: Janine Jorgensen
reviews.text:
I called on a Friday even trying to be towed back to Salt Lake.
They answered their phone in a timely manner, gave a quote and gave me estimated time to arrive. No bullshit

They score 5☆☆☆☆▪︎

Very professional and care service.
I will definitely use this service from Jake's again with needs to be towed.
Thanks again Jake's Towing your are the best!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: We truly appreciate your support and are honored to be your go-to towing service. We're always here for you when you need us. Thank you!

reviews.name: James Stephenson
reviews.text: Jake is super friendly and helpful. I needed an immediate tow and even though he was not available, he made phone calls for me and found me someone who could help for a great rate. I would suggest Jake for anyone in trouble on the side of the road.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you, James!

reviews.name: Daisey Navarro
reviews.text:
I highly recommend working with Jake’s Towing!
I called for quotes and chose them because they were polite and had good customer service over the phone. The quotes I received were the same else where, so pricing is fair. I had multiple issues with where to  park my broken down vehicle and they were extremely kind and helpful with a spot to park it for a few days. They went above and beyond for me and I appreciate it so much. Will definitely use them again when needed in the future! Big thanks to Scott especially!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the kind words, Daisey!

reviews.name: Tyffiney Snow-Woods
reviews.text: My Nissan Pathfinder broke down and I didn’t know who to call. I saw a few different tow companies listed and called Jake’s. Not only did they answer their phone quickly they were professional and happy to provide a quote with basic information on where the car was and where it needed to go.  I had to wait for my husband to finish his appointment but that didn’t bother them.  I called them back and let them know where we were at and they arrived within 20 minutes. Hooked the car up and towed it to the auto shop of our choice. They are Professional, Courteous, Friendly, and I will support them in the future.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for trusting your vehicle with us.  We appreciate you!

reviews.name: Justina Sullivan
reviews.text: They picked up the phone after one ring and got me a quote right away!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for the kind review we love our customers

reviews.name: YourProudDad
reviews.text: Casey and his wife are fantastic. They picked up the phone right away (at 4ish am), no fuss, efficient, just flat out positive. When you’re out at Dugway it’s hard to find a place that will commit to a tow.. but I can think of nobody better I would depend on than Hauling Ace Towing. 🙂
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the great review of our towing company! Glad Casey and the team were able to provide you a hassle-free solution for your tow, especially at that hour. It's awesome to hear we're your go-to choice when you need help out there!

reviews.name: Khan
reviews.text:
Thomas arrived at the wrong location for a tow set up a day in advance. I gave him the benefit of the doubt and still treated him professionally and respectfully. He then layed all of the blame for his mistake on me, responded aggresively over the phone insulting me and my ability to do my job, and then refused to complete the tow before hanging up on me.

I forwarded all of the same information for the tow to another local company and they quickly arrived to the right place and got the job done.

reviews.name: MARCEY MOODY
reviews.text: I would never use this place of business.  I've never had someone talk so rudely to me over the phone.

reviews.name: Nathan Heaton
reviews.text: I waited for 2 1/2 hours for my truck to get towed and not one phone called to let me know they ran into some problems. They referred me to another company ended up waiting another 2 1/2 hours to have another company come what a great day sitting in a parking lot because somebody cannot call and let you know that they’re not coming

reviews.name: brian whittaker
reviews.text: Was towing my boat up sheep creek road to Strawberry yesterday and about 3/4 of the way there lost the hub on the boat trailer and entire wheel came off.  It was undrivable and needed a tow. I had enough cell service to make phone calls and called Larry's Towing. They said to send pictures of the boat to make sure they send the right size trailer/equipment.  Unable to text the pictures due to poor cell service.  Called her back with actual measurements of the boat and trailer.  She informed me that the manager was insisting we send pictures or they could not send a tow truck.  I explained to her that we were "in the wilderness" and could try to email them, but the texts would not go through.  She was insistent that if we did not send pictures, even though they had exact measurements, they would not send a tow truck.  My wife explained to her again we were "in the wilderness" "in the middle of a lane of traffic" without the ability to move the trailer as it had no wheel and was dragging and sparking on the road.  Also explained to her we had tried calling other tow companies and they did not have a big enough flat bed and told us to call Larry's.  The rep at Larry's continued to repeat "the manager said we have to have pictures to send a tow truck."  My wife said to her in tears "so you will not send a tow truck if the pictures will not go through due to poor cell service out in the wilderness?"  She answered yes.  We were left totally stranded.  After 2 1/2 hours of waiting on the road trying to figure out what to do, a family member suggested Heber Valley Towing, we called and they were there in an hour and got us home, charging less than Larry's too.  Totally dismayed and disgusted at the treatment we received from Larry's Towing who totally left us stranded.  Will never attempt to call them again...totally worthless.

reviews.name: Brandon
reviews.text: Very fair price. The nice lady on the phone was very kind and helpful, and the tow arrived shortly afterward. Wonderful service.

reviews.name: Ismael Ruiz
reviews.text: Answered the phone good. People

reviews.name: Makayla Dahl
reviews.text: Called for a quote ( this is my 9th towing qoute of the day) first off, best price so far but more importantly they were so friendly and human, they had joy in their voice rather then the 8 other monotone blah blah blah phone calls before! Thank you so much for treating me like a human and not just another annoying call!!!!!

reviews.name: Janea Elizabeth
reviews.text: These people do a phenomenal job at making sure you are satisfied! My favorite employee by far is Kevin Rafferty, i had a very long and bad day, and he made a bad day a good day when he towed my car a few days ago! Nobody else would pick up their phone, i was fired from my job and it was just one bad thing after another! He saved the day!

reviews.name: Stephen Aldridge
reviews.text: I had rushed into Salt Lake to pick up a birthday present for my son and on the way home stopped to use the restroom at a Maverik and at that point my car wouldn't start. After calling multiple tow shops in the Saratoga Springs/Lehi area for quotes I called ZNL Towing and was blown away by his price. Way lower than any others. (Some of the others were more than twice his price!) I get it; Things cost money and towing has never been cheap but I was so grateful I found ZNL. He gave me a price over the phone, confirmed where the car was and where it was going, picked it up when he said he would, texted me photos of my car when he picked it up--I had to go home because it was my son's birthday-- and he delivered it right into my garage. He was professional and radiating a good attitude. He's the kind of guy that just makes you smile no matter how your day has been. I could not have asked for better. He truly turned a stressful experience into a good one. I paid him via Venmo and sent him on his way with a warm handshake and big slice of birthday cake. Thank you, Sir!

reviews.name: Jackalope 86
reviews.text: My experience with ZNL has not been a pleasant one. They are flakey, make endless excuses, change pick up times, ignore phone calls and in the end didn't show up at all. I spent my evenings at home more than once waiting on them to show, only to be disappointed and forgotten. Need a tow truck? Call someone else.

reviews.name: Caycee Brown
reviews.text: This was by far one of the best towing experiences I have ever had. Our vehicle broke down after hours on a holiday weekend and most places were quoting us excessive amounts of money and wait times to be able to pick us up. After one phone call to this company, we had a reasonable estimate and less than a 1 hour wait time. The gentleman who helped us was exceptionally friendly and extremely well-versed. He was helpful and went above and beyond to make sure that we felt well taken care of. It truly has been quite a while since I have had such exemplary service from any company. I will be using this towing company for many years to come. Thank you for all of your help that night!

reviews.name: Patrick Madden
reviews.text: Nobody wants to need a tow, but if you ever do, ZNL will be perfect for the job. Walmart drained our transmission fluid instead of our oil, then they put in a full 7 quarts of oil on top of what they didn't drain, so it was really bad news for our engine. Latu got there within 15 minutes of my call, hooked the car up quickly, and got us to the dealership just in time before they closed. Not only that, he was friendly, sympathetic, and personable during the drive there. Now I just have to file all the paperwork so Walmart will pay to fix what they messed up (so, yeah, I don't recommend Walmart's oil changes, but that's another story). But as for towing, I actually saved Latu's number in my phone so I have it whenever we need a tow next time. I highly recommend ZNL Towing.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Happy to serve thank you for choosing our service!

reviews.name: Nile River
reviews.text:
This review is for anyone using Road Side Assistance.  ZNL 'may' do a good job for customers that call direct, so I thought I would clarify that my experience was using Road Side Assistance.

Due to the abuse/harassment/bullying of the last one star review, I saved all of my phone and text correspondence in the chance that ZNL chooses to deny the validity of any of my review. (feel free to email me for the evidence I have stored).

Reading the response to ZNLs first one star review should be enough for anyone to use a different company.  (And I should have believed it so I wouldn't have had to experience it myself).

I needed a tow, my insurance found ZNL on their service list and scheduled the tow.  ZNL corresponded that they would arrive at "7:07".

A little more than an hour later, at 7:37, (no arrival, no notification)I called ZNL to get a new ETA, I'm happy to wait as long as I can confirm someone is actually coming. There was no response. Their voice mail message was flat and came off as rude.  It made me question who was coming to help me, so I looked ZNL on Google to read their reviews.

All were 5 stars except one.  The one star review sounded like what I was experiencing (No show, no reply and no answer). So to verify that I didn't have the incorrect information, I called my insurance back.  They called him, with no response or answer, they informed me that he had 'updated their correspondence' to say "Arriving Soon".

They said that "maybe he doesn't want to answer while driving".  I agreed and stood fast.  After waiting another 30 minutes, I attempted to call again(wife did also).  There was still no answer.  ZNLs phone rang through to voice mail again.

I called my insurance to see if they would have success in getting ahold of ZNL.  They said ZNL would be there in "20 minutes".  I said no big deal. I live close enough, I would have waited until morning if I was instructed to, so, wait time wasn't the issue.

After 30 minutes more, and no arrival, I called my insurance back. This time, I asked if they had actually spoken to ZNL.  They said NO.  They said that he hadn't answered the phone at all, he had just 'updated their correspondence'.  Which he had just done again....

I canceled the tow.

His abuse of the person that wrote his 'one star' review should have been a red flag enough for me, so I am trying to save you the time I wasted, by confirming.... It was likely true, because it happened to me.

If you're using Road Side Assistance or Insurance, "my opinion is": Tell them to call someone else.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: I have no idea what you went through with your insurance but I didn’t have any info about my company coming out to tow your car plus you aren’t the first person them insurance has to treated that way.. and yesterday I didn’t take any calls!! And if you are one of those towing owners or ppl that just wanna ruin someone’s business do to some mental, jealousy issues get this, YOU CANNOT STOP MY BUSINESS FROM GROWING!!!! HAVE A WONDERFUL DAY!!

reviews.name: Charlie Morse
reviews.text: Very aggressive phone operator not sure the name of the person but yea not a cool guy
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: I WILL LOOK INTO THIS , THANKS

reviews.name: Ivy Lopez
reviews.text: WORST EVER! The lady said she could not help me due to her being on the phone and driving she was so unprofessional worst service ever
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: She offered to call you back, But you hung up on her ?

reviews.name: Judith McClure
reviews.text: This towing company is unethical, my daughter's car broke down in AZ. Left car off the exit and Az had it towed by these individuals, when they called for two days were unable to get location of the vehicle. Well needless to say the cost is way up there by the time they were able to get the location of the vehicle. So they decided it was just not worth paying all the fees to get the car out. The lady that answers the phone is very unethical when my granddaughter whom is disabled called her to find out when she could come get the items out of the car, she told my granddaughter that she could not get the items out of the automobile, my granddaughter was very upset. I took it upon myself to contact an atty and the atty assured me that she was breaking the law. The law in every state in America indicates that ' no towing company and or impound yard may keep your personal belongings from you and may not request money before allowing you to retrieve your personal belongings! Maybe someone better inform her of state laws before allowing her to answer such questions. As you know this could become ugly and cause such law suits.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Sorry, We only tow cars to one yard. We had the car for over a month before anyone called looking for it. No one ever showed up to get the property out of the car ?

reviews.name: Amanda Jenkins
reviews.text: Seriously?! My apartment complex hired your company to do parking enforcement which is awesome when it's 10pm and someone is in my parking spot that I PAY for and there are NO OTHER PLACES TO PARK so I have to park on the other side of the complex and haul my NEWBORN BABY home in the snow & freezing cold all because NOBODY WILL ANSWER! Your "24 Hour" line is some poor guy's number who has nothing to do with your company and whoever has your main phone won't answer or have the decency to even respond to texts. Funny that when Knights Towing had our complex they were always here within minutes. Thanks for nothing.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: We are sorry to hear this. We have stopped doing parking enforcement in 2019. If there is anything we can help you with let us know! 801-367-9413

reviews.name: Mawulolo Kodzo AKLASSOU
reviews.text: I understand some people may have had a great experience with this towing and some may have not. The person I spoke with on the phone was the rudest person ever. Very disrespectful. A towing truck came on scene to tow my vehicle after waiting 3hours versus the 90 mins ETA he said at first. Then because of his rudeness behavior, my wife got angry. He then instructed the driver who already drove my car to the bed of the truck to pull the car back. When the insurance company contacted him to find out the reason, he said to them that I was drunk, that he doesn’t deal with drunk people. Normally when a towing driver feels threatened on the scene, he has been trained to call the cops. This driver just took off, meaning that I was not in any way a threat to him. Stay away from this kind of company.

reviews.name: Merin Benson
reviews.text:
We were in a huge bind, with a  malfunctioning car, and a short time frame to get it to a mechanic,  on a Saturday evening.  Dan answered his phone right away, and was able to get us where we needed to go,  on our crazy time frame.

Many, many thanks!!
