reviews.text: Austin came an got my truck an fifth wheel off the side of the free way an was an amazing guy also vary fast as well as the lady that we talked to on the phone

reviews.name: Harminder Singh
reviews.text:
Wrost service
They charge me $370
For changing my Spare at their shop

Other places charge $40 for tire change
Lady on phone she don’t value their customers
All time  rude

reviews.name: andrew vejnar
reviews.text: Never a fun situation getting stuck on dirt roads I was a mile into a sand trail. I was 30 minutes out from Kanab. In less than an hour after I made the phone call I was back on the road like nothing ever happened. Quick and easy!

reviews.name: Dami Hubbs
reviews.text: Tried to call them at 2:30 on a Saturday, we were driving through town and our small trailers hub broke and we couldn’t go any further, and this shop said they wouldn’t have anyone here until Monday to help. After that, the man on the phone said I have to take this other call and hung up leaving us stranded with no options. Not actually open until 4 on Saturday like they have listed!

reviews.name: Jeff Lyon
reviews.text: I travel in a 30' Class A with a cargo rack on the back.  While trying to pull into a camping area off Hwy 89 in the Vermillion Cliffs area, I came down the ramped entry too steep and got my tail end hung up...like a dog dragging his butt on the rug.  I have GS road service and they contacted Ramsay to come winch me out.  Jake from Ramsay was on the phone with me right away with an ETA and a cell # to text some pics so they would know what to expect.  The service truck arrived in about 90 minutes and the driver, whose name I don't remember but whose courtesy and good nature I'll never forget, had me unstuck in under 2 minutes and even jumped into the driver's seat of my rig (with my grateful permission) to position me safely to enter back onto the highway without getting hung up again.  Top-notch service!  Courteous, professional, quick and personable!

reviews.name: Kira Arbuckle
reviews.text: When the police and roadside assistance fail you when your family is stranded with limited to no phone service, Ramsay’s Tow will not. After an hour and a half on the phone trying to get help to my family from a hundred miles away way, a five minute call to Ramsays and someone was on their way to them. Thank you for making sure my family was safe!

reviews.name: Caryn Lim
reviews.text: Worst customer service, very rude and condescending. We got lost and tried to get out of the area (accordingly to Google maps, 10 minutes from Ramsay) but ended up in the sand on the side of the road. They felt they had to give us a lecture on the phone and when they got to us repeatedly saying "what were you thinking?" We asked for help and willing to pay, of course, not like we were asking for free help. We didn't even negotiate. They quoted $175 on the phone, then gave us a lecture and upped the price to $225 by the time they were done lecturing because they felt we were too dumb to get ourselves into trouble like that.

reviews.name: Julie Brooks
reviews.text: A tenant called Love's Tow on the evening of 3/18. She fabricated a story that she was the manager & my truck was involved in a recent situation where my son preceeded to run a man over & to be parked in Reserve Parking. After speaking to Weber Dispatch, no such call/report was made, my truck had an unjustifiable tow, protocol was not followed, the manager didn't call, phone numbers didn't match hers. Sheila Smith made a false report & Love still towed. They charged me $295.15 the next day, is this common practice for this company? Is this how they make payroll? Is this how they get the collection plate for the Christmas party? I am now having to take them to court, it was a wrongful tow, they stated it was wrong & knew the caller wasn't the manager. Don't trust this company, the media has been informed, Matt Gephart was called. They did me wrong, they'll do the same to you.

reviews.name: Myka Beckstead
reviews.text: Do NOT go through love towing. They impounded my car (my fault I know) and then proceeded to wait past the 10 day notice I’m required to receive to let me know my car was with them. I then asked them how much it was to get out and they stated because they had had it for 22 days it was going to cost me over $1,000 to get it out. I then brought my title to them and asked to grab a few things out and was denied. The female at the front was rude along with whoever I spoke with on the phone. This company is not up to date with legal procedures. They don’t even understand basic customer service manners. Never again.

reviews.name: Waters Nielson
reviews.text: This is such a ridiculous company and i’m so surprised they are still in business. our car was towed a few nights ago, which is on us, but it took us hours just to figure out where our car was at because nobody knew where it was. they didn’t know where they put our car and had us call the individual driver to figure it out, and of course he didn’t answer his phone until hours after. On the phone he told us we wouldn’t be charged to pick up our car as long as we came the next day. when we went to pick up our car, the tow driver told us we owed him $350 after multiple attempts to figure out the math. this guy couldn’t even do simple addition and people trust him driving a tow truck? we called him out for lying about the price and he flat out denied ever saying anything about it being free. This company is full of incompetent idiots that continue to make careless mistakes, and it seems they have not taken any steps towards being safer and more responsible even after the ogden canyon incident.

reviews.name: Rebecca H
reviews.text: This place is a joke. We've been trying to have someone towed out of our spot since 12am. It is now 3am and we're illegally parked by a dumpster in a fure lane becuase love towing absolutely will not answer their phone. When they do answer, a guy named Michael answers and says we have the wrong number, and quickly hangs up. Which we KNOW is a lie becuase we've had many people towed from our spot using this company and phone number. And the voicemail literally says "you've reached loves towing"..... this company is trash and they lie when they don't feel like working.

reviews.name: Erin Bennett
reviews.text:
Garbage company. I had my Sprinter towed by Loves and requested an invoice when I spoke to the gentleman the first time. The communication with the person answering the phone was challenging. The tech who did the tow had excellent customer service skills. I followed up and asked him for a receipt which he wrote up and texted me a photo.
Apparently, the receipt from the tech isn't sufficient for my insurance company. I called the office to request a receipt. The gentleman informed me that the tech had been fired. It is unprofessional to discuss office politics with customers. I requested an invoice. The gentleman read the notes from my call, the correspondence between myself and the office then the office and the tech. Loves definitely did the tow and I definitely paid them. Then, the gentleman told me that I was scammed and he could not provide an invoice. What? I would like to be reimbursed the $900 from my ins company and he replies I was scammed and he cannot provide an invoice.
Call someone else!

reviews.name: Shayne Lewis
reviews.text:
While driving through weger canyon a driver from this company harassed my wife for several miles fir the infraction of leaving her bright light's on. Turned on his bright rear facing light's on and then swerved into her lane when she tried to pass. After the pass was completed he followed closely with brights on and then when she slowed to let him pass turned on the rear facing lights again in front for several miles. Very unprofessional and rude. Would definitely rather walk than use a company that thinks this is acceptable behavior for a supposed professional driver.
Since I can't respond to the reply I had to amend my review. The incident started a few miles up weber canyon east bound. Driver finally turned off his load light's facing to the rear between the batch plant on the north side of the freeway and the mogan exit. Sorry I had to guess and didn't get the exact mileage for you. You are free to hire anyone you want. Your business bub. Just thought you should know how your company was being represented. I never said he was a fault to begin with. I told you on the phone at yhe beginning it was because she had forgotten to dim the lights. Your drivers actions after that were what I had a problem with. But by all means argue with me instead of addressing the actual issue. Good luck to y'all!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: First off, you said your wife's brights were on driving behind my driver which means your wife was in the wrong to start with. He turned his lights on to remind her to dim her lights, then you said that he did it for 15 miles while harassing your wife. Did you ever think to tell her to dim her lights? The exaggeration of him doing it for 15 miles, leads me to believe that the whole story is an exaggeration. Maybe you should just tell your wife that it's harassment to drive with her brights on behind people. I find it interesting that you are complaining when you are at fault. Thanks for the bad review, I'm sure other people will read the rest of our companies reviews and find that we are an excellent company. We pride ourselves with good quality work and take responsibility for our actions as should you and your wife.thanks for re-writing your review ad.itting your fault in this situation, to bad that I can't leave you a 1 star review on your driving habits. But thanks for admiting you ma de a mistake. I realize that your review is your way of trying to hurt my business.

reviews.name: Connor O'Brien
reviews.text: The driver, Rick, was excellent! Very chill and understanding of our situation. They actually charged me less than I was quoted over the phone! Thanks guys!

reviews.name: Jason Maalona
reviews.text: Just got off the phone with them n asked for  a estimate on how much it would cost to tow my car from one place to the shop to get it situated n they actually helped me out n gave me a great estimate on how much it cost n i am very happy with there service that they will help me tow my car first thing in the morning 😎 i would recommend them if you need your car towed 💯

reviews.name: Nina Lapuste
reviews.text: Top notch towing right here. He answered the phone, did what he said he'd do, and has fair pricing. What more do you need? Thanks for the tow from Advance to our home. Hopefully we never need you again, but if we do we know we can count on you 😁
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you, always available to help anytime.

reviews.name: Trentan Carpenter
reviews.text: Needed a fix for our window before a predicted big snow storm. Chris not only was able to discuss options over the phone but was willing to look into the parts we needed ordered before I even confirmed we would do the repair. Chris was honest, fair and very responsive with everything and got it fixed the very next morning.

reviews.name: Jennifer Bly
reviews.text: So I called 801 Auto and repair  At 2:30 AM Sunday morning and he gave us a consultation over the phone and then offered his towing services to his shop. This man was outstanding and a hero by getting myself my daughter and my grandchildren out of 20ﾟ weatperiod I can't think him enough. Have you ever need help Within this area of Utah please call Chris at 8:01 auto and repair.

reviewContext.Services: Auto engine diagnostic, Service not listed

reviews.name: Luke Dalanhese
reviews.text: My experience was calling in just to tackle an ai robot. And when I finally got to Collin on the phone, he took my phone number, sent me a text, hung up and resumed the conversation through text. He has me send him a photo and give him info just to tell me he couldn’t help me until tomorrow.  Really wish the customer was more personable

reviews.name: Josh Christensen
reviews.text:
If I was the competition for Matt I would be pissed. They answer the phone right away, get some info on where I’m stuck, and Matt says he’ll have someone right out.

They had my wrecked can-am picked up in no time and dropped it to my house the next day!

Now if I was Matt’s competitor the thing that would drive me crazy would be that Matt charged less than $100 for all of this!

I left a healthy tip because he just didn’t charge me enough. This is service!

reviews.name: Helene C
reviews.text: Great little tour, husband was over the moon, bought himself a pair of gloves and I could see for real what he watches on his phone :-D

reviews.name: Andy Long
reviews.text: Wait for a phone call 📲

reviews.name: dustin chase
reviews.text: Not sure why my phone thinks I've been to Utah.....lol

reviews.name: Ariadne Morales
reviews.text: Hands down the best in Salt Lake!  My husband and I decided to go off road on an adventure and got our selves stuck in some mud. Eric picked up the phone right away and got to us in a timely matter. He had all the proper equipment and methods to get us unstuck! I highly recommend them for any road and off road recovery services! Eric is definitely a man of his word. “We have never left anyone stranded or stuck before.”
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you so much for your kind words! It was a pleasure meeting you and I’m glad we were able to help you out of your sticky situation.

reviews.name: soxnotsocks
reviews.text: Wouldn't ansee phone for more than two hours in the middle of the day. Wasnt allowed to get house keys, nor tools for work. Took 3 day weekend for COLUMBUS DAY, where no one was at the yard. Just terrible all around

reviews.name: CRAIG
reviews.text: Horrible the worst my goodness get a clue, a woman who looked like a mountain lion came as soon as I called didn't even give me a chance to hang up the phone and she was in her right mind how boring, she also had tools that got my trunk open and she checked the battery which is not what I called for... What did she think she was a mechanic unbelievable prompt, polite and going the distance what the heck is wrong with this company!!!;)

reviews.name: Tyler Wood
reviews.text:
Dishonest. Rude. Stole my aftermarket subwoofer after crash.

My wife worked as a home health & hospice CNA which required her to drive from house to house visiting her clients. One day she was traveling on belt route through construction and some construction debris blew into the road causing the cars in front to slam on their brakes. My wife slammed her brakes, but they didn’t slow her down quick enough so she hit the car in front of her. Thankfully she only suffered a concussion, but the car had to be towed. The responding officer called for a tow and the company that responded was Hudson Towing. After towing the car, I had them release it to my insurance company so they could look at it and hopefully pay for repairs. My wife and I were very sad when they deemed it a total loss. Naturally I went to get my aftermarket subwoofer, amplifier, and capacitor from the car before turning it over to the insurance company for good since they were not cheap pieces of equipment. I was sickened when I saw that my equipment was missing from my car. I called Hudson Towing and calmly explained the issue but the guy was extremely rude and unprofessional. Eventually he told me he would check his security tapes and get back to me the next day, but he never did. No windows were broken on my car which tells me whoever took my equipment had a key. This rules out a random person stealing form my car while in the tow lot, so I know the culprit was someone who worked at Hudson Towing, possibly even the rude guy I spoke to on the phone.

Unfortunately for me, I didn’t take a photo of the stereo equipment in my car while it was being loaded onto the tow truck, so I can’t press charges. I was much more concerned with making sure my wife was okay as she was concussed and hysterical due to having PTSD from a previous car accident a couple of years ago.

The bottom line is that nobody should ever let this company tow their car for any reason.

reviews.name: Chris Nelson
reviews.text: Company told me one price on the phone and then when it came down to it, the charged me FOUR times as much as originally quoted.

reviews.name: Cody Jensen
reviews.text: 100% scumbags and liars! Driver tried to repo a car, and when he discovered we made arrangements with another company to pick it up he got pissed. He even went so far as to tell me the other company was on the phone and wanted to tell me to let him take the car. The number showing in his phone was not the other company, he was just trying to lie. I immediately called the company I was dealing with and they confirmed that the patriot tow guy was in fact lying and he was not the person they were trying to say he was. Driver and assistant very unprofessional and threw a temper tantrum when he was informed he wouldn't be able to take possession of the vehicle. According to personal experience and the word of multiple other repo agents, Patriot towing and recovery are a dishonest, scumbag company who lie, cheat and steal personal belongings and who enjoy harassing minor children. Stay away from Patriot towing and recovery if you don't want to be mistreated, lied to and stolen from

reviews.name: Thomas Castillo
reviews.text:
If there was less than a zero.  It would be too high!
They towed my car and when I went to get my belongings, they had moved my car elsewhere and said that they cleaned out my car.  I asked to grab what they cleaned out and they only had my portable battery jumper.    When I got to my vehicle, my entire car including the trunk had been rummaged through by the company/driver. They stole a brand new pair of headphones, a full bottle of cologne, my phone charger and a special black light flashlight that's used for work/pest control.

I'd advise everybody to never use their services if at all possible.  Other reviews have also mentioned theft!

reviews.name: Brennen Montoya
reviews.text: This company should not be in business! Came and tried to repo a car in my driveway that is not mine at all whatsoever the person doesn’t even live at my house. Left BIG gouge marks and scratches on my brand new driveway. The driver who was friendly apologized and took pictures on his phone. I have pictures also and the whole thing on video. My husband called the company and the owner basically told him to piss off and take me to court. Which we will. DONT DO BUSINESS WITH THIS COMPANY. Even if your a car lot trying to hirer a recover company, just stay far away from them. I will be contacting my lawyer and news stations about them. I’m sure they don’t care obviously from there 1.9 review base.

reviews.name: Cam Wilding
reviews.text: The owner is abusive. He tried to forcibly remove me while I was talking to an associate that was helping me until he came out and started saying I was being rude. (Due to a phone call with an employee who also was rude to me) I was literally explaining to the associate what happened and he interfered. Learn to deal with angry people! I should have gotten my car on friday and not have had to pay more because of mistakes made by this company and their client! Worst experience I've dealt with by really any company. This owner should be held accountable because he literally has no people to people skills and only knows how to upset his clients! Check city was the other culprit in this fiasco.

reviews.name: Garrett Myler
reviews.text:
After repeatedly telling them exactly where I was broken down on the freeway, the lady asked for an address, and then sent me a text message to get the exact coordinates. After being in the phone for over 15 minutes - in a dangerous position since there was no shoulder to pull off to and the vehicle being too broken to limp to the nearest shoulder/ off ramp - they told me it would cost about $270 to tow it less than a mile away and that it would take 30 to 60 minutes.

I ended up cancelling the tow and calling Ogden Auto Towing which was there in about 22 minutes and charged about half as much as Jorgies quoted us. I can't be sure but it seems to me - as well as our tow truck driver - that Jorgies is not being honest about their claimed location in Roy, UT since it seemed to me (based on the exorbitant price and time) and that they are merely a referral service.

Find another LOCAL towing company.

reviews.name: Chantel Brown
reviews.text: They sounded so sketchy over the phone. They wanted my Cc number and drivers license number before they came out to do anything and I wasn’t having it. When I asked where they were coming from they said “we work from home but don’t worry we have drivers in the area.” What?! The scariest part is they the roadside assistance program that my insurance uses called them, so I will be having choice words with them as well.

reviews.name: monica deleon
reviews.text: I bought a jimmy from them they will tell you what you want to hear the car is reliable great condition and they guarantee 100% and then I went the next day cuz oil was leaking the struts were bad and when I went to tell them they said the guy who sold to me was gone they never answered my phone calls. If I could I would not even give them a star. They are Untrustworthy,, I do not recommend ,,,

reviews.name: Amanda Allen
reviews.text: I had a minor incident, and wasn't sure if my car needed towing or not. I called Winterton, and they were very patient and helpful with my questions on the phone.  Trevor came out super fast, helped me decide the best option for my vehicle, and was very positive, reassuring, and generous!!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you Amanda for the review! If you're ever unsure,  give us a call and we will help in anyway we can!

reviews.name: Robyn Peters
reviews.text:
I recently had my vehicle towed by Winterton Automotive Towing, and while dealing with an unexpected breakdown is never easy, I was genuinely impressed by their professionalism and responsiveness.

Mike, who assisted me over the phone, was incredibly helpful and worked with me to arrange payment over the phone, making the process smooth and stress-free. He immediately assigned a tow driver to pick up my vehicle and even went the extra mile by providing his personal number for follow-up questions. Mike also ensured I received two emails with the invoices, showing a level of customer care that exceeded my expectations.

Despite the high towing costs, their quick response and excellent communication made a difficult situation much easier to handle. I highly recommend Winterton Automotive Towing for their reliability and outstanding customer service.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for your great review! So glad we could get you help in your time of need!

reviews.name: Tyler
reviews.text: Probably better get someone else on the phones! Called about hiring you to do a job and lady on the phone was rude and unhelpful. Not the best attitude for the industry that you're in!

reviews.name: Fernanda Jackson
reviews.text: There are no listed prices, he just charges what he likes. They also charged for 2 days when the vehicle was there for just under 15 hours. Lastly, he quoted a price over the phone and then charged $100 more at pickup. Completely shady business
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for your review. Its obvious you are mad because you got your car impounded by the police and are just mad at us because of your mistakes. At least tell the truth and don't make up things that did not happen. Have a great day

reviews.name: Jantzen Steinmetz
reviews.text: Hooked up to my car, but saw how heavily modified it was and knocked on the door before taking it due to the damage that would happen from our steep driveway. Were willing to sit and wait while I figured everything out with the bank on my phone. It's my birthday. Best birthday present was those two guys and their patience. My car and I owe them some beer.

reviews.name: Reely Baxton
reviews.text:
This company is completly unreliable.
I called for a tow and she told me it would be an hour but would call if it changed. She never called. So i called after waiting an hour and a half. She then told me it would be an additional 45 minutes. After another hour and half i called again, we had been waiting 3 hours. I told them if they couldn’t be here to tow in ten minutes then we would have to cancel. He said go ahead and cancel. I explained i had waited over 3 hours and this was very discourteous and i would not be using there service ever again. He said ok, and hung up the phone.
DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY. They do not care about the customer. I called another tow company and they showed up in 20 minutes.
Go with someone else.

reviews.name: Nayeli Gemini’s
reviews.text: Horrible place is close when there business hrs say the are open  form 8 :00am to 5:00pm lady on the phone star getting  all aggressive   Hang the phone on me  when I ask why the do false  advertising of there  hrs I drive from west Jordan to salt lake   I was prepared to pay the feeds  to get my property so disappointed !!!

companies.name: Brett's Heavy Duty Towing and Roadside

reviews.name: Alaze Bowen
reviews.text: Such amazing service! We called many towing companies in the area & they were unwilling to come get us. We called RC & they immediately answered the phone, gave us the cheapest quote in the area, & were very kind & quick. Once we called, our driver, Cameron, was there in 20 minutes. He was so kind & polite. He drove us to the closet tire service company & made sure we were okay since we weren’t from the area. Highly, highly , highly recommend this company!

reviews.name: Kuya Kano
reviews.text:
This third and fourth party system charged me $137 for a service that was only suppose to move my vehicle to an address 600 feet away from where the car was.  They did not offer a quote, they IMMEDIATELY charged my credit card without letting me how much they were going to charge me.
To add to their incompency, instead of the address I requested, they sent the vehicle to an address that was 13 miles away.  Then I had to pay another company to relocate the vehicle back to where I originally wanted it to be.
When I called True Towing, another third party billing company from India answered the call and refused to assist me with the refund.  Instead of forwarding to me to True Towing, they said that True Towing does not have a phone number to transfer me to, so instead they transferred me to an State Farm Insurance phone bank.
DO NOT USE THIS SERVICE!
Most likely its not even an American company, rather some foreign computer link third party that charges extra to link you to an ACTUAL TOWING company that you should have called in the first place.

reviews.name: Xntrest Nick
reviews.text: The lady on the phone on Thursday March 23 she sounded Mexican was unhelpful very impatient, rude and also rushed me off the phone and hung up on me . She will in the future be a liability for the business…someone will want to slap the smart mouth out of her

reviews.name: Josh Kleifgen
reviews.text: We were stuck with a blown tire, and a blown spare. 24 hour tow quoted a decent price, and got us to Ogden. The driver kept in touch, and explained he was dropping a car, and he would get out to us ASAP. Took about an hour to get us from phone call to flat bed which was pretty good. Thanks.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you so much for taking the time to leave a review

reviews.name: Maggie Dylan
reviews.text: Didn't answer the phone.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Hi Maggie! We're sorry to hear that you had a negative experience with our team. We take all feedback seriously and will do our best to make things right.

reviews.name: Philip Pelster
reviews.text:
When asking for a quote (not an urgent tow), the person on the other line was very rude and said to call somebody else, even though the request was non-urgent.
Don't care if I'm broken down and need an urgent tow. They won't get my business.
EDIT - lol the person who picked up the phone earlier called to complain about his one star review. Seriously, these folks have the maturity of a crying toddler.

reviews.name: Kristina Clark
reviews.text: Just a heads up - a jump costs $85 + a tip for the driver. For that price, go bother one of your neighbors! I called the number on the website for the jump and the guy who answered couldn't wait to hang up. He tried hanging up so fast I had to yell and ask if he needed my number. The service guy that came was incredibly nice and efficient. They take a card payment over the phone and the guy on the other end, just awful. Once again, couldn't wait to hang up, the price of the jump shocked me so much I was speechless for a few seconds. I was fine tipping the driver but that whole experience was honestly a little intimidating and scary.

reviews.name: Mykaela Fine
reviews.text: Every encounter on the phone was so rude- hung up as fast as he could & could not even get a word in. 100% can’t recommend

reviews.name: serena marron
reviews.text: whoever answered the phone on 7/21 needs some re-educating… incredibly in-comprehensive

reviews.name: India Hoover
reviews.text: Awful customer service, very rude on the phone when I asked for a quote. Guy on the phone couldn’t hang up fast enough.

reviews.name: Kayden Macey
reviews.text:
Their Google Maps hours say open 24hrs, but that's only for the towing services. Went to pick up my car after 5pm (closing time) and was charged an after-hours fee of around $70. Seriously?
Their website also states open 24hrs for towing, but doesn't list any other business hours on the front page.

My car was towed while I was out of town and I wasn't notified about it. I don't know if Cartow would've been able to contact me, but I found my car online through the Utah Department of Public Safety's Impound Vehicle Service. A call or email or anything would've been appreciated if possible.

Regardless of all of this, I believe that car towing is extremely predatory, but, the driver who helped me out and the owner (who was talking over the phone) were very friendly. I really appreciate that. Other reviews say their team is friendly in general, and I believe it.

Overall I disagree with the expensive fees and lack of notification, but at least the team was friendly.

reviews.name: Shanna Carpenter
reviews.text:
When a company prides themselves on longevity and customer service, you’d expect to receive such , However Unprofessional is Inappropriate would be better suited.
From the manner the initially driver pulled up , addressed me and “handed “ the card I should have expected less, upon entering the building all employees were occupied which was fine as I was on the phone, waiting for a reception to be present , in the most snarky tone a “manager “ yells once you get off the phone we can help you .
Immediately taken back as well no one was available, and I wasn’t in a rush ,
She then proceeded to yell how they don’t want to be rude im on the phone so and it’s policy ..(because yelling across an office is appropriate?)
A driver in the office steps in and starts getting hostile with me , at this point the receptionist makes her way to the desk and immediately rolls her eyes and has an attitude.
I tried explaining , she proceeded to interrupt and tell me she doesn’t know what happened she’s just trying to get me out .

After asking for a corporate number , the “manager “ comes up very aggressively and continues to push conversations, I stated I wasn’t comfortable with such which is why I asked for a corporate number she said to go online and she’s an owner.

What should have been a quick interaction turned to me leaving shaking on the verge of tears

Just to be locked out of my vehicle .. so I had to stand there being glared at for 10 mins while they tried to pop my lock ..

When the choice is yours .. don’t let  Stauffers towing be it !

reviews.name: Laura Phillips
reviews.text: I was traveling through Farr West, Utah when my camper trailer blew a wheel bearing. I called around to find a heavy duty tow truck and the staff that answered the phone helped to find an RV place (shout out to Blue Compass RV!) to take it. It was a complicated tow when you have to tow with 3 tires  but they got it done. No drama, polite, laughed at my jokes. What more can you ask for? Stellar service from the moment they answered the phone - thank you!

reviews.name: Bob Joe
reviews.text: Was not even towed to the right place. Towed a couple feet to a random parking lot. Wasted time because the driver took a break to go mcdonalds that I had to go with. Ended up getting charged for his miles he took to go to mcdonalds. Ridiculous and very unprofessional business. Lady on the phone was very rude and never even gave her name to introduce herself. Unprofessional company. The towing guy also said we would never be billed since he didnt tow us anywhere. We didnt go to our destination. GET TOWING ELSEWHERE. HIGHLY RECOMMEND STAYING AWAY FROM THIS BUSINESS! Matt will lie to you so then you loose money and will change his story every chance he gets. YOU CAN NOT TRUST THIS COMPANY!

reviews.name: Michele Oakes
reviews.text: The employees are kind understanding and polite the man I spoke with on the phone steve was very helpful and actually care about my situation awesome place
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Michele,

Our customers are our number one priority and that's why we always try to go the extra mile to offer quality service. We have the luck to have amazing drivers and dispatchers that provide an amazing experience to anyone that needs our help.

We're glad that Steve was so helpful with your problem. We'll make sure to pass on your kind words.

Thank you,

Stauffer's Towing team

reviews.name: Eric
reviews.text:
Tried to use this company today to get a man lift un-stuck on a job site.  They took my first call, and asked me to send them some pictures over email.  I did this, and then they never got back to us.  .   I followed back up again via email, and phone call a few times throughout the day.

AMS Towing came through for us though, they were quick with all responses, emails and calls, and got us un stuck in no time.  Highly recommend them.

reviews.name: Vera Jie
reviews.text:
We accidentally closed the trunk while car key was still there last night after coming down from Overlook trail. Phone service was out, couldn’t remotely unlock my car. Rangers were not able to be targeted. A group of kind soul drove us down to the town. Thanks for saving our lives! We called around to seek for help after getting down, but it was too late and everyone I contacted wasn’t able to help and we had to wait till the morning. Winder came to my sight while I was searching, so I called them. They are the quickest to respond. Called in at ~6:35am, problem solved at 9:10am. Super friendly and efficient!
Shout out for all these kind souls and people please always remember to CHECK YOUR KEY before close the trunk!!!!

reviews.name: Andy Fam
reviews.text: Got towed 11 miles to a shop for $70. Fairly priced. Driver was professional and knew what he was doing. Customer service was OK, they're not gunna kiss your butt but they aren't rude. The guy who answered the phone was helpful and gave me a fairly accurate ETA. Driver got there quickly and got the job done in fast timing. I got no complaints. Good job.

reviews.name: Zach Bay
reviews.text: I called AAA Winder towing to attempt to get some keys out of a vehicle. The person on the phone was extremely unhelpful and when I attempted to clarify why they could not do the job, they hung up on me.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
I am sorry to hear this.
The only thing I can think of to explain this is that my work often leads me into sketchy cell service.
It sounds to me like we may have had a miscommunication due to poor cell service followed by a dropped call.
Once again, my apologies.

reviews.name: Cindy Petersen
reviews.text: The person that picked my car up was very friendly and nice on the phone. The receptionist that took my call was very unprofessional and rude.

reviews.name: Tori Smedley
reviews.text: I could not believe the woman on the phone. She was short with me, kept putting me on hold every four seconds, then randomly told me they were headed to come get my car before even telling me the price (which I asked for first) and any details. Such a frustrating call.

reviews.name: Andrew M
reviews.text:
After 2 hours of waiting on the highway (for their 40 minute eta) I had to call them back, they claimed they couldn't find or contact me, despite me telling them exactly where I was and having my phone the entire time, and gave up.  Pretty sure they never sent someone out, it'd be hard to miss.  One of the ladies I talked to on the phone was pleasant, the other was not and I'm wondering if she just didn't process my request.
Go with literally anyone else.

reviews.name: Leah Brunell
reviews.text: I would like to let everyone know that Brett's Towing is the best towing company in Ogden. They are very nice and polite. The gentleman that I talked to on the phone said we will get you picked up in 30 minutes. The driver was their in 15 and very polite. Their trucks are always clean and the drivers are professional. I will recommend them to anyone anytime.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Leah for that amazing review, we appreciate you letting us help you and look forward in helping you again.

reviews.name: rolling green
reviews.text: My Chevy K5 got stuck after becoming high centered in Rattlesnake Gulch and we were unable to self-recover. It was already late in the evening after hiking to get cell phone coverage. We we're able to contact Adrenaline Recovery and inform them of our situation. They arrived quickly and were very courteous and professional from the start. There were no YouTube cameras shoved in our faces nor a 100 questions asking how it happened, just Lloyd and his son working as quickly and efficiently to get us out and back home as quickly as possible. I highly recommend them to anybody needing off-road recovery. I will definitely call them again in the future if the need arises.

reviews.name: Brian Sibanda
reviews.text: Picked up the phone one timw showed up on time  and was very nice . Local to the ogden tremwmton area
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
Brian, It's great to hear that we were able to help you out. Our goal is to make sure everyone who walks through the door leaves happy. Thank you for choosing Hansen Motor Company!

Matt Hansen
Matt@hansenmotors.com

reviews.name: Tynan Conner
reviews.text: Zane and his crew were timely and efficient. Answered the phone and gave me a quote. Then arrived within the hour. Would definitely recommend and use again. Fingers crossed I won’t have to. Thanks guys!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
Tynan, Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts on working with Zane and our team. We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience!

Matt Hansen
Matt@hansenmotors.com

reviews.name: Florea Denis
reviews.text: The owner of the company was very rude. He started yelling at phone.That's his rules and he don't care about everybody. He wanted me to pay him $800 in advance.for 1 hour of work, When I told him , that I would pay after the job is done.  don't  call this company.  You will lose your money and time.

reviews.name: Christine Suriano
reviews.text: Called to get a Ford F550 towed from downtown to West Valley City, I was told it was 210 an hour with a 2 hour minimum, I commented several times that 2 hours should be plenty of time, the man on the phone never corrected me. The call was made at 3:30 PM, the driver called me when he reached the truck at 4:48 PM, Arrived at my home at 6:30 PM, tinkered with the truck and on his phone until 6:50 then charged us 3 hours plus 37.80 for gas. 667.80 for a job that should have been 30 minutes, only 11 miles. He told me that we have to pay from the moment he leaves I15 until he gets back to I15, RIP OFF!!! Very Deceptive!

reviews.name: Kiersten Cave
reviews.text: RUDE LYING THIEVES.. Traveling from out of state. Called for help changing a flat tire, was quoted $95 for them to come out and help. Explained multiple times my exact location, and after 30 minutes he called back saying he was in the wrong area and way farther away than he originally thought and wanted to charge $150 for the time it took to get there and more for the way back. I said no thanks, that’s too much for just a flat ONLY then was I informed that since he had already dispatched I was still being charged $100 even though he never made it to me. Sat there and argued on the phone with me for a good hour and a half and said since they took my card info at the beginning they could and would continue to charge me. S C A M

reviews.name: Randy Griffith
reviews.text: Whoever answered the phone was not very well informed of what the company does or how it works and he was very off-putting almost to the point of rude

reviews.name: UNIT # 111 ACE
reviews.text: The worst customer service I have ever experienced. Called for help was put on hold for about 10 min. After being on hold another person answered the phone had no clue what I was talking about. Then after explaining to her what I needed. She said I need to pay $250 before they dispatch a mechanic. First time I ever hear that. I agree to pay then she tells me she cannot accept my fleet one check or cash only com check or t check, neither one of which I have. No help what so ever, don't waste your time with these people!!!

reviews.name: Madison Shoaf
reviews.text: Excellent experience from start to finish. Professional phone manners, good communication about when they would arrive. Gentle treatment of my car to get it loaded. After we got to the service center they took extra time to teach me how to shift my car without any power and helped make sure everything was taken care of and locked correctly before they left. Truly above and beyond.

reviews.name: Betsy Olsen
reviews.text: They were very prompt and service was great. Customer service (person answering phone) was very helpful. Customer service is clearly lacking since covid in most industries. Intermountain tow had HELPFUL people on the phone helping with all the details. They also gave me a very accurate quote on the phone prior to service.

reviews.name: Juan Reyes
reviews.text:
Best towing company I've found! My car wouldn't start. After requesting roadside assistance through both the Progressive Insurance app and over the phone talking to a real person. I was waiting an hour and a half! Still nothing from Progressive.
I called Intermountain and within 15 minutes they helped me out. Tow truck driver was highly respectful too. Never was   a smart aleck unlike some tow truck drivers I've met. I HIGHLY recommend this company.

reviews.name: Bobi Smethurst
reviews.text: We were stuck in the mountains when our fuel line went out in our truck on a Sunday- on a holiday weekend!!   We called Winterton towing from a referral from a friend, and man, they were right!  From the phone call, to the drop off … we felt at ease and taken care of!  Scott dropped off our truck at the shop and was so pleasant and professional. We will continue to praise and share this experience …   Thank you!

reviews.name: Nelle Pugsley
reviews.text: Very responsive and helpful🤗 The phone was answered by a real person and they said they could be there within thirty minutes. Thanks so much for the great service!

reviews.name: ttynsk
reviews.text: They answered the phone right away. Let me know it would be possibly 45 min for them to get someone to my car. They were able to get to it much sooner. Great communication with Andrew. He was very polite and prompt. Got the car were it needed to be in a timely manner. Will definitely recommend Winterton. All around great experience.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you so much for the great review and recommendation!

reviews.name: Steven Brewer
reviews.text: Great service! My truck broke down this morning I gave them a call they arrived right when they said they would. Very affordable price too! I’m saving there number in my phone for future reference
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you so much Steven for the 5 star review! Glad we could help.  Thanks for calling and if you ever need us again don't hesitate to call! Nice meeting you today!

reviews.name: Alyssa Garrison
reviews.text: Andrew was so awesome! He was very nice and fluent in my stressful time. I called early morning hours and he picked up the phone immediately. After I told him the problem he was grabbing his keys and was out the door. He even got to me before my ride did! Exceptional customer service. Wonderful rates as well! Hopefully I won’t need a tow again but if I do he’s always going to be my first call.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for the great review! Glad we could help in your stressful situation this morning! If you ever need a tow again we'll be here! Good luck and hopefully they get your car figured out at the shop.

reviews.name: Joe Detro
reviews.text: From the very first phone call till the end,the service was outstanding. I got stranded in Idaho on my way home. My truck broke down while towing my trailer. I called Ams towing and Angie was very kind, helpful, fast and efficient. Then within minutes Evan the driver called to say he was on his way. Evan was awesome and very professional. If you need a tow call AMS. Thanks again AMS

reviews.name: Finis Thomas
reviews.text:
Excellent Excellent Excellent!!!
The driver was very good at his job, his boss was on the phone with us every step of the way. Would definitely use this service again. 5 stars is not enough I'd give them 20. Thanks again for your help...

reviews.name: Nathaniel Foster
reviews.text: Car broke down 3 miles from my home. Evan in truck #34 got to me in a 1/4 the time the guy on the phone said it would take, got my car up onto the truck in like two minutes and got it to my house in another 7. Extremely friendly, extremely kind and understanding, and extremely competent, for quite a decent rate as well. If you ever need towing from AMS, ask for Evan if you can. Great service and if all their drivers are like this then I'd highly recommend them.

reviews.name: Lisa Lee
reviews.text: Absolute misrepresentation of price on the phone!  Talk about kick you when your down.  Went from $292.00 quote to $$497.86 and min tip of 75.00 expected!!   And what do you do then?  What if I didn't have the money?  Would they keep my cat?  Was price doubled because of the car I drive??  Curious???

reviews.name: J Slick
reviews.text: Great service. My trailer clearance lights were both out. Driver side went out next morning but its a separate issue going on because they took pictures with both of them working before they left. I called and the guy that answered the phone was professional in response and even helped out over the phone with a few tips.

reviews.name: NORTH LOGISTICS COMPANY
reviews.text:
Our truck broke down due to a transmission issue, and we called this towing service for assistance. Their driver arrived and disassembled the driveshaft (cardan). I’m not entirely sure whether that was necessary for towing, but I assumed it was part of the standard procedure.

After towing the truck to the repair shop on a Saturday (which was closed until Monday), the driver left without reassembling the driveshaft. I called the company and asked them to send the driver back to complete the job. They responded that it would be handled by the shop’s mechanics instead.

I explained that if the mechanics were to reassemble the driveshaft, we would likely be charged for it — and this should have been the towing company’s responsibility. They then told me it was part of their policy. However, no one mentioned this to me when I booked the tow. When I raised this, the woman on the phone simply claimed she wasn’t the one who spoke to me during the booking — which was not true.

This lack of communication and accountability is disappointing. Customers deserve to be clearly informed about what is included in the service and what is not. Transparency is key in any business.

reviews.name: Dave Jervis
reviews.text: Attempted to get pricing for service, was told by the rude lady on the phone that 'we don't do that, thank yeeewwwwww" and then she hung up.  Unprofessional.

reviews.name: Shelley Cooper
reviews.text: I had an excellent experience with Stauffer’s Towing! Cassie was incredibly helpful and a pleasure to speak with over the phone. When we blew a tire on our Escalade, I called three other towing companies, and none had the flatbed necessary for our vehicle. Stauffer’s came through quickly and efficiently. They were not only fast but also very affordable, which was a nice surprise. I couldn't have asked for better service during a stressful situation. Highly recommend them!

reviews.name: Felipe Silva
reviews.text: Excellent service 👏.  Thank you for helping me today I called more then 5 towing companies around and no body wanted the opportunity. I appreciate your time and service. The lady that I spoke on the phone she is a sweet heart. I thank you and your team for helping me today with the skidsteer from sunbelt rentals.  In West Jordan.

reviews.name: Mike Mohr
reviews.text: Good equipment, courteous professional driver and prompt service only get you 2 stars when the bill was $425 to tow 10 miles. Also paperwork was a hassle. None given at the time of service and it took 2 begging phone calls to get it emailed.

reviews.name: William Jolley
reviews.text: They quickly picked me up and took my car to the dealership. It was already prepaid over the phone from the sweet office gal.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: William, we're glad you had such a positive experience with Empire Towing & Recovery! Thanks for the wonderful review and kind words about our office staff. We appreciate your business!

reviews.name: Laurie
reviews.text: Jeremy answered the phone and sent someone out very quickly to pick my my car. Glen showed called to tell me he was on the way and showed up before was expected. He was so helpful and explained a lot to me! Glad I used them to tow my car!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us a review. We look forward to serving you in the future.

reviews.name: Emir Alikadic
reviews.text:
Dispatcher answered phone instantly, and answered all my questions patiently. Standing in full motorcycle leathers on highway shoulder in 105F weather, I probably wasn't at my best, but the dispatcher certainly was - and I really appreciate that.

Glenn (the driver) called ahead to let me know he'll be ahead of schedule, communicated with me throughout, made sure my motorcycle was safely loaded and protected for the ride, and delivered it to destination promptly.

You're never having a good day when you need a towing company/roadside assistance, so it really makes a huge difference when the folks you're dealing with are professional and courteous, like Empire Towing.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you so much for your review. We really appreciate your business and I’m so glad that our staff exceeded your expectations.

reviews.name: Matt McDuffie
reviews.text: I need truck that broke down a few months ago towed to the mechanic the day before I was going to contact the tow company that my mechanic recommended I was outside Bestbuy in Draper in my car and that decided to stop working. I had to take Uber home then the next day I started calling I called the recommended company the guy sound like he was too busy and told me to call back. Then I called a few more companies one said he didn’t have a driver another guy said he wasn’t a tow company even though he answered the phone with the same name. When I finally called empire the guy Jeremy that answered was super nice I told him my truck was at my house in south jordan and the car in Draper he said not a problem but he would not be able to get to it fir about an hour and a half he quoted me the price for each vehicle which I tell you was very reasonable within 30 min he was at my house to pickup the truck unfortunately it had a flat tire and his tow truck was not able to move it but he would dispatch the one that  could without an additional charge. He went instead to pickup the car they had both vehicles to the mechanic within two hours. I highly recommend this company to anyone needing towing service very Proffesional five stars all the way.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you so much for your review. I’m glad we were able to help you with both of your vehicles. We appreciate your comprehensive review and would love to serve you again if needed.

reviews.name: Devin Sherwood
reviews.text: If I could give this company zero stars I would. My insurance company called them to tow my car, almost 2 hours goes by... Guess what no driver. My insurance called me and said they cancelled and marked the tow as complete. Completely  unprofessional.  I even called them to get an update on the location of my tow truck and nobody ever answered the phone. Thanks "Empire" for showing me what a good towing company is like. Nope not for me.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: We had cancelled the tow with your insurance company, we did not mark the tow as complete. That's not even how the process works.  I'm sorry that they didn't re-dispatch another provider in a timely manner, that is out of my control.

reviews.name: Travis Van Dongen
reviews.text:
Great experience with Cartow today.  My shop/van sees many miles.  Today it decided to stop working so well.  Cartow was super helpful.  Answered their phone, checked for proper fit of my van on their truck, called me back to coordinate the job.  And got my vehicle to repair shop safely.  Driver, Aaron, was friendly and professional.  Safe loading and unloading of my van.
Thank you.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for the great review Travis!

reviews.name: John Veloz
reviews.text: Horrible nasty individual answered the phone and spoke to my young nephew who was trying to get a quote.  She was Nasty to him and unpleasant.  Call was on speaker and he asked for a quote and she could not be bothered.  Put him on hold and just hung up on him.  I called back because I was upset at how she treated him and told her she was nasty.  She the proceeds to call me back from a blocked number only to tell me that she had my number.  Well good for her.  I didn't call from a blocked number.  I would not deal with this company.

reviews.name: S M
reviews.text:
I have saved Cartow in my phone. They deserve it. I've used them twice in a year and each time their dispatcher is so courteous and professional. The tow drivers have been so considerate and professional as well. This last time, SHAWN #44, helped my 18 yr old daughter tow her vehicle, she was so nervous about everything. He was professional and kind and made her feel important and respected. My daughter saved Cartow in her phone too.  I highly recommend Cartow. Thanks again! 🙏

And it was the fastest wait time I have experienced ever, especially right before Christmas.

reviews.name: Duvish Suthar
reviews.text: they towed my car the first time and everything was okay at first, the shop i towed it to took a video on their property for their safety reasons to cover them if they did any damage, and because of that when i needed another tow the lady on the phone told me they will no longer tow for me because they were “illegally recorded” even though it was on their property, and my car was apparently too low (bone stock civic suspension) would never use them again even for another car

reviews.name: SoshJam
reviews.text:
I was a bit frustrated when I left my first review but now that I've actually concluded business with them I thought I'd leave a real one.

When I called them initially, the person who answered my phone was very unengaged and didn't provide all the information I needed, and it took them three or four hours to call me back. Even then it was very difficult to find out what I had to do and when I had to do it.

They also painted some numbers on my windshield, probably as some internal way for them to track who the car belongs to or something. But they aren't coming off from regular scrubbing, and I might have to hire someone or something to get my windshield back to normal.

Other than those major hurdles though, it went fine. Once I was actually able to get down there and pick it up, it went very smoothly. The person at the desk at the impound lot was helpful. It was very expensive but that's not their fault as the rates are controlled by the state.

reviews.name: dude5576
reviews.text: Hey Paul I love your videos I wonder where I can get that radio and steering wheel that in wrecker  I love when help people from getting stuck too I had a very nice phone call with your mom  thank John from Jersey

reviews.name: Austin Stenholm
reviews.text: Called for a quote because sugar was put in my tank  and was rushed off the phone! He stated "they can't do big jobs like that". Apparently they can't change a fuel pump, filter, or injectors.  I can understand not being able to drop a gas tank. Plus I don't even need the work done I only needed a quote for the courts!

reviews.name: Sarah Camryn
reviews.text: This business will lie to you to get you to use their service. I was told I could call to release my vehicle to the auto body shop yet when I did that they changed their story saying I had to come down in person just trying to get it in their custody longer to rack up storage fees. They said they allow over the phone release for someone that got injured only. Considering the technology we have today and knowing people that just got in an accident don't have transportation Id say their service is awful. What a way to add more stress to an already stressful situation! Plus the last on the phone was rude as hell!

reviews.name: Maegan
reviews.text: Gary found my sisters car on Friday evening, over the phone with us after she broke down while visiting from out of town. He got to the car before the city towed it and was able to get it to a very good mechanic who got them back on the road, quickly the next day. He was extremely professional and responsive to our calls as we worked to figure out where she had left it. His invoice was very reasonable and we are so thankful for his quick response! Thank you, Gary!

reviews.name: MC Outis
reviews.text: These guys are awesome I had to get my car off private property before the place closed and I was at work and couldn't be there and they helped coordinate everything with me and took my card over the phone a day in advance but didnt charge til after the job was done. They were also the cheapest and least pushy out of all the other towing services I called..

reviews.name: Jenny Moran
reviews.text: Terrible service! I had to leave work to go home and help the tow guy with my husbands car because he apparently doesn't know how to tow a Tesla! Upon arrival I was told to get in the car and press the buttons he told me to press all for it to still not work and him forcing the Tesla on the tow bed anyways! After about 30 minutes of helping him figure out how to get the car on the bed I was told it would be another $50 that my "insurance refuses to pay" even though I had just gotten off the phone with our insurance and was told they would cover all costs. He refused to accept insurance payment and kept insisting I pay him $50 directly. What a scam and rip off go to someone else when you need a tow.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Such a liar why do I have to refuse?

reviews.name: Ahhnehh T
reviews.text: Had roadside assistance schedule this company, they were almost an hour late, no updates and would not answer their phone. Terrible experience.

reviews.name: Eddie Wilson
reviews.text: Zero star review! First and foremost, this is a difficult place to find due to it being tucked behind a bunch of semi truck businesses/building and other industrial machinery. To add to the level of difficulty the company office is even harder to find. I recommend calling the towing company for help. The owner of QR Towing LLC (Tomas) is a joke and he will not hear you out. Billing/reception team seem to be uneducated and do not know what is going on with your vehicle and payment. The girl that helped me was nice but lack customer service skills and basic social skills. The receptionist and I finish with my transaction and she didn’t give me an invoice/receipt or direction of my damaged vehicle to collect my belongings. Yet I had to ask her all those questions and she still was not sure of what answer to give me. In addition, she kept looking down and looking at her phone. In conclusion, this place is an absolute joke and every be safe out there, so you do not need to deal with people who are unprofessional and rude.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Eddie, we're very sorry to hear about your experience. We value our customers' feedback and are always looking to improve. Please contact us directly so we can discuss your concerns further.

reviews.name: Tavish Snow
reviews.text: My wife and I were on an adventure today for our 21st wedding anniversary, we were in the middle of the west desert on paved road  when our tire strut snapped after going over a set of horrible railroad tracks.  We got 5-6 other quotes, almost tried to rent a truck and do it our selves, but QR towing saved our day!  Our car was  90 miles 1-2hrs driving outside of where we live. Tom with QR towing is who we reached on our sixth price quote he was the best price by far.  Tom was professional and courteous on the phone and took our information and payment and was off to retrieve our car immediately.  In 4 1/2 hrs we have our car back Thank you Tom Best price, customer service and time.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Congratulations on your 21st wedding anniversary! We're so glad QR Towing could help save your anniversary adventure after encountering car trouble in the desert. We understand the stress of being stranded, and we appreciate you highlighting Tom's professionalism, courtesy, and efficient service, especially considering the distance involved.  Thank you for choosing QR Towing, and we wish you many more happy anniversaries!

reviews.name: Krystal Huntsman
reviews.text: After being stranded in the middle of the road by our insurance towing company. I called QR Towing to see if they could help. Tomas was super quick, respectful and understanding to not have any more damage to a Classic car with a broken tie rod. This company will be saved on everyone's phone in case of emergencies. Thank you for all your help!!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Hello Krystal and thank you for taking the time to share your detailed feedback! We are thrilled to hear that you have nothing but amazing things to say about our team at QR Towing LLC and that you'd trust us to help you in the future. Take care and have a great day!

reviews.name: Aj Broschinsky
reviews.text: Rude on the phone and hung up on me trying to find my car
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Hello. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. Please, contact us directly so we can gather more information about this incident.

reviews.name: Shon Schoppe
reviews.text: Illegally towed my car, cant leave a message, never answer the phone. did call me back from sms and said they would check with the driver but it has been many hours and no call. Worthless, unprofessional and irresponsible company. I will be sending complaints to every city and state official that will listen and has governing power over these car thieves.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
Hello Shon,
We apologize for any inconvenience that you experienced on our behalf. We do not do business this way. Unfortunately, even when we set out to not only meet but exceed expectations, circumstances can prevent success. We wish you and your family all the best.

reviews.name: Brock Warwick
reviews.text: As advertised. Adam answered the phone on the 2nd ring. Described how keys were locked in the car. He was there in less than 10 minutes with professional tools and knowledge to get the job done.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
We pride on being punctual at our job so thanks for the review Now responding to our reviews sometimes it takes awhile
Thanks

reviews.name: Carter Jensen
reviews.text: We tried multiple ways to get our vehicle out, they held our vehicle hostage for 3 weeks. The driver William drove my vehicle off the tow truck when there was no oil in the vehicle, the phone representative Dakota cussed us out over the phone. They are truly an unprofessional company.

reviews.name: Mariah Ergovich
reviews.text: Brandon Melendez is who helped me….nicest guy from the jump. I was on the phone actually, he just basically took the keys as he saw I was preoccupied. Did what had to be done and sat there I was done on the phone and then said I’m gonna go take care of this for you. I’ll call you shortly, i got a call in the morning from the tire place my car was already done they had all my info it was for sure a great experience.

reviews.name: Karen Banta
reviews.text: Brandon Melendez towed our truck to the dealership. Kept me updated via phone calls. He was very courteous, friendly, knowkedgable, educational and pleasant to work with from the start. Thank you.

reviews.name: Jill Taylor
reviews.text:
This is the absolute worst company I have ever worked with. We were in a dire situation and they were no help at all!!!
The lady that answers the phone has the worst customer service skills I have come across. She was very rude.   I will never deal with them again and would suggest you don’t!!!

reviews.name: Mike Loveless
reviews.text: Rude office personnel on the phone! Horrible communication! Drivers are not very knowledgeable nor friendly! All this company cares about is a dollar and heck with customer service. I recommend using any other tow company and avoid Ogden Auto towing at all costs!

reviews.name: Alex Miller
reviews.text:
The owner  is a rude person  . He started  to  cuss  once   he picked  up the  phone  The only reason  was  that  I  was calling  on Saturday  coz I know that  some  towings  work  on weekends and sometimes  24/7
I would  never call if I didn't  need some help  on the highway
So I recommend  not  to use this  service  and  this rude guy

reviews.name: Aaron Roberts
reviews.text: The dispatcher lied on the phone failed to show up  at the agreed time, even though I called ahead of time. Then lied again just kept saying the driver is on the way several times. So 7 hours later never actually did anything. The dispatcher just didn’t care. Should be Bollocks not Bullocks .

reviews.name: Julie Christiansen
reviews.text: I love how kind and detail oriented everyone at Wolford's is! When I went in for my quote they took the time to explain everything that would need to happen. I was so surprised when I got a phone call that they were finished because it was days before they had told me!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you, Julie!  We love it when we can deliver a car early to a customer.  Hopefully you won't need us anytime soon, but keep us in mind if you do.

reviews.name: Brandi Butler
reviews.text: Marvin was amazing showed up quickly and helped me out so much!! I’ve made sure I have saved his company’s number in my phone so that the next time I ever need help, I know who my tow truck driver in the red superhero cape will be!!!

reviews.name: Thành Triệu
reviews.text: My car's lower ball joint popped off and I was fortunate for Marvel Towing to towed my car by to my house. Jodey the phone operator was very professional and caring to make sure I was OK. Juan the driver was a really cool dude. We had a good conversation about cars (he's a car guy), so that help eased my stress during the moment a lot. He went extra to nicely put my car in the garage so I can work on it. Overall, Jodey and Juan are very professional and easy to work with. Heaven forbid me for having to call a towing company again, but if that were to happen, Marvel would be the one.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Good afternoon Thanh. Marvel Towing is pleased to hear Jodey was able to take your call and make sure you were ok. Then she sent Carlos out to save the day. Great team work to them both. Thank you very much for leaving a wonderful 5 stars review. We will be here anytime needed.

reviews.name: Larry Griffiths
reviews.text: TJ was my driver that was assigned to help me with my dead battery. He came within 35min of my phone call, what can I say, he was great, had me on my way within 5min., that so I could get to the dealership for a new battery!! Awesome job, TJ
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Hello Larry. Way to go TJ! We are glad he was there quickly and got you back onto the road in 5 minutes to get a new battery at the dealership. We appreciate you leaving him a 5 star review. Thank you!

reviews.name: Brianna Sanzenbacher
reviews.text: I put in a request through AAA to have my car looked at because it wouldn't start. Marvel towing called me within 5 minutes of placing the service request and the person who helped me on the phone was very nice and willing to listen. I explained I had to be to work by 2, and she told me she would get a driver there immediately even though they were busy.. Anthony showed up within 20 minutes. Anthony helped replace my battery, but he also fixed a few minor things that he didn't have to. He was such a huge help and also pointed out some things I could repair on my own for a low price. I really enjoyed having him service my car and would 100% use this towing service again. Thank you guys so much!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Hey there Brianna. Awesome team work Marvel Towing!  We are happy to know Amber was able to dispatch Anthony out to you in a timely manner, especially knowing your needing to get to work. Great job to Anthony assisting and always going above and beyond to help his customers. We love the fact that that you would 100% use us again. Thank you very much for the 5 stars!

reviews.name: Mike Miner
reviews.text:
These guys are always great!! I couldn't find anyone on my insurance plan who would come out to replace my 6-year old battery, then called around myself and couldn't find anyone!

Of course Marvel (McNeil's) came through and not only that, they arrived within an hour and the person on the phone (sorry I didn't get your name) was super-friendly and helpful.

TJ texted me to inform me how far away he was, and showed up with a smile before taking me through my options. He not only replaced the battery quickly but checked the alternator too. I can't believe how easy these guys are to deal with after all the phone calls to other places I made. Thanks for the peace of mind!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Good morning Mike. We are happy to know Amber with dispatch was able to answer your call and get TJ headed out your way. Then TJ was able to get that new battery installed and check your alternator too. Anytime Mike we will be here for you! Thank you for the 5 star review!

reviews.name: Bruce Lithgow
reviews.text: Parking enforced capriciously and sporadically at the private building where I live. No way to reach a live person by phone. No restrooms on premises. No Apple Pay/phone payment options. “Automatic” exit gate not working. Second time a friend was towed in two months. The first time we were able to reach a live person, and she did not explain that there would be an additional charge for using a credit card. I had to get someone else standing there to pay for me, and I Venmoed her bc they do not accept phone payment.

reviews.name: William Reiter
reviews.text: Towed my rental car on a Saturday night despite parking pass being displayed.  Held car hostage until I paid $400 charge.  Showed them parking pass in car when I picked it up.  They told me I would have to file appeal, which I did, but they didn't respond to appeal, emails, or phone calls.

reviews.name: Sessi Fletcher
reviews.text: Really nice and professional woman on the phone line. Was friendly and prompt even during Saturday night after-hours.

reviews.name: Heather Leilani
reviews.text:
Con artists. I wasn’t gone more than 20 mins at an apartment complex in downtown SLC and my car was towed. I called the # on the sign while thinking it had been stolen but checking the tow co anyways and the lady on the phone (Ariel) was absolutely rude and disrespectful. She stated it would be $380 to get my car back. I said the sign says $145 and she yelled, “Well ALL the signs are wrong!” She said the longer they keep the car the higher the fee. I had to take the bus to get there before they closed at midnight. I had to use rent money to get it out so that I can still make it to work so that I can still pay bills. This place is an absolute sham running a con on every single person they’ve preyed on. Also, the sign says “Slickrock towing” and when you call they’re “Legacy towing”.
4188 s 300 w, Murray UT.
This is absolutely criminal!!
Also, they charge an additional $75?fee for picking up after hours - when you towed it after hours! I was there within a two hour window of them towing it.
Likely have scouts earning a few to call your car in.

reviews.name: Lexi
reviews.text: They get a bad rap as they are just doing their jobs tbh, accidents happen but really they didn't damage my car. I wasn't supposed to be parked where I was, and they made the process of getting my car back pretty fast. Took awhile to answer the phone but answered my questions quickly

companies.name: Winterton Automotive Towing St. George Yard

reviews.name: Stitch 85
reviews.text: Very great service. They answered my call and got me going within 5 mins. Owen was a very knowledgeable guy about towing he knew his stuff. Phone customer service was great and stayed communicative the whole time before during and after the towing. Would definitely recommend these guys to anyone needing tow service.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks so very much, glad we could help. Refer a friend , Best Advertising out there. Review was terrific & helps so much. We appreciate you!!!

reviews.name: Debra Torgensen
reviews.text: I contacted 5 tow truck companies before l called Tow U Later. After taking a break from being frustrated from talking to monotone, rude, and uncaring people, I called Tow U Later. It was such a pleasant surprise to talk to Owen. He answered his phone sounding happy and cheerful! He was caring and helpful by listening to what l needed. Towing my truck "went off without a hitch!" Owen knows his business. Very professional and great service! Thank You Tow U Later!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
You rock , your review is perfect and helps the business so much.
OUR MOTTO: Bringing Integrity Back to Towing! 
Tell a Friend, Best Advertising out there. Thank you Kindly :-]

reviews.name: Melene Ralph
reviews.text: They towed my van to the repair shop. I was out of town and they made it so easy. I gave directions by phone and they did exactly what I needed.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: What an awesome review, you are appreciated🇱🇷. Refer a friend , best advertisement out there. Stay Safe.

reviews.name: Stefanie Lecomte
reviews.text: My daughter was in an accident, her car was towed by matt. He was beyond helpful, he helped is when our insurance wouldn't, answered the phone every time we called, he helped us with thing he didnt even need to, he went above and beyond. I would recommend matts towing to everyone!

reviews.name: Sam Robertson
reviews.text: Matt gave me a quote over the phone and stuck with it even though the mileage was more than expected. Great service!

reviews.name: GM Instrument Cluster
reviews.text: Absolutely amazing service from Matt.  Always answers his phone right away and is extremely friendly to talk to and work with.  Always on time and the prices are awesome.

reviews.name: Tyler Banks
reviews.text: I called  to schedule  a tow truck to move a classic car 3.2 miles  and google  says 9 minutes.  1st they want to charge me 235.00 and pre-pay. What a joke. They  wouldn't  even  answer the  phone  just wanted to  do business  via text. Do yourself a  favor and  spend  your money  elsewhere  !
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
This review refers to a request involving a 1930 Model A — a vintage vehicle that requires specialized equipment, flatbed towing, and the skilled care of an experienced operator. These types of jobs go far beyond what a simple mileage estimate or a Google Maps time can reflect.

Although the individual did not proceed with the service, we provided a detailed quote and responded professionally — as we do with every inquiry.

To protect our time and resources, prepayment is required prior to dispatch. This policy helps us avoid prank calls, no-shows, or cancellations, which directly affect our ability to assist real customers with urgent needs. Many of our regular clients appreciate this because it keeps things efficient and reliable.

We use text messaging to streamline dispatch, but we are always available by phone for those who prefer to speak directly. Our goal is to keep communication clear, professional, and convenient for everyone we serve.

We proudly assist customers throughout Draper, Riverton, and Lehi, and we routinely tow classic, exotic, and specialty vehicles with the same level of care we give to fleet and everyday cars. Many of our clients return to us — not only for the service, but because they trust the precision, respect, and professionalism we bring to every call.

If you’re looking for dependable, experienced towing you can count on, we’re here when you need us. That’s the standard we proudly maintain every day.

reviews.name: Tyson Osborn
reviews.text: Needed a tow for a good price. Had a miscommunication over the phone which was not their fault but they accommodated and helped make it right. If I ever need towing again, there wont be another company I use. Thank you
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
Tyson Thank You very much for your nice  Feedback we appreciate it.
It was our pleasure to provide Towing service for you.

reviews.name: MJ Villafana
reviews.text: I thought it would be a hassle to have my vehicle towed but I was wrong it was painless. This company is very professional. They answered the phone right away, called me before arrival, and texted me confirmation of delivery. Charged me the quoted price (good price, very fair). Before we loaded up my SUV he even offered to try a jump one last time. He was very helpful and knowledgeable, great service. My vehicle was in good hands.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you, for your Five start review, we are Glad we provided you an excellent service.

reviews.name: Carsen Field
reviews.text: They will charge you 3% fee on a debit card which is illegal. This is only legal under credit cards under Utah Code 72-9-603(18)(a)(ii). When I called them to explain the situation, they hung up on me. I called them back and they told me because I did not enter my pin when paying (they don’t have a keypad) my debit card ran as a credit so they could charge me the fee if I am with Visa or Mastercard. This is still illegal. Here is what Visa.com says “While some merchants may have the option to process debit cards as "credit" (without requiring a PIN), this doesn't alter the nature of the card itself.
