Debit cards are still debit cards, and surcharging is prohibited for them, regardless of how they are processed.” When I told them that on the phone, they said if I call again they would file harassment charges and they hung up. I reported them to the FTC and UDOT and will dispute it with my bank.

reviews.name: Allison Foust
reviews.text: I had an awful experience with Snowy Mountain/Central Valley/Atomic Towing in Salt Lake City. First off, the signage where my car was towed from is confusing and can easily be misinterpreted—be very careful about where you park in this city! When I went to pick up my car, I was met with some of the rudest and most unprofessional employees I've ever encountered. One of the guys had his foot propped up on the dashboard and was scrolling through his phone, completely ignoring me as I tried to ask him questions about the situation. He didn’t even bother to look at me or acknowledge my concerns. The lack of basic courtesy and professionalism was shocking. I’d recommend avoiding this company if you can. They clearly don’t care about their customers.

reviews.name: Rochelle R
reviews.text: They were rude on the phone. Told me they would not talk to me about my car again. At 251.00 to tow a car,  they are thieves. I called at 7 am,  and they wouldn't release my car until 6 pm.there was nothing I needed except to pay the outrageous fees.

companies.name: STAR TOWING & RECOVERY (AND MOBILE LOCKSMITH SERVICES)

reviews.name: Michael Smith
reviews.text: Really awesome customer service. Our car ran out of gas on the freeway tonight. My wife is pregnant and it’s cold so I wanted to get some help fast. Every other company said it would take an hour or more to get to us. When we finally got in contact with theses guys, they were there within 20 minutes or so of us talking. The guy that brought the gas was already on his way to another place with a car already loaded up and he was heading the opposite way but, he still turned around to help us. He was very friendly on the phone and in person.  Hopefully I don’t ever need gas again or a tow but, I would call these guys first if I do.

reviews.name: Keri Blakely
reviews.text: AMAZING customer service from the initial phone call to when my car was dropped off to it's destination. No one wants to get stranded, especially on a Sunday when you are from out of town. If you are, I HIGHLY recommend that you call these guys.

reviews.name: Anika Allred
reviews.text: Terrible customer service the shorter bald guy that works the phone lost our business for life which is sad because we used you guys for years! Terrible people even more terrible service
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: SORRY TO HEAR THAT

reviews.name: Scott Clawson
reviews.text: Worst guys ever they will not answer the phone so i cant get my vehicle thinking about reaching out to the consumer protection board and making an official complaint as-well as with my HOA.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Our phone rings all day and night best number to call is 8017923189 or 8015698697

reviews.name: Carlos Puerto
reviews.text: Very dishonest people, they try not to answer the phone so that your vehicle is in their lots longer and the can charge more have put in 27 calls over a period of two days trying to get a hold of someone to get my car. Also there was severe damage to my car.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: We make our money by answering the phone so sometimes you may have to be more patient we may be helping someone else.

reviews.name: D. Neil Moss
reviews.text:
I haven’t used this towing service, but based on the driving of the tow truck driver, I would never use them. The driver cut me off in traffic and I held up my hands as if to say, “What are you doing?“  The driver felt it necessary to stop in front of me on the freeway, stopping traffic, and turn around and hold his hands up mimicking me and then made gestures of hitting his hands on his chest (as if to make fun of someone with an intellectual disability) and then blew me a kiss.  I don’t know if all their employees are immature but at least one is.  If you look through their reviews, you will find that this review is not the only one regarding poor driving.

Answer to reply:  Apparently Google won’t let you reply to a reply.  I appreciate that the owner wants to look into this - thank you! It was a white flat bed tow truck.  I-15 southbound a little after 4pm on Friday, Oct 11 2024, Maybe 4:15pm at about 106000 south.  The truck said Advanced Towing on it and after googling that name there were several advanced towing locations; so, I matched the phone number on the truck to this advanced towing location in order to leave an accurate review.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
This doesn’t sound like my guys. 
 do you have any information that help me  with out you giving my whole company a bad reputation, because if it was one of my guys I for sure want to take care of this. 

What kind of truck was it ?  What color?  Where was it ? What street ? Day and time ?

companies.name: UTC Towing. Grúas Para Carro-Español ( 24/7 tow & road-service ) Autos & Motorcycles

reviews.name: Tiffany Shults
reviews.text: I had to call for a tow truck after someone made an illegal turn in an intersection and completely disabled my vehicle. I could hear my driver literally starting his truck while we were still on the phone. I was amazed at the fast response I received on a Saturday afternoon. When arriving at the accident, my driver was so incredibly kind and helpful. I honestly never expected to be so impressed by service from a tow company, but I genuinely appreciate the kindness and help! Highly recommend Terry’s Towing. I would give more than 5 stars if I could. Thank you so much.

reviews.name: Natti Juarez
reviews.text: Super over priced tow $280 to tow it 100 ft. Super rude on phone, do not use this business. R and C towing much better.

reviews.name: mitchell bennn
reviews.text: Both times I have ever had to use Terry’s towing I have had an experience who is the rude male staff over the phone using profanity and being very rude I had to call today I needed a vehicle towed and I also have a simple question if one of my cars was there and he said we’re closed it’s towing 24 hours call back Monday I needed my vehicle towed and it’s 24 hour towing call back Monday needless to say I will be using a different service that doesn’t damage my vehicle and all of my stuff Isn’t missing when I pick up my car

reviews.name: Panda SLC (Panda)
reviews.text: asked if they took a card over the phone while I was to pick up my car and they said no, then I made a statement of most companies do and a couple employees and the lady started fighting with me over it. Stay away from them and their yard.

reviews.name: Marcia Hanson
reviews.text: Grumpy, disgruntled, irritated to be bothered by me...  Just called this place because it is less than a block from where I broke down, got an abrupt, unfriendly answer of the phone...  No one available immediately because the man was on a job for a couple hours.  I said that would actually be perfect because in a few hours I could take my lunch  and meet the driver.  She said something about we don't do timed call outs but I guess we could see if we can help you.  There was more conversation with her sounding disgruntled to be bothered by me so I finally said I would just see if I could find someone else to help me.  Good luck getting help from Terry's Towing...

reviews.name: Mike Ainsworth
reviews.text: Hard to get a wrecker at 7am on a Saturday, not only was south valley the only ones answering the phone, they arrived promptly, and were very flexible and professional. Got me out of a “diy brakejob emergency” and much appreciated. Reasonable upfront pricing too.

reviews.name: Lina Rincon
reviews.text: The person who answer the phone was so nice and help me. Thank you so much

reviews.name: Josh Ayre
reviews.text:
They price gouged me…$400 to perform an unapproved tow and one night in their yard.  There was no word about my stolen car from 2 years ago… until I hear from Pendleton’s that it was found and being held at their impound lot.  They demanded $400 to get it out -or- pay $150 for the tow and forfeit my title into their grubby hands -or- get sent to collections if I do nothing.

I totally understand they provided a service at the request of the police once my car was found and that they need to make a living…so why not charge me what’s customary…about $120-150 (I learned after making a couple calls).  I know the answer, because they can.

I hate to be rude but this is an honest description.  At the shop, a very unkempt “lady” ran the desk, a filthy man and child were glued to a phone screen and the whole place smelled rank.  I asked to please give me a break since this happened without my permission, but the “lady” was curt and refused to even talk about it.  I didn’t fight her…just paid up because fighting with a pig just makes everyone dirty.

Don’t use Pendleton’s Towing if you can help it.  There are plenty of decent folks to work with.  If you have no choice like me, I’m sorry you have to deal with them.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
Josh, I am sorry that you have felt the need to slander our company AND our employees over something that YOU could have prevented by picking it up from the apartment complex where it was found when the police officer called and told you or your daughter they had found your vehicle. He gave you/her the option to pick it up from there within a certain time frame or it would have to be impounded. 
Also, when doing your research on the pricing you failed to ask those other companies what the charge would be for a "police generated" tow not just a customer cash tow. Because had you they would have given you the same price you paid here. We are state regulated and we strictly follow by the R909 code that is put into place to protect you as the consumer. That is all explained to you in the Consumer Bill of Rights that not only you but your daughter were given. Also storage is done by a calendar day not hourly hence the two days of storage. 
I will also take the time to explain the FULL story to the public as you have left ALOT of details out. Our first contact was with your daughter and I took the time to explain all the steps she needed to know to get this vehicle out of impound which included having to go to the DMV to get an impound release. Unfortunately for her she was not on the title preventing her from being able to go get that release. She went back and looked at the vehicle where my yard manager helped her jumpstart the vehicle and he tried to charge the battery up for you guys while she was trying to get the release figured out. The next interaction we had was you coming in and slapping the title on the counter and telling me how "excessive" our fees were. You then said to me "I only brought $300 can you give it back to me with that" to which I told you "the bill is $388.94". Then I told you you needed an impound release and your response was " it is my vehicle I own the title why do I need a release". I explained to you that it was state taxed and there was nothing I could do until I had that release. Did you come in here and ask if there was any wiggle room on the bill? Did you actually ask me if there was anything I could do to help reduce that bill? No, you did not! instead what you did was come in here slamming things down and pretty much telling me we were ONLY going to get the $300. That attitude right there is what shut me down to the idea of even thinking about giving you a discount. You asked me what happens if you did nothing with the vehicle and that is when I told you that once we obtain our own title to the vehicle we would then sell the vehicle and whatever was left owing you would go to collections for. I then went on to tell you that if you didn't want to deal with it you could sign over the title and pay $150 of the fees and we would write off the rest and dispose of the vehicle for you. If answering your questions means to you that we were somehow trying to get our "grubby" hands on anything maybe don't ask the question. 
In your review you said "I hate to be rude" so maybe you should have not been!! I am far from an "unkempt lady". Being overweight does not necessarily mean someone is "unkempt" there are medical issues that cause my weight. So thank you for being like all the other bullies in the world that point those factors out and hurt feelings. You should be ASHAMED of yourself for calling someone a PIG!! Also there was no "filthy man" in my office! However there was a dark skinned gentleman here and have you ever thought that maybe it was easier and more professional of him to stay "glued" to his phone rather than to point out how your ATTITUDE was affecting our whole office or causing conflict with you. And last but not least our office definitely Does Not smell "rank".
So for future reference go pick your vehicle up when the officer calls you to do so. And maybe treat people the way you want to be treated! And please be kind to others you never know what they are going through!

reviews.name: Brayden Leavitt
reviews.text: Awful customer service when I called the lady who answered was very rude and unhelpful. It sounded like she was eating while on the phone with me and she was just very unprofessional.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Brayden, I’m so sorry to hear this. I will definitely talk with her. Were you able to get what you needed? Is there something further I can help you with?

reviews.name: Kimberly Clements
reviews.text:
My son's car was stolen in Salt Lake City and involved in a DUI incident with a police cruiser
We were unaware of this, .because we live in Nevada. When we were called to say the car had been found we tried to get information  ..was it damaged, etc.
We weren't able to find out anything. Whomever you initially talk to on the phone assumes that you know exactly what you need to know to pick up a vehicle. In our state, we don't need any forms ...just money.
We drove three hours to pick our car up, and the employees in the office,  once again, rude!! They said they didn't have on record that the vehicle was stolen. So basically,  we were treated  like we were the ones that rammed a police cruiser.
The level of unprofessionalism is off the charts!!
I guess in this business you don't need to be polite or treat people with respect.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: I am sorry this happened to you. I will be addressing this, thank you.

reviews.name: James
reviews.text: Highly recommended! The owner, Nathan, went above and beyond for us. We had broke down on 215 East traveling through Utah with our coach and called Pendleton’s for a tow to the closest service center. When he arrived to see what type of tow vehicle would be needed for our coach we informed him that it was now starting and we thought we could make it. Instead of charging us for coming out and just leaving, Nathan offered to follow us to the service center to ensure we made it safely and stayed on the phone to give us directions. Not only that but once we arrived to the service center, he kindly introduced us to the staff. You don’t see this type of service every day.

reviews.name: kitty print
reviews.text: Experience was great! Needed a Harley trike taken to repair shop. Lady answering phone was quick and pleasant. They showed up sooner than estimated. Gentleman took care loading bike. Good service. Thank You!

reviews.name: Z Icarus
reviews.text: Tried to mansplain things to me and my service dropped out during the phone call and left me horrible messages.

reviews.name: T.j. Kay
reviews.text: When I called,  the person who answered the phone was extremely nice and helped me calm down as I was stressed to the max! I ended up canceling because I got it started and was able to drive it to a place and wait for my ride. And then after I canceled, Tyler Winderlin called to make sure I was canceling and didn't need any further assistance.  Great customer service for sure!

reviews.name: Yazmin Badillo
reviews.text: I was told a driver would be at my location in 25 minutes after waiting for 40 in the cold I decided to call them and ask what was going on? Well, nobody would answer the phone and one time they answer and just hung up.

reviews.name: Jenn B.
reviews.text:
I had randomly picked up a huge nail and ruined my tire while getting my daughter from school. My specific car type does not have a spare- and the run flat tire was toast. I was able to limp my car to a gas station, and felt nervous about finding a tow during 5pm rush hour, and being left stranded with my young daughter. I called three different tow companies and all had a 3+ hour wait.
On my fourth attempt I found this tow company and was saved! The gentleman answered my phone call quickly and had a truck to my vehicle within 20 minutes. The car was loaded safely and quickly, and off to the tire shop for a replacement. Thank you!

reviews.name: Miles Anderson
reviews.text: Probably the worst customer service I've ever had to deal with.. driver can't speak a lick of English. Was impossible to find out where my vehicle was going or even get a phone number. Vehicle got impounded Saturday morning and was taken to Heber (I live in Springville) upon arrival Monday morning I was told I needed to wait an extra 2 hrs or possibly come back the next day (sign says open) so I called dispatch and they had him come in and realeas my vehicle next I tried to pay with my wife's debit card and he absolutely refused to take payment so the police showed up and they excepted my payment. What a complete waist of not only my time but local police officers as well. These guys are predator towing at its finest please be aware and have a great day
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
If it tickles your tummy saying all this lies then let it be,
1, your vehicle was Impounded for improper registration you made the choice we were not driving your vehicle just trying to take your stupidity on us,  blame us for your lack of brains, police and DMV can give you that information of were your vehicle is and you where there so you saw what company took your junk
2, you can't tell us how to manage our company if you need to pay with you wife's credit/debit card shows what a lack of man she has, my 6yr old has its one credit/debit card , your a grown adult.
3, if we want to ask for an ID to take a credit/debit card payment there's nothing wrong with that just making sure is not stolen.
4, we call the dispatch twice because not only you don't have brains but you also can't read we have signs In English and Spanish saying you can't going in and instructions , just like the police told you, because you did not call dispatch we did your lucky I don't press charges for trespassing we got you on camera 
5, your pice of junk was Impound in Wasatch County so it stays there. It's a state Impound 
6, you were crying over what you had to pay then now if we charge you for more time to tow it to springville I can't even imagine.
7, We treat people with same attitude we get treated. I feel sorry for you wife I could hear her over the phone trying to calm down a grown adult throwing a 4yr old tantrum grow some balls man, there you go have a Blessed Day.

reviews.name: torrie hollis
reviews.text:
NO STARS

This is the worst tow company I’ve ever dealt with! The driver/supervisor was incredibly rude and unprofessional. Around 8 p.m., we realized my sister’s car was missing. We had only been at my friend’s house for about two and a half hours. It turns out the tow company had been in the neighborhood the night before, which is how we figured out who towed the car. They towed my sister’s car from our friend’s driveway, claiming it was parked in the street, even though it was clearly on private property. Meanwhile, there were at least 7-8 other cars actually parked on the street that they left untouched.

When we called to confirm they had her car, the person on the phone was dismissive and even hung up on us. When we called back to ask if she could retrieve her belongings from the car, he gave us a hard time and said it would cost money just to get her things. This included essential items like her work laptop, inhaler, wallet, and other personal belongings she couldn’t wait for.

After some back-and-forth, he finally agreed to let her retrieve her items because they included money and medicine—without charging her. When we arrived at the tow yard, we called again, and he rudely told us we would have to wait because "they have lives too." Once they finally showed up, my sister said she wanted to take the car home. He then demanded $400 in cash to release it.

He also insisted on taking her car keys and asked to see her ID. At this point, I got out of the car because I felt the situation was escalating and my sister needed backup. As I walked toward her, he told me I wasn’t allowed back there. There was no way I was letting my sister go into a dark tow yard alone with a man who had treated her so poorly. After some heated words, he finally agreed to let me accompany her, as long as I showed my ID.

When we got to the car, he suddenly demanded to see her registration, which had never been mentioned before. He kept adding new requirements, making the process even more stressful. My sister sarcastically asked if he also wanted to see her social security card, and to our shock, he responded, "Well, do you have it?!" ARE YOU KIDDING ME? I should report them just right there for identity theft.

As she tried to grab simple items like her sunglasses and her backpack—which included her laptop, wallet, and inhaler—he told her, "No, not those," as if she wasn’t allowed to take them.

Eventually, we were able to leave, but the entire experience was completely unacceptable.

This company is completely unethical and predatory. Towing cars just to squeeze money out of people is wrong and should not be allowed.

I’ve contacted the HOA that employed them, the Better Business Bureau (BBB), and the City of Heber regarding their business license. I have also filed a complaint with the Utah Department of Transportation’s Motor Carrier Division.

reviews.name: Dallin Ball
reviews.text:
The entire experience to get a tow was a pain with this company. Our company vehicle went down and we called our insurance to pick up the vehicle at a hotel and transport it to a dealership. We were assigned this towing company and they proceed to tell us he couldn't find it in the parking lot and didn't take it. He then said the vehicle was "too large" for his tow truck and we needed a larger tow. We called our insurance and they changed the tow capacity to a medium size truck haul and guess who we got assigned to have tow it? You are right, VB Towing -- so he had the capacity to do it the first time but didn't.

Finally, 4 hours later, the tow showed up to the dealership. Had he just done it the first time we could have cut out half that time.

He would call us and hang up whenever he was done with the conversation. Extremally rude on the phone and text. Wouldn't follow simple instructions. Absolute terrible experience.

We would our insurance to drop them as a tow as they are not worth any of that experience.

reviews.name: Ana Gutierrez
reviews.text: "If I could id give it a zero but thats not possible so I give it a one". So rude on the phone call and refused to help us. Nobody should talk to a customer like that when all we needed was some help towing a vehicle. The guy on the line was so rude and disrespectful.

reviews.name: Maura Cheney
reviews.text: I recently needed a tow on the highway after my car broke down. I called VB Towing after receiving their business card and was very thankful to have their service. Adam, VB Towing's owner, was quick, responsive, helpful, kind, friendly, and efficient, everything you could ask for when you may be stressed over car issues. He was also extremely affordable and reasonably priced. VB Towing took my car right where I asked them and even sent a confirmation photo to my phone after delivering my vehicle. Adam started this business for a very good cause, and I was happy to support them. I am very pleased and thankful for VB Towing and will be sure to call them next time I need a tow. Thanks Adam!

reviews.name: Mykal Noah
reviews.text: Told me 45 mins waited 2.5 hours no show.  Had to call a tow from the valley  Lady on the phone was very nice though.  So +1 star

reviews.name: Jeff
reviews.text: I manage a fleet of vehicles and have used PC Tow for years. The drivers and office staff have always been great. I had 1 billing question (we were charged $860 for a tow from PC to Salt Lake - keep in mind the past 7 times we towed from PC to Salt Lake it was $450 consistently) and just wanted to know what caused the $400 price increase. The Owner, Thad, got on the phone to handle the matter and was one of the rudest and most unprofessional individuals I have ever worked with in my entire career; honestly thank goodness I never had to deal with him before. I simply was trying to understand why we were charged so much more and he said ‘it is what it is and if you don’t like the price, get lost’ - word for word. It’s not how you treat people and conduct business.

reviews.name: Jeff Hall
reviews.text: Hands down, one of the most helpful companies in the business. Not only did he come in a blizzard to try and get me out with a flat bed, but when that didn't work he drove all the way back in a blizzard to pull me out with his truck. Man is a blessing. I know a lot of people have mixed opinions on this place, but I'll never use another company if I get stuck in Park City. Can't stress enough how amazing it was to have him show back up after not being able to get me with the flat bed. Oh on top of all of this he never changed me more than what he said over the phone. If I could rate higher I would.

reviews.name: Tyler Haney
reviews.text: Just like every other tow company. Scum of the earth. 300 for 1 night. Absolute disgrace. Lady on the phone absolutely disgusting.

reviews.name: Holly R
reviews.text:
Had two jump starts in one day. Paid $150. Very overpriced and they can get away with being rude and expensive because they are the only game in town. The manager I delt with on the phone had no customer service.

The positive was Adam - he helped me out the second jump start and he was honestly great. He is the reason for 2 stars instead of one. Thank you Adam

reviews.name: Bethany Snyder
reviews.text: Bob was awesome! Driving our truck too fast, pulling our 30 foot travel trailer, with bikes, kid and dog, our radiator hose busted on Hwy 40, in the middle of nowhere. Bob answer the phone, contacted a mechanic, and then towed our truck and camper to the mechanic. He was professional, on time, good hearted, and in great spirits. He was like an angel in the desert. I wish there were more Bobs.

reviews.name: Vincent Schulte
reviews.text: Answered the phone came and pulled me out of the snow. Very nice guy the price is what it is.

reviews.name: Lu Eason
reviews.text: Please do not make any phone calls to this repair shop, because they will charge you hundreds of dollars if they do not do any repairs to you, and then lure you to their shop, and finally tell you that you need to wait 3-4 days
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for your review, Lu. Bar M Diesel & Automotive Service values each customer and aims to clarify service expectations before any work begins. Please contact us directly, as we’d like the chance to discuss your experience and address your concerns.

reviews.name: lu guo
reviews.text:
If I can give them 0 star I will do it…
Last Friday afternoon my driver found the trucker has leaking oil issues so we called this shop and they said we need to pay first otherwise they were not waiting for him to repair. So we paid over phone. Once we got the shop the guy checked like 5 minutes then he made call like 40 mins then told my driver they didn’t have the part couldn’t help us to fix. My driver asked how about the payment it should be refunded the guy said payment NOT REFUND!! WHAT?? We didn’t get any service and we drive the truck to his shop on ourselves they didn’t even tow my truck and provide any services then charge me OVER FOUR HUNDRED BUCKS! FRAUD IT’s FRAUD! They said it’s their policy even no service still need to charge!! Charge for what? Charge on when driver there the guys spending on the calling with someone else??
I will complain the BBB and CFPB to report it!
DO NOT COME HERE TO SAVE YOUR MONEY!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for your review, Lu. Bar M Diesel & Automotive Service values each customer and aims to clarify service expectations before any work begins. Please contact us directly, as we’d like the chance to discuss your experience and address your concerns.

reviews.name: H. W.
reviews.text:
On 09/26/2024 we got stuck with our 13-ton RV truck in the damp clay on the Pruess bank. We called BarMDiesel and asked for help. After sending the location and a photo, we received a quote for $5,783 (+ $202 service fee). Shocked by the high price, we inquired about the basis of the calculation. There was no fixed price, 6.5 hours had been estimated, of which 2 hours each for the journey to and from the site and 2.5 hours for the recovery. If it took longer we would have to pay more, if it was less we would get our money back. After our payment was confirmed, the driver was sent to us. On time, 2 hours later Austin arrived and had us recovered after 20 minutes. We informed the service immediately and asked for a refund. We received the answer that the journey had now taken 3 hours each way and that we would therefore not get any money back. They wanted to call us back again, but this has not happened to date. We wrote an email and still received no reply 4 days later.
To summarize, we can say. We were very satisfied with Austin, who gave us professional and fast help. The advisors on the phone were also friendly and we have no complaints about the service in general. We would have awarded 5 stars for this.
The price as such was a shock and seems disproportionately high to us. However, even this would not have led to a rating, as we agreed to the contract.
The disappointment that led to the poor rating is based on the fact that price components were explained to us and we were promised a refund for fewer hours, which was subsequently rejected for absolutely incomprehensible reasons. In addition, we have not even received a reply to our written complaint in this regard. What a shame!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for your review and for recognizing Austin’s prompt and efficient service! We apologize for any misunderstanding regarding the hours and the refund; however, based on our records, the travel time did exceed expectations, which impacted the final charge. We received your email on the 27th, but our office is closed over the weekends, which is why a response was delayed as it was. We’re committed to resolving any lingering concerns and have reached out to clarify—please don’t hesitate to reach out for further discussion.

reviews.name: Marti Rae Di iorio
reviews.text:
BAR M DIESEL & AUTOMOTIVE SERVICE are life savers...Wed nite 9pm and broke down..and we and our On-star rep called literally 23 businesses in and around Beaver,Utah..this company not only answered the phone with a friendly real human ( TEARA) but towed us and tended to our every need and got us on the road safely ..THIS COMPANY IS THE BEST..THANK YOU TO...Teara...Austin for towing us late at night and to our mechanic Cody...God Bless you all.
5 star service!!!
Dennis & Marti Rae and Mia Di iorio
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Marti, we are so grateful for your kind words and 5-star review! We are thrilled to hear that our team went above and beyond to help you out in such a stressful situation. It's our pleasure to be there for our customers, especially when they need us most. Thank you again for choosing Bar M Diesel & Automotive Service!

reviews.name: Janece
reviews.text:
A few weeks agoit was just around 8 pm/dusk on a Sunday evening as myself and my three young kids were headed home and about 15 miles from Beaver when I realized neither off my headlights were working! We pulled over at the first Beaver exit and to make a long  stressful story short of checking fuses and bulbs with mixed results, I was given the business card of Bar M Diesel & Automotive butther gas station attendant. I called the number and it was answered very promptly by Dustin(I believe this was his name- I apologize if that's incorrect I was a little frazzled worrying about being stuck there at night on a weekend) I explained what was going on and he said he'd be right there as he actually walked up to me with a smile.

He'd just finished another call and jumped right in to check things out. It turned out I had one blown bulb and one that had a connection but it was tenuous at best. He eased my mind about what I'd thought might be corrosion on my connections for my bulbs and told me he was pretty sure he had my bulbs back at his shop and he'd be right back.

Less than 20 minutes later, just long enough for me to grab some food from the refrigerated section in the gas station for my kids, he was back. The new bulbs were put in and checked and then he made sure everything was put back in place and ready to go for us. He had also found out while we were talking over how I'd learned to pull things apart and check them, that my husband was deployed and so he'd decided not to charge me for the bulbs or his time, even when I tried to insist! It is people like Dustin and this great company that restore my faith in humanity and small business. I hope to never need a tow, but if I ever break down near Beaver Utah again, I know just who I'm calling.

TL;DR- Dustin was caring, knowledgeable, quick, honest, and a true patriot. If I or anyone I know ever find ourselves in the area in need of vehicle help I will be calling Bar M Diesel and will be keeping this card in my glovebox and their number in my contacts on my phone. I highly recommend Dustin to anyone stranded on any night, but he went above and beyond on a Sunday night for this mom in need. Thank you again for your excellent service!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for the kind words!

reviews.name: Rebecca Phillips
reviews.text: No one ever wants to NEED a tow, but if you do, call these guys. My car broke down and this was the 4th place we called - they were not only super pleasant to work with and reasonably priced, but they showed up quickly, were super efficient and did exactly as we asked. I’m definitely saving them in my phone if we ever need help again.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for your 5-star review. Thank you for letting us assist you today and will be here if you ever need us again.

reviews.name: Dorsell Tully
reviews.text: The lady that answered the phone is rude and yells. She always like that, so I won't be using their service. Overall, I'm pretty sure the mechanics are more professional than her. She did yell...she didn't spoke up. Always been rude in the past too...not the 1st time....
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: I believe you are the person who called me twice back to back with the telephone on speaker and I listened to you talk in the back ground for 30 seconds.  I spoke up to try to get your attention.  Sorry that I do not sell used parts.

reviews.name: Sheldon tohtsonie
reviews.text: They did fix what i wanted but bad communication and people skills. The owner heather needs to hire someone who is willing to pick up the phone and speak with people. Not the service i wanted. Left my passenger window down and unwilling to help get it back to how i left it. I am not happy.

reviews.name: jessica swafford
reviews.text:
I’ll tell the truth since you can’t apparently…. Went to the shop on a Friday and was told that the job would Only take three hours on the repair to bring it Monday they would get it done for us. We brought it in on Monday morning to have the repair done Monday at 4 o’clock I called to check to see what time I could pick it up since I had dropped it off at at 7 AM that morning had not heard anything at four pm for a “3 hour repair”. She told me that they were almost done with the repair, but they would not be able to test it to pick it up in the morning. I told her I’d go on lunch at one that I would come and pick it up at that point never heard anything come my lunch point by lunchtime. I also called with my calls being rejected. so I went up to go pick it up to get there to find out that he had my axle out and had just started. But yet she had just told me as I came in that he had been working on it since yesterday the mechanic told me that he did not get to it yesterday because he was on a tow that he just started this morning at 9 AM mind you this is Tuesday they had had my jeep for for over 24 hours at this point and they knew we left Wednesday to go to Arizona and now had to take out The axle because he couldn’t get to the repair on the ground, which was fine if that’s what he needed to do to get it done then fine… he was also trying to figure out where to put the new axle mounts out. My husband told him where to put them showed him what to do. He sured us he would have it done even if he had to stay late, He said that he would have it done in a couple hours, but now that he knew where to put it. “It wouldn’t take that long”. Come 4 o’clock still no response. I had called multiple times once again She was ignoring my phone call so we drove up there. My husband sat there cause I was worried about them leaving without giving us the jeep back because we had a trip the next morning. I asked her multiple times both times I was there what the cost was gonna be and she would not give me a quote or a price. I had to go pick up my son-in-law so I picked him up at 6. I get a phone call from my husband and he tells me that I need to come back so I did I come back to get a $1184 repair on what supposed to have been a “three hour” job she lied to me again said that the mechanic had been there since 6 AM when the mechanic had already told me that he has started at 9 AM that morning she kept consistently arguing with me about what time he started when I had already was given the time by the mechanic multiple times she wanted to lie she wanted to argue I paid the $1184 and I won’t be back. I did let my boss know because her vehicle is in there and once again they lied to her on the days that it was gonna be done and what they had been doing, but yet she had told my husband at the same time that they had they weren’t getting the parts until the next week, but yet was lying to my boss about when they were gonna start the car that they were already almost done and what not they are liars. They will use people do not trust them. Since this is a small town they will do what ever they want bad mouth other shops in the process. If you want to pay a outrageous price to fix your car this is the place to take it. They are the most dishonest people to go to.
And BTW you didn’t do any discounts. And since you want to say it had been repaired temporarily on a trail and was down for a couple weeks waiting on parts. I should have taken it to the other person cause I wouldn’t have been screwed over.

Can’t stand behind a business that one person can lie and scam people out of their hard working money and screw over even veteran just for their gain.
I was lied to multiple times on my car repair and then charged and outright insane price even had to pay for an extra part they broke. This place won’t get my business ever again nor will I ever recommend anyone to take anything there unless they can’t drive anywhere else. I sure hope the welder that did my work got some that money since he was the only one that was honest with us.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Just a little back story on this repair...the vehicle had been down for WEEKS, the customers had been speaking to another business in the area and when that fell through, they brought us the vehicle on Monday morning, knowing that they had plans to travel very early on Wednesday morning.  This is a modified Jeep with after market coil over springs put on the front end that had broke the shock mount on the drivers side axle.  Someone else had attempted to repair the break previously.  When we got the vehicle it was determined that to do the repair correctly (customers husband whole heartedly agreed) the axle would need to be removed to get the mounts put back in square and correctly.  One of the brake calipers broke during removal (not uncalled for in a 130,000 Jeep).  The caliper had to be replaced to get the vehicle back in working order.  We had 2 mechanics that stayed an hour and a half after we were closed to finish the repair (customer's self inflicted emergency, not ours) Customers were also fully aware of this, they were standing in my office for about 2 hours after we were closed....  Customer was NEVER lied to. She was quoted a very low repair cost by the other company that opted not to do the repair.  We had over 14 hours of shop time tied up in this repair and we only charged them 8.  No price gouging was done, just a customer's lack of understanding of what it was going to take to repair their vehicle correctly.  Not to mention the 20 phone calls and 4 drop in visits as we had the vehicle here. We even offered to let them split the bill in to 2 payments, they are living locally right now.  They declined that.  Yes, it was an expensive repair but it was done correctly so they won't be right back where they were when they came in.  Vehicles modified with aftermarket equipment are different to work on than stock and that has to be factored in.  I felt that not charging the full amount of shop time that was taken up was a fairly good veteran's discount.  Hopefully this customer has better feelings about business that she takes elsewhere in the future, not to our shop.  Her husband would be welcomed back, he was a joy to work with.  Thank you for your service sir.

reviews.name: Eshcar Kapoya
reviews.text:
Best auto repair service I’ve ever had.
From Heather’s understanding and care over the phone, (she named my truck just from me telling her of my problem) to Dylan’s smile as he came to tow us, to DJ’s friendliness to welcome us, as we got stuck there for a couple of nights over the weekend. And of course, Dominic’s professionalism, care, and patience. He answered all my questions, listened to all I had to say, talked with my former mechanic, and took such a good and thorough care of our truck that it sounds and drives better than ever!

Our engine couldn’t choose a better place to get stuck in. Honestly, if I could, I would always take my business to their shop. I feel so blessed to have met such modest and honest people on our way. Thank you and God bless you and your home.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: We're so glad that we could get you back on the road quickly.  Enjoy your tour of the area.  It was very nice to meet you.

reviews.name: Susan G
reviews.text: After having a great rafting trip on the Grand Canyon, my family and I were driving back to Grand Junction, Colorado.  As we were driving, almost to the turn off to the Valley of the Gods, our van just went dead.  We pulled off to the side of the highway and discovered we had no phone service. We made it back to Mexican Hat town and called AAA.  They contacted Quality Auto Repair and we were towed into Blanding, Utah.  "Dillon" was so very helpful and pleasant to interact with.  He put our worried at ease.  "Heather" went above and beyond for us, contacting a hotel in Blanding and helped us secure rooms for my daughter and her fiancé as well as my granddaughter and her boyfriend.  This all happened just prior to the 4th of July holiday.  Everyone at the shop fixed our van the next day and we were back on the road.  Our experience at Quality Auto Repair was amazing!!

reviews.name: Jamie Varnell
reviews.text: Amazing and friendly!!  Stuck on the side of the road, on my bday, at least 60 miles from where I was staying, as well as 7.7 miles north of Monticello. The driver was quick and friendly.  We went through a 3rd party company---DO NOT DO THIS!!  But I am so thankful the towing company was great to work with.  I will make sure I have this towing company name saved in my phone incase I ever need them again!!

reviews.name: Ellen
reviews.text: My suv battery died in Monticello Saturday morning.  Not only did Mike problem solve with me over the phone as he was already out on a call, he saved me a walk to Napa for a battery charger.  Then he sent another kind person within minutes to jump my car.  Since my battery wasn't holding the charge and I had a five hour drive home they lent me their charger without hesitation.  I am in awe of their professionalism and consideration.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for the great review! Mike is always trying to go the extra mile to be there for someone that needs help!

reviews.name: Grace Sulzman
reviews.text: Multi car Towing LLC - I would give 0 stars if possible. Absolutely abhorrent, predatory behavior and blatant discrimination and disrespect by the employees we dealt with. We parked in a lot labeled for restaurant customers. We had to go across the street for to pick up a meal for a member of our party that had dietary restrictions that could not be accommodated by the first restaurant, with the intent to order food from said first restaurant for the other people who could eat there. Another person in our group has a physical disability (clearly marked by a permanent handicap placard in the vehicle) so it took a little extra time to return back to the car. In that less than 10min, we returned to an empty parking spot with only tires marks remaining. We called the listed phone number on the sign and were met by rude, unprofessional behavior during this stressful situation. Information was not clearly provided on how to obtain our vehicle and no assistance was provided in navigating the situation. When asked how we get to the lot without a car, we were told to just order an Uber through garbled speech that sounded as if the employee was intoxicated and we were hung up on multiple times. Despite posted signage that credit cards were accepted, staff would only accept cash, which we felt very uncomfortable with, especially when arriving to a desolate lot with no employees present. Unfortunately, even after paying the exorbitant fees ($12 for gas for a <10min drive, $42 for being in the lot for less than 20min, $75 for being towed on a weekend, $201 for towing, etc), our vehicle was disfigured by a large sticker on the window making it unsafe to operate the vehicle due to impaired vision through said window that was completely unnecessary as the sticker said there was a boot in place, which was untrue. Not only were we not treated with basic human decency and understanding, but we were blatantly discriminated against for having a handicap placard and out of state license plates. Disgusting behavior. DO NOT GIVE THEM YOUR BUSINESS.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Miss you are reviewing the wrong business, remove it and place it on the correct business name.

reviews.name: Kaitlyn V
reviews.text: I have premium coverage, which was suppose to cover any roadside assistance. Told over the phone that I would not have to pay a penny. I waiting for the tow truck for 3 hours on the side of a busy road. By the time the service was finished he said I had to pay $250 dollars for the tow. I called my insurance company to figure out why I’m being told two different things, and they informed me they do not know why and that they would help me at that moment. The tow truck driver started getting restless and started to get aggravated with me threaten to impound my car with in the next 5 minutes. Before I could get answered from my insurance company, he forced me to pay within the next 5 minutes or he would leave with my car. Then tries to charge me twice for the tow, Luckly I saw it went through and he ended up having to put more paper for the receipt. In all, it just felt like a scam. Will never use this service again. We ended up having to wait months to get reimbursed by my bank who investigated it.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
Sorry that you had to go over this, but you are not telling the whole story here. If this was a police call, it is handled Totally different that a private call. Unfortunately, not all the facts are described in this review. And it is a fact that I don’t work with any 
insurance

reviews.name: Sunni Hobbs
reviews.text: Quick tow saved the day yesterday for my broken down vehicle. Gentlemen on the phone was just that- a gentleman, and communicated wait time and costs clearly. Gerald came out to do the towing and he was a delight, so funny and professional. Thank you!

reviews.name: Levi Ackerman
reviews.text: They sound rude and just unhappy. Pretty bad customer service. Their ETA is completely off, and just hang up the phone when they're done with you. Highly would not recommend

reviews.name: Ryland Abeyta
reviews.text: very poor guy on the phone hung up on me when i asked about my tow fees told to me blow myself and call back when someone cared

reviews.name: jonas piraquive
reviews.text: The guy just pick up the phone and ask me about my car. He said I’m not interested and hang up. Worst service possible

reviews.name: Amber Fox
reviews.text: We needed a tow at an inconvenient and unexpected time. Quick Tow was fast, friendly, and professional from the first phone call to delivering our vehicle to the repair shop. Edgar showed up quickly, got right to work, and made us feel at ease. If needed, we will use Quick Tow in the future without hesitation.

reviews.name: Carlos Trujillo
reviews.text: All it took was just a phone call and I can tell I was getting rip off
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
Carlos, Its 6am.  So you left the review at 5:15. I think you made a mistake on the company.   We sent everybody home yesterday because I had to think over the fuel cost at $5.05 a gallon.   I had the phone.  No towing performed last night.
I think you have mistaken us for a company on the same land, in the same storage yard.. you were towed but it wasn't us. Promise.  please check your receipt, then remove review.

reviews.name: Giancarlo
reviews.text: The guy I talked to this morning was very disrespectful from the very first moment he picked up the phone. I needed a tow from the University of Utah to South Salt Lake and first he wanted me to get an Uber. He was telling me to do it, although I wanted to ride along to the destination where he was taking my vehicle. He wanted me to leave my car keys in the vehicle telling me how safe the neighborhood is. Then I call him for a second time and he starts yelling over the phone to CANCEL it. He CANCELLED my tow that I had already requested because it was too complicated. BS! VERY UNPROFESSIONAL! IF YOU DON'T HAVE RESPECT FOR YOUR CUSTOMERS BETTER LOOK INTO A DIFFERENT BUSINESS! I will definitely give you a zero rating if I had the opportunity to do so

reviews.name: Cameron Ledesma
reviews.text:
Sketchy business practices. Booted my truck for parking at McDonald’s for ten minutes with intentions of going into McDonald’s. I don’t care about the $75.00 dollars they charged me. I’m more upset because they take a sign to your door. My truck hadn’t been washed that day. Left micro scratches in the paint. I called the company and asked for a manager. I got Peter on the phone. While I calmly tried to discuss this matter, he promptly got loud and said “you were going to the liquor store, I’m not listening to that, you can suck my d**k.

Real professional Peter. I would avoid using these guys as a service. I would also steer clear of the McDonald’s on 450 South and 200 west in downtown slc. I’d consider it entrapment.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: The whole story? Cameron parked his truck in a tow away zone marked with large signs and walked away....   Cameron was booted instead of towed. Much cheaper at $75 fee than $250 if towed.   Cameron called us up today and started into insults and implied that Larry Miller group was "going to get me".   I explained that we have the video, he made a mistake in parking where McDonald's doesn't allow parking for liquor store...   Cameron then started into creative f*** bombs and threats.  Not exactly the story that Cameron is portraying.   It's unfortunate that a  person  who clearly parks under a large 2 foot tall no parking sign, will not own that decision and turns to point the finger at the businesses.  Video is captured.  Signs are everywhere.  Have a great summer, Cameron.

reviews.name: E Dazley
reviews.text: Professional on the phone, was told it would be a two hour wait time. Still waiting six hours later with no word on what is going on. I understand if something more urgent came up, but it would be nice to know that so I don't spend all day waiting for a truck that isn't going to come
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: It's an imperfect world we live in....   I'm certain everyone scores 100% at thier career everyday.   In the Towing business, we balance emergencies and chaos with every phone call.    Having to choose whom gets help first? The car in the driveway or the person on the freeway?    You're never going to please everyone.   We try!!    We would of understood if you needed to get something more urgent to remove the abandoned car from your driveway.  Glad it all worked out.

reviews.name: Bryson Richins
reviews.text: Terrible service. The driver told me he could do but then told me he couldn't he was also swearing on the phone at me and then told me he was not interested in my business. If there was less than one star I would do it.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
Now lets tell the whole story....Bryson has a 1993 Saturn with no tires that he wants hauled away tonight, December 2nd at 11pm at night.    Understand, Bryson  is not hiring me to haul it away,  he is wanting his junk car taken away for free at Midnight.  He lives next to Mountains off Backus Highway at 7800 south in almost Herriman.
I explained I could come out in the DAYLIGHT and take care of the problem of installing the tires back on the junk car and hauling away the junk but that wasn't acceptable, he wants me out there at midnight in 20 degree weather... So I told him I'd have to decline the job tonight but we could help tomorrow....  so he yells EFF YOU and hangs up the phone ... Then leaves a review like this. I never swore at him, he sounds about 17 years old on the phone.
You are never going to please every millennial child.   Have a nice day!

companies.name: Salt Lake Towing | Tucker Towing & Recovery

reviews.name: Dustin Currie
reviews.text: I was busy so I paid early, and handled it all over the phone. He got the job done and sent me a picture to show my car at the dealer. Great!

reviews.name: Crystal Galache
reviews.text: These guys are awesome couldn’t get any other tow company to tow my moms motor home when her wheels fell off in the road. Called these guys and they were there quickly. Now it’s at their shop. This company’s # is already programmed into my phone cuz I’ll call them first if I ever need a tow.

reviews.name: Jim Calkins
reviews.text: After my insurance vehicle assistance line struck out with other so called 24 hour towing companies, Tuckers answered the phone even though their website said they were closed. After freezing at the airport for three hours, I was so glad to find a company that cares.

reviews.name: Brock VanZweden
reviews.text:
THESE GUYS ARE THE BEST, ESPECIALLY WHEN YOUR TO L NOT HAVING THE BEST DAY WITH CAR PROBLEMS, DONNIE SHOWED UP WITH A INFECTIOUS  SMILE AND ATTITUDE, THAT MADE MY SITUATION WAY LESS STRESSFUL.
THEY ARE SUPER FAST, PROFESSIONAL, CLEAN, AND ABOVE ALL THE LEVEL OF CUSTOMER SERVICEI RECEIVED IS UNMATCHED. THE TOOK REALLY GOOD CARE OF ME AND MY CAR. I'VE NEVER THOUGHT ABOUT SAVING A TOW TRUCK COMPANIES PHONE NUMBER IN MY CONTACTS BUT AFTER TODAY CMD TOWING IS IN NOW SAVED IN MY PHONE. IF I EVER NEED A TOW TRUCK COMPANY THEY WILL BE THE ONLY ONES I CALL.

reviews.name: Jonathan
reviews.text: I was blown away with these guys from my initial phone call to dispatch to the moment my truck touched down at the mechanic. Amazing staff, equipment, and price! And Donny is the nicest guy ever!!

reviews.name: Osiris Garcia
reviews.text: Donny was absolutely AMAZING! I had called about 8 different towing companies and all of them had refused to tow my car since it was stuck in a parking garage. I came across CMD towing and their customer service was INCREDIBLE. I don’t recall the name of the girl who answered the phone but she was so nice. Donny came to my rescue within 30 minutes of calling. Highly recommend their service. Communication was excellent

reviews.name: G S
reviews.text:
Update: Management reached out and it sounds like it is a known issue for Austin. Hope he no longer is a representative for this good company. He gives them a bad name. Would reconsider using them with a different driver for sure.

Would not recommend. The 2 people who answered the phone were very professional and friendly. Was told the driver was going to contact us for our location. Austin called us and we caught him saying we weren’t worth the trip. He was extremely rude and short with us! Seemed like he didn’t want to do his job. Called us to let us know he was coming after 45-50 min. We tried to start our car again and it worked. We called him to let him know about our situation and he said “are you kidding me!?”. We could’ve just left and had him come all the way because of how rude he was but we wanted to give him a courtesy call that his services weren’t needed anymore (thankfully). We’re glad we didn’t have him tow our car. We already didn’t feel comfortable with someone who felt like it was a burden to do his job.

reviews.name: Ky
reviews.text:
Called to get a quote because they advertise their starting rate at $85, today is a holiday so I assumed it could be more. He quoted me $155 and I decided to call other places for quotes. Simple phone call. However, it’s the harassment of texting after that is what is awful business practice! He texted me letting me know that they can do cheaper for tomorrow. I said we needed it today and it was 4.8 miles away. I said I didn’t want to pay his price and thanked him. This is when he become absolutely rude and unprofessional.

I get letting customers know a different day is cheaper/affordable. But to continue to berate them after they said no is absolutely wild to me. Plus continuing to be rude after and asking for a receipt is even crazier! Why would I need to prove that a company is helping me out!?!

Make sure you call around and don’t take this companies prices. I found a company who would only charge me $55 for my towing. There are good people out there this one is no one of them.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: We appreciate your feedback and understand your frustration with the communication you experienced.  We strive to provide excellent customer service and would appreciate the opportunity to discuss this further.

reviews.name: Efrain Gomez
reviews.text: Zips towing couldn’t make any money off of me so they cancelled my towing service (literally told me over the phone ) ; since it was thru my insurance they didn’t want to tow my truck and cancelled the whole towing while they where one the scene after the insurance company told them exactly what they where getting into , super unprofessional, and they already have the worst reputation in Saint George , to top it off I’m not even from here

reviews.name: M P
reviews.text: Towed our legally parked car from in of our home. Saying it was parked in a fire lane. Then they dong answer the phone.

reviews.name: Joel Owens
reviews.text: Honestly the absolute best experience I've ever had with a road service company. I blew out a tire and within minutes of hanging up the phone they had Zach out to my truck. He was extremely professional, very friendly and quite possibly the fastest tire guy I have ever met. Also the price was incredibly budget friendly.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Joel, thank you for sharing your fantastic experience with us. We're delighted to hear that our service was the best you've ever had. If you ever need assistance on the road again, don't hesitate to reach out.

reviews.name: Luke
reviews.text: Thanks guys for their help!  Jimmy and on the phone in the office to the guy.  My truck stalled, there was a problem with the diesel supply, everything was repaired.  Thanks
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for the feedback. Take care and have a great day!

reviews.name: Kimberley Miller
reviews.text: We ran out of fuel about 4 miles north of Beaver. Made the phone call to these guys and they were out to us in about 10 minutes. The young lady that came out to help us (Whitney )  with her flashing lights and smile, had us fueled and on our way in about 6 1/2 minutes. If you ever run out of gas before Beaver, this company is the one to call!!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Kimberly, thanks for your 5-star review of our towing and roadside assistance company! Take care.

reviews.name: Marie Peterson
reviews.text:
By far the best experience I have had with a mechanic. My car broke down on the side of I-15 at dusk and I was alone. Anytime Road Service and Repair came out and Skeet was amazing! He made me feel safe and well taken care of.  Over the next few days, when I was working with Shaylee and Jace over the phone to get my car back and running, I felt they went above and beyond to get my Audi running right.  My car is back and running better than ever!! If the option to select six stars was available I would select that.

I hope if you ever have your car break down it’s near Beaver Utah!! Best car service I have ever received. Thank you!!!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: We're so glad to hear this, Marie! Come see us again if you ever need our services in the future!

reviews.name: carol calixto
reviews.text: Friendly over the phone but couldn't help us.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Hey Carol. We want to thank you for rating us and wish to learn more about your last visit! Please don't hesitate to call us: (435) 438-5376. Our team hopes to talk soon!

reviews.name: Young Ind1
reviews.text: Worst place EVER. The guy who answered the phone hung up on me as I was trying find out info about when I could pick my car up. He know refuses to answer the PHONE!! Highly recommend NOT USING THEM.

companies.name: Rocky Mountain Collision of St. George

reviews.name: Eric Haymond
reviews.text: The staff is very friendly.  Be sure to schedule an appointment to get work done as they are very busy.  It took just over a week and a half to repaint the roof of my vehicle when they said it would be done in 5.  When I called after 6 days the person on the phone said they were just about to paint it.  It almost seemed like once I called they started to move faster (and I turned annoying and followed up each day after that).  They were waiting for the windshield guy to put my windows back in at the end (which took two days).  When I got my vehicle back, the window glue was all over my windows and tool box.  Pretty bad job.  I didn't see it until I left.  I ended up scraping the glue off myself because I didn't want to deal with having my vehicle gone again.  I could have been more patient but when you say 5 days, mean it by delivering on that.  When it gets closer to 10 days, that's just terrible service especially when I have to call to get an update instead of receiving a call or notification if anything has changed.  Clearly this place is busy, but having better follow up on the services being done to the vehicle would take a minute each day.  People would appreciate it.

reviews.name: Brock Norman
reviews.text: Brent and team were great. Very courteous and kind over the phone and in person, and they were able to get me in sooner than anyone else. They were able to diagnose the issue quickly and communicate the problem clearly. The issue with my vehicle resulted in a pretty deep and involved repair, which they completed quickly. I appreciate that Brent and team were willing to discuss a few options for the repair and help me with a good long term fix to avoid another potential repair down the road. If I ever run into future issues or repairs, I will call up Zion Motors again. Thank you!

reviews.name: Meredith Harward
reviews.text:
I just wanted to let you know how extremely happy I was with the towing experience I had with Zion Motors this morning.
I had a tricky spot that I needed a tow out of and David was there within minutes to help me. He was so skilled and knowledgeable about how to get me unstuck and was very reassuring through out the tow.
He even took extra steps to support my car very carefully keeping the undercarriage of my car in tact, miraculously!
The phone staff are also so friendly and helpful.
These are top notch people at Zion Motors!
Thank you all for making my day today.

reviews.name: Gerald Yowell
reviews.text:
If I could I’d give no stars for this review. My experience was not worth my time or the money spent and I wish I could go into depth with it but it won’t allow a long review so in short I had my truck towed into their establishment only to be LIED TO AND THEM STEALING THINGS FROM MY VEHICLE AND MANIPULATED AND CHARGED SURPRISE FEES AFTER BEING TOLD I OWED THIS AMOUNT BUT WHEN I GOT THERE ITS A WHOLE NEW AMOUNT AND CHARGE A TOWING TAX ON TOP OF THE TOW FEE AND THEY SAY THEY ONLY CHARGE THAT ON VEHICLES BROUGHT IN FOR REPAIR BUT NO REPAIRS WERE PERFORMED ONLY DIAGNOSTIC BECAUSE THEIR DIAGNOSIS WAS ENOUGH TO BE QUESTIONABLE SO I HAD ANOTHER SHOP LOOK AT IT AND MY SUSPICION WAS CORRECT THEY CLAIMED I NEEDED 2 injectors when I only needed 1. And they quoted me an amount for 2 injectors that I paid the other shop for all 8 new ones. I’m sure Zion motors employees are very knowledgeable but in my experience I have no doubt are just as dishonest and I can not support such and will never go back. It makes me wonder when reading all reviews that there are positive ones and negative ones and I think to myself either the positive ones are manufactured by friends or family of employees or the persons leaving the reviews just didn’t have a clue or didn’t have valuable things they could steal or didn’t have excessive repairs needed. It’s quite questionable. But your choice if you choose this shop and their staff me personally will never go back.
In response to your response my problem with your shop isn’t the fact that 1 or 2 injectors were or weren’t bad it’s that your diagnosis verses someone else’s is at question and they replaced all 8 under my orders because I’d rather replace all 8 at the price of your 2 and not have to come back again to have others replaced later and spend more money that I didn’t have. And it’s ok if you don’t agree with me I know your shop is dishonest and tech’s as well and as for the man I talked to on the phone he was very disrespectful and unprofessional telling me how he felt about me and my complaints and living situation and so on. And telling me I was a bad customer from the get go. If that was true why not just turn me away from the very beginning? I appreciate your response but I don’t believe you know what your talking about and or care to know where I’m coming from and I wished you knew all of why you won’t get my Business because of the unprofessional ability your employees have shown. Not that you care but I won’t be talked to that way and I’m sure you wouldn’t either.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
I'm sorry to hear you had a bad experience and feel you were not treated fairly.  I want to clarify a few things and maybe ease your mind. 
 I am quite confident in our 6.0 diesel diagnostics as we have sophisticated oem testing equipment.  This equipment allows us to identify injectors that are failing as well as ones that have failed. Someone using more basic equipment would only be able to find a completely dead injector. I also question why you elected to have the other shop replace all the injectors when they only found one bad one.  
I can understand why you felt like you were unfairly charged tax on the towing portion because the Utah tax law is confusing.  Unfortunately towing is only exempt from tax when no other services are performed.  You can see it explained here: https://tax.utah.gov/forms/pubs/pub-05.pdf   "Towing charges in connection with the sale or repair of tangible personal property are taxable. For example, a towing company responds to a caller who requests that the towing company tow his car to their repair shop and fix his flat tire. The charges for towing services and repair are taxable, even if separately stated on an invoice. "
As far as the item you said went missing from your truck (amplifier fuse);   While I have no idea how, why, when or where it went missing,  I am 100% confident in the integrity of my guys and know they would not have taken it. Our customers routinely leave valuables in their vehicles without issue.
I feel like our pricing is fair and holds up when comparing apples to apples.  Quality parts and a parts and labor warranty is what we offer.

reviews.name: Lennard Fuller
reviews.text: 7.3L Diesel Ford Excursion cracked the transmission case while going through Virgin River Gorge, Arizona late Sunday night.  Zion Motors and Towing were there within 35 minutes of the phone call, and had the vehicle towed to the shop soon after.  They located a remanufactured transmission, had the drive shaft/u-joint remanufactured and replaced the bolts that had sheered off.  The job was completed in a timely and professional fashion... and I didn't have a moments trouble with the vehicle during my 400+ mile drive home.  Over all, a job well done!  I highly recommend their services and would not hesitate to use them again.

reviews.name: BL Haughey
reviews.text: Wow! We are still dizzy happy over the service we received 3/16/2020 at Zion Motors on our 2004Jeep Liberty!! We made an appointment by phone, brought it in, got the valve cover gaskets replaced and picked it up the same day. Brent treated us right gave us a price, Bam done! What a delightful experience.Jeep runs great too. Pinch Me Please!! Thank you Zion Motors! Bonnie & Michael Haughey

reviews.name: Dave M
reviews.text: During a trip to Zion, we had a fender bender in the literal sense. We were steered in the direction of Jerry and his crew at Superior and after a quick phone call, we showed up with our problem. Not only was it taken care of quickly and professionally, but we got to meet Hercules, a giant lover of a dog. Everyone was friendly and helpful and they got us out of a jam, to say the least. Check them out!

companies.name: Auto Matrixx Collision and Towing: St George Autobody & St George Towing

reviews.name: Ben Stewart
reviews.text:
I will start this review off by saying that I am very particular about my car. I took my car here for a repair to the door. Other reviews were good and they were also the only shop that would get me in relatively quickly since it didn’t require any parts to fix.
As far as the paint and body work, I am happy enough with it. However, I cleaned my car inside and out before taking it for the repair and was disappointed with its condition when I picked it up. There were boot prints all over the dash and it was very dusty inside. I also found a door panel to be not installed properly, so it isn’t sitting right on the door. I also had a set of sunshades for the windshield in it when I dropped it off. They are nowhere to be found.
I also called a couple of times, once while it was there and once after finding things missing, and my call was never returned. I even left a voicemail both times.
Again, as far as the paint and bodywork done, I am happy with it. The disappointment for me is in how dirty it was, the door panel not being put back on right, my sunshades being gone, and phone calls with voicemails never being returned.

UPDATE: After posting this review my phone call was answered when I called to see when the panel could be fixed. No previous phone calls were ever returned. I received a phone call several hours after I went into the shop to ask about it saying it was done. They fixed the panel and were sure to wipe the car down inside when they were done. Later I found that the windows door lock button on the inside did not work. I had to pull the switch out to plug it in. At that point it wasn’t feasible to take it back for them to fix it as the car was in Indiana at that point. I also have noticed that there is a run in the paint along one of the body lines on the front door. You can’t see it straight on, but you can see it in proper lighting when standing up against the car. The car is now in Indiana, so it is not feasible to have it fixed unfortunately.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Ben I am sorry you feel that way.
A body shop is dusty and we did try and clean it after repairs to your doors were done. You left a voicemail on Friday after hours and I returned that call on Monday when I was back in the office. I would love to help make this right if you would like us to look at the door panel sometimes the clips don't clip back in the first time and we can adjust that.
As for the windshield covers I will look in the shops and ask the technicians if they were taken out for some reason and see if I can find them. Sorry to hear of your disappointment. Hope you will give us the chance to rectify.

reviews.name: Kailey Allen
reviews.text: 10/10 would recommend! I had the pleasure of calling these guys when my car decided to take an unplanned nap on the side of the road. Not only did they arrive faster than my last delivery from Amazon, but the driver was so friendly. He even helped me find my lost phone under the seat while we were waiting. The best part? I didn’t even have to wrestle my car out of the mud—it just magically lifted and got loaded onto the truck, like some kind of automotive wizardry. If your car needs a lift, these are the guys to call!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the awesome review we love our customers and it makes the job that much better when we here great things from our customers

reviews.name: Adam Petersen
reviews.text: This is one of the most predatory companies in Utah and that’s saying a lot!  Our vehicle was snatched in the middle of a triple medical emergency by these leaches.  They are cowards who won’t speak on the phone and then call the cops on you if you ask them how they possibly can feel right about interfering with health emergencies and kneecapping single mothers who have young children to pick up!  It’s criminal what companies like this are allowed to do to innocent members of the community.  I hope everyone lets them know we’ve had it.

reviews.name: izzy lock
reviews.text: park utah is the worst thing that i have ever had to deal with. refused to call me back claiming “they are unable to make or receive phone calls” but I had to call in the first place and was told to leave a message… make that make sense. they are extremely shady about how they go about things and they constantly make you jump through hoop after hoop.

reviews.name: Ethnee Swensen
reviews.text: Got new license plates and updated them in their system, yet they still booted me for some reason! I had an active parking permit at the time! Still had to pay the 75.00 fee BEFORE applying for an appeal that according to them is going to take 6-8 weeks to review! You can’t talk to anyone directly on the phone. I will be following up on that appeal.

reviews.name: Ben Brown
reviews.text:
My car was recently towed, even though I had the right to park there for 20 more minutes. When I told them about this, they said that my license plate appeared differently in their system (I have a screenshot of the visitor parking confirmation with my license plate printed correctly), so they refused to talk about it. I told the person I was texting that if they made me pay the fine, I would just dispute the charge with my credit card and have the money back in 10 seconds since I could provide documentation that they didn't have the right to tow me. He just told me he would note my case and to come in the next morning.

I started talking with the guy the next morning and he said that they could not release my vehicle without payment, even if the unjust tow was completely their fault. He then told me to begin the 6-8 week appeals process after I paid. I basically asked him why I would do that if I could just dispute the charge with my card? He didn't say anything. I just told them either they give me my car for free, or I'd pay for it with my credit card and charge it back. Again, he didn't say anything. So, I paid the $321 to get my car back (on my credit card), after which he finally chimes in and goes "you hereby agree to not initiate a chargeback, otherwise you will be subject to a $550 liquidation damages charge plus your initial $321 fine." For those of you unfamiliar, all credit cards strictly prohibit merchants from fear mongering consumers out of charging back. It is against all their agreements.

I mentioned this to the guy over text, saying they couldn't do that. Keep in mind, I hadn't went to get my car yet (rookie mistake, in my defense I didn't know I was dealing with the cartel here(for legal reasons that was a joke)). I then got a text that said "Benjamin, because of your THREATS of charging back through your credit card, we have refunded the $321 and you will be required to appear with exact cash to retrieve your car."

Wow. Not sure I could think of a more predatory business move. They knew what they did with the chargeback fear mongering was completely out of line and that I would win with the credit card company, so they strategically engineered a situation where I had to pay in cold hard cash.

I truly believe these are bad people, and it amazes me that even with the impressive amount of money they bring in (from extorting college students for egregious sums of money), they can't figure out a better customer service system. You can't speak to a live human being over the phone regardless of the hour, and nobody is ever in the office. UNLESS it is to retrieve $321 in cash, in which case some dude shows up in a really nice red truck that's a little too big for him (again, extortion pays well), and happily takes the money.

If you ever have the displeasure of doing "business" with this company, remember that you are dealing with terrorists who only have the worst intentions.

reviews.name: Grant Gwin
reviews.text:
Very unprofessional in how they handle things. I was booted in my stall that I pay for and had put my car information in and they would do nothing to help me out. Still had to pay the $75. When I called, a guy named Mike answered the phone and when I asked him if there was anyway he could help me out understanding that I did nothing wrong he said “I could pay the fine for you myself but I’m not willing to do that.” Very unprofessional company - not impressed.

This is my response to your response: the moment that I pulled in to my parking stall with my new car I went to the app and put in my new information for the car.
