The app had a place for me to add the vehicle which I did do and you can go back to the footage and see that I was stopped in my vehicle filling out the info the moment I parked there. The app said nothing about making it the primary vehicle or that I needed to delete the first vehicle and so I thought that after I had added my vehicle I was all set. Turns out I was not. When I called I did not ask Mike to personally compensate me - I asked if there was anything he could do to help me get my money back and he said that he could give me some of his own money but that he was not willing to do that - real professional.

Yes, it was a mistake that I made completely honestly - it was my stall and I did everything in my power to do the right thing but at the end of the day this company will do anything and everything to take your money and keep it.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
The compliance manager who returned your call and the help center representatives you've spoken with have patiently explained the parking violation to you multiple times.

The vehicle was parked without a digital parking permit on December 3, 2024, at 6:35 PM (MT), and enforcement followed the terms of the private property parking contract. According to your time-stamped audit log, you assigned the vehicle to your permit on the same day at 6:50 PM, after noticing the Smartboot® on your vehicle. As per the digital permit terms and conditions you agreed to, vehicles must be assigned to the permit before parking in the restricted lot. Documentation confirming this was sent to you via text on December 3, 2024, at 7:29 PM.

You've acknowledged that this was an honest mistake you made, which is understandable. However, requesting personal refunds from individual employees of the company is not appropriate. As a reminder, any official dispute regarding a parking fine will be handled by the appeals committee. The committee will carefully review the posted parking signs, the private property parking enforcement contract, evidence such as photos and videos of the parking violation, as well as relevant state or city ordinances, to determine responsibility and fault.

reviews.name: Aaron Roberson
reviews.text: I called to get information on a vehicle repair & the guy Dakotah was extremely rude over the phone it seemed like he just wanted to get me off the phone & was uninterested in any of the questions I had, it was very discouraging & for that reason I decided it wasn’t where I would be getting my repairs done.

reviews.name: Lauren P.S
reviews.text:
Absolutely never coming here again. I wanna start by saying I literally went out of my way to book out my oil service 1.5 weeks with these guys instead of going to Subaru Southtown which I could any time of any day bc Clark’s is closer and I had a desire to support a local business instead.

My appointment was scheduled at 9am for a simple oil change & tire rotation. They told me it’d be about 1.5 hours which is honestly longer than I spend at the dealership but whatever. I went and sat across the street at the park, 45 minutes go by and nobody has touched my car so I PAY 15$ to uber home and back to waste some time and grab my wallet. I come back at 11:40 and they haven’t even touched my car. No text, no phone call update, no sorry. Nothing. lol. Typical male behavior, lying, careless and just completely inconsiderate. Never again. Wasted money on Ubers and now I still have to drive out to Southtown and get this dealt with. Not to mention their prices really aren’t any different than the dealer. Maybe $10 which I just spent on my Ubers.

reviews.name: B
reviews.text: Less than two years ago I got a new short block, as well as new head gaskets, and quite a few other parts (brand new) from a dealership (name redacted, However, I think a car was driven into one of the dealerships buildings recently according to the news). The dealership told me to pick up my car. I drove it off the lot. Less than 15 minutes of driving my car was smoking badly, and broke down yet again. The tech that knew how to fix my particular vehicles moved, and they had extremely new, and seemingly untrained techs working on my car, and with that the biggest mistake ever made was done to my vehicle. He forgot to put the parts back together, and called as well as texted me to say my car was ready for pickup. Short story long... my car spent the summer at that dealership just getting everything new put in, only to have it go back to the dealership because of a mistake made on their end. After that chaotic summer, I googled trusted mechanics for specific vehicles in Utah. A reddit post asking the same question, and Majority of the comments praised Clark's auto, and it's workers. Women said they felt heard, respected, and the pricing was fair. Recently my check engine light came on, and I went back to the dealership, and initially they dismissed me, and told me to get an oil change (even though I had been getting them, and also recently enough got one at Clark's auto). Devon was incredibly kind, and helped every step of the way especially when I was unable to answer the repetitive questions from the dealership concerning my car. Devon was able to use the terms they used, and Brady even provided pictures explaining why my issue was actually a big deal. Devon told them he was hoping to help me get a reimbursement, or some form of financial help with my upcoming bill, because their products failed in my car. The dealership managers always changed their tone when Devon was on the phone. They appeared nicer, and their words were now simplified. It was funny to me how when Devon spoke, they were like... Well, I don't exactly know what that is, and both the service manager, and the dealership manager would become quieter. They also took back all their assumptions, and accusations after I shared with Devon what they were saying in front of everyone. Devon, and Brady informed them... They're still able to come to salt lake City to see anything they'd like; he didn't get rid of the bad parts yet. He also said he'd send even more pictures. He maintained a kind tone even though I'm sure this could've possibly been frustrating to him as well, because the dealership says everything is okay, then they'd blame something on someone else whenever he wasn't on the phone. Later, I received a phone call from the dealership stating they'd pay half of my bill. I went in to the building, and through negotiations we settled on them paying the remaining portion of my bill. I was able to pick up my car, and while driving it, after awhile (same day of pick up) it just wouldn't accelerate til it eventually just stopped. I had it towed back to Clark's auto, and they figured out there was a faulty part preventing my car from driving. They replaced the part, and did the service so I was able to get it back quickly! I was able to pick up my car after hours. They have a lockbox available for those that need their vehicle right away, and I guess for those that need to leave their cars after hours as well. Clark's auto is who you should do business with. Male, female, and non-binary people will feel how much Clark's auto cares about their work. Their parts are under warranty for seven years, which means they stand behind their work, and really want the best for you, and your car. They have phenomenal customer support, as well as, competent auto techs that have people double, and triple checking each other's work. I love that. Thanks again Brady for doing an amazing job on my car, and to Devon... Thank you (and your manager) for literally everything, and a bigger THANK YOU specially for being my advocate, and helping me through this tough period.

reviews.name: A B
reviews.text:
On an '02 Tundra had a ball joint shear < 10 mph (thank goodness). On the phone, Clark's very accomodating given that it was President's Day. Once dropped off by the tow truck they couldn't get it into the shop. Apparently the 1" of snow was too much to shovel and floor jacks weren't an option, so Clark's decided to charge me an additional hour and half of mechanic labor ($175) for a relatively simple ball joint replacement (I've done them before and I'm no mechanic). Not sound business practice. Prior to the work being completed I provided specific alignment specs which they said they could accomodate but upon pickup they said that their Hunter Alignment printer did not work and has never worked so I have to trust that they are in spec. While nice on the phone, I can't recommend this shop given their shady practices.

UPDATE: I had the alignment checked when I got summer wheels put back on and It required adjustment. Further, I specifically requested the front differential oil be checked by Clarks, given the leaking after the ball joint sheared and the related components came apart. Upon examination, It was extremely low and obviously an oversite. I will never bring my truck or any other vehicle to Clarks for anything that requires more competence than a tire rotation, and even then I will double check the torque on the lug nuts.

reviews.name: sara gonzales
reviews.text: Second time i have used Clarks. I brought the car in for one issue which didnt need repairingl however other issues were found. We spoke about those extensively on the phone. I agreed to all and the charges were the exact same as discussed. All work including new tires, alignment, 75,000 mile maintenance, power steering flush, new belt was done in ONE DAY. I drove the car and immediately noticed the car driving better than the day I bought it.  I love this auto shop! Devon was so great and kept me well informed.  Thank you Clarks!

reviews.name: Skyler W
reviews.text:
I thought I would give this place a shot because it was very close to my house compared to my other mechanic.

My brake pad replacement indicator went off in my car. I had them replace my brake pads and they called and told me my front rotors needed replaced. I hope they actually did and I didn't get scammed.

-1 star: They completed the car a day later than promised.
-1 star: They charged me an extra $100 because they had told me the wrong wheels over the phone. This wasn't brought up until I was picking up the completed work.
-1 star: Their prices are already high to start with.

I will be returning to my original mechanic. It would have been nice if this place was good because it was is so close!

reviews.name: Mara Perry
reviews.text: Traveling through SLC on a Sunday I had the joy of a flat as hell tire blowout. These guys were awesome! My tire was not fixable but they went over my options with me and I left happy. The whole crew there were super nice and put up with my slightly hysterical phone call from the side of the road to make sure they were open (Sunday in SLC not a lot of tire business open). Thanks so much!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: We are so glad you enjoyed your experience, Mara! Thank you for the positive review and we are excited to serve you again!

reviews.name: Christian Graff
reviews.text: Shaun was really helpful over the phone, in setting up an appointment, and in person. Great service and quick tire rotation.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: We're happy to hear you had such a great experience. We appreciate your business and hope to see you again soon!

reviews.name: Danny Watts
reviews.text: Got a good deal on 4 cooper tires. They had an issue with my alignment. Even though it took a long time to get it corrected, they kept me informed regularly and explained the issues they were having. While I was waiting I observed a lot of interactions, from the technicians teaching a new hire with patience and expertise, to customer interactions in person and on the phone. This location seems to have an honest hard working crew that takes pride in there work.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for the awesome feedback. We are happy you're happy. We look forward to continuing doing business with you.

reviews.name: Luis Sandez
reviews.text: Excellent and prompt service. Bruce was very efficient and courteous with phone and walk in customers.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Hello Luis, Thank you for the 5-star rating. We are glad you chose Pep Boys for your car needs. We look forward to servicing you again!

reviews.name: Erik Quijada
reviews.text: Service dept is terrible, a guy named Bruce was  total racist..bad attitude, I showed up and gave a different price than on the phone.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Hi Erik, we understand how this experience could be frustrating. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. Please reach out to us directly via email at pepsocial@pepboys.com so we can make it right.

reviews.name: Doug Hepner
reviews.text: My vehicle was impounded by Utah County Sheriff's department. They used abs for the tow from Payson to Spanish Fork. I called as soon as they opened on Monday 3 times no response, drove to the address that I was told my car was at by UCS (no car there), drove to Springville to the business address on Google (no car there). Talked with the owner at his residence, he tried calling his daughter 2 times with no answer! Finally I used another phone to call the #on the website for the 4th time and got a real pleasant lady full of excuses!  Then she gave me the correct address to where my car was, I drove back to Spanish Fork and waited another 45 min for her to finally get there. This whole situation took over 3 hrs and 450.00 dollars..... I wouldn't ever use this company for any kind of tow, they make plenty of money off being in bed with UCS!

reviews.name: Chelsea Pfouts
reviews.text: A woman told me she would be 25 minutes, ended up waiting in the cold for almost 2 hours. She quoted me $198 over the phone and then sent me a bill for $218. I’m trying to wrap my mind around charging ME and extra $20 when she’s the one who took her sweet time. I called and asked where she was after the first 45 minutes and she said she needed to warm up her truck. For 45 minutes? Just be honest!!!!

reviews.name: Hannah Andreasen
reviews.text: We love cougar tire! After being quoted insanely high prices at multiple other mechanic shops (meinekes, computune, etc.) we stumbled upon cougar tire. They’ve consistently provided excellent service over the last couple years as we’ve taken both our cars in periodically. They are thorough and quick and so kind! My breaks were giving out in my car so I pulled into the shop and realized I had forgotten my phone. Rod got our car in immediately, let me use their phone multiple times to call my husband, and gave me snacks. You really can’t beat a cheap, quick, high quality mechanic shop that treats their customers like family.  We’re sad to be moving out of state!

reviews.name: Kelly Maynes
reviews.text: I came in a few weeks ago to get a flat tire patched and the patch did not hold. Rod was very kind over the phone and pleasant to work with. He helped me get a new slightly used tire back on as the valve was compromised and sent me on my way. I’ve worked with cougar tire a few times in the past and they are always kind I never feel like I am being taken advantage of or ripped off. Definitely would recommend:))
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Kelly, thank you so much for your business. We love working with you. Thanks for the kind review. Drive safely.

reviews.name: Audrey Rock
reviews.text: I had an amazing experience with the owner, Rod, and his staff. We have a company truck that wouldn't start. We were pretty sure it was the alternator. I needed a mechanic that could come to me and scheduled an appointment with them by accident, because they don't usually provide a service to come to you. The owner called to confirm my appointment and I explained my mistake. He asked if I had found someone yet and I hadn't. He told me he would order the part and because I was pretty close to their location, he would send someone out to me SAME DAY! I got text updates throughout the process of when the technician would arrive, when the alternator was replaced, and when the technician was charging the battery. Before they came out, I was sent an estimate to my phone that I accepted before them starting work. They did exactly what they said they would do, communicated often, gave me a super fair price and didn't even charge me to come out to my location, and paying was a breeze with a link sent directly to my phone. I will definitely be using them again and have already told a bunch of people about them. One of the owners of the company I work for arrived at the office when the technician was here working on the truck and said that he was very professional and doing a great job. He said he will definitely use them again as well! They didn't have to do any of the things they did but went above and beyond and got me out of a tight spot. Thanks again, Rod and staff!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Audrey, thank you so much for the kind review. You were wonderful to work with and we appreciated the work. Thank you!

reviews.name: Matthew Gessel
reviews.text:
Update: Major kudos to Rod and his team at Cougar Tire for reaching out to me and wanting to ensure my satisfaction. After going back to receive inspection services (free of charge), I can say that I’ve never had a business work harder to elevate my customer experience. It sounds cliche, but Cougar Tire truly went above and beyond. I look forward to returning for future business and plan on recommending this shop to my friends and family in Utah County!

Original Review: I had a great experience here previously—a tire alignment service, which they happily price-matched. I later returned for an oil change service, which their website says (on at least three separate webpages) comes with a complementary 21-point vehicle inspection. I called beforehand and made an appointment, confirming with the employee on the phone that a vehicle inspection would come with the oil change service. However, upon the completion of the oil change, I was informed that the well-advertised inspection no longer comes with the oil change service. Sensing my dissatisfaction, they were kind enough to check the tires and brakes but it was still disappointing since that was the reason I went there and not somewhere cheaper.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Matthew, thank you for coming in. We appreciate you as our customer and are grateful for the business. Thank you kindly for the wonderful review. We hope to see you in the future.

reviews.name: Elise D
reviews.text:
I made an appointment online for them to check out a slow leak on my tire on October 27th. The appointment was made for when I am in town visiting my daughter in college on Black Friday (November 25th). In the appointment section, I asked if this is something they can fix and to please reach out to me to confirm.

I never received a response so I called on Friday November 4th (2 weeks after making the appointment) only to find out that they are likely not going to be in that day (??) Despite the day being on their online scheduler (which they direct you to schedule online when you call in) it appears that A. They are not open and B. No one could pick up the phone or bother to email me to let me know this fact.

I asked for the manager to give me a call back on Friday morning to see what my options were and discuss this and as of Tuesday, November 8th, no one has called. I called them again today and the man who answered said that he gave my information to the owner but was not sure why he hadn't called me.

I can absolutely understand if they are closed in observance of a holiday - totally fine. However, they should have promptly called me when alerted to the online appointment to advise as such. They also should have responded to my email inquiry and responded when I asked for a manager to call me back. However, none of those things happened and for those reasons I cannot recommend this business.

reviews.name: Christopher Creveling
reviews.text: Probably one of the best towing experiences I've had!  I had to have my vehicle towed to my mechanic and they coordinated with phone calls with my mechanic since I was unable to ride to the shop.  I would highly recommend.

companies.name: Munnster Towing - Cheap Towing SLC Salt Lake - RATES STARTING AT $79

reviews.name: Kaylee Merrill
reviews.text: This is the worst experience i think ive ever had with a buisness over the phone. The guy answered an didnt say a name of the business. He literally said what when he picked up the phone.  I asked him if i could get a tow quote an he quickly said no i dont havw any trucks availible without. Me giving him any information. I said well its not for today an he cut me off before i could rinish an said No No trucks bye! An hung up. Im. Appalled at how incredibly rude he was . do not use this place they are very rude and unprofessional.

reviews.name: Noora Chingaliyeva
reviews.text: I had a very bad experience with this company. First of all they came 6 hours later than what they have told me because timing was very important at that time. I asked to leave the invoice in my car and they did not. I followed up with them four times afterwards and they still didn’t send me the invoice. I also tried to contact them via phone call and they were ignorant to email me that. And they were very rude. Never get service from this company. They don’t know how to deal with the clients at all.

reviews.name: Shauna Heddlesten
reviews.text: This tow company is not even worth a phone call. I set them up at 730 to pick my car up at 10 to take half a mile to a shop. They didn't even call when running late. Left me sitting in a hot car for over 40 minutes past pick up time. Then when I called they said it would be another hour.

reviews.name: Corey L
reviews.text: The gentleman answering the phone is extremely rude. I do not understand how this company is still in business with such poor customer service.

reviews.name: Chad Mangum
reviews.text: Called for a tow Friday around 3:00pm. They said text the address to them and abruptly hung up.  After an hour, no one had shown up.  I called again.  No answer. I called yet again.  No answer. After 3 hours, someone finally called me back to confirm towing.  By this point, I had already called another tow company and was back home relaxing. Terrible communication. I don't recommend this company. And they wouldn't give me much in the way of a price quote/estimate on the phone.

reviews.name: Josh Larkin
reviews.text:
I had a little bit of an issue with my truck and needed some body work done on it. I saw Dons had good reviews so I decided to give them a call. They were super nice over the phone and the lady at the front desk was nice to talk to, not like other receptionist that I have dealt with who just want to get you in and out the door and take your money. She was very nice. The guy gave me a quote and it was a little cheaper then what I was thinking so I decided to go with them. So far my experience has been very good. If it changes after they do work on my truck I'll update my review. But so far so good.
1/3/19
They finished the work on my truck and did an excellent job. I think I have found an auto body shop that I will be going to for the rest of the time I live in Cache Valley.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks again Joshua!

reviews.name: Aaron Booty
reviews.text: These guys are liars and lazy. I put my truck in with them after someone backed into my front driver quarter panel. It was with them for three times the quoted amount of time. Every phone call would end with a promise of a returned phone call and an update. None of them ever came, I would have to call every time to get the update. The morning of dropping off my truck I verified that they would be able to match the lining that was on my fender flares, the staff assured me that they could. The returned vehicle did not match even close. The staff member told me he would call the vendor who did the lining for them and call me back to see if there was anything they could do. They never called me back.

reviews.name: Ryan Yerka
reviews.text:
I usually take my cars to Shadetree Automotive off the 193, I noticed the west location on my way home and decided to try them.

Great experience!

Knowledgeable staff, friendly, answered all my questions and are prompt when returning phone calls. It’s not often you get that kind of care at an auto shop.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
Ryan, thanks for the fantastic review! We're so glad you decided to give our Shadetree West location a try and that it was a great experience for you.

We truly appreciate you trusting us with your business. It means a lot to know that our staff was knowledgeable and took the time to answer all of your questions. We always strive to provide that extra level of care, so we're thrilled to hear that it made a difference.

Thanks for being a loyal customer!

Best,
Braiden Reich
Marketing Manager

reviews.name: Beth Rhoades
reviews.text: I am very impressed with this location of Shadetree Automotive. My car was assessed and repaired in a 30 hour turn-around time. The staff were so friendly. I received a detailed report of the issues and was able to have a phone call conversation about the report prior to any working being done. I was quoted for the work to be done and then I received a detailed invoice helping me understand the time it took for each job to be done. I am very satisfied with the results and will bring my (15 year old) car here again when it needs the next service or repaire. Thank you for an honest job well done!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you Beth, we appreciate you letting us fix your transmission.

reviews.name: Vanessa Garcia
reviews.text: Wow where do I begin? Well first I called earlier in the week and spoke to a guy he didnt give his name just answered the phone "extreme auto". I explained i was calling for a price quote to have a fuel pump and filter replaced. I asked for the full price parts and labor out the door. He quotes me at exactly $259.09 out the door. I call back the next day to schedule the appt and an older lady answers the phone. Right away this lady is extremely rude and disrespectful. I tell her about the phone call with the gentleman the day before and so we continue to set up an appt and she says that i will need to drop off my vehicle in the morning and come back for it at the end of the day. I tell her thats not necessary its about a 4 hr job ill just wait there. She begins to argue and says no itll be an all day job. I ask why? She explains that the mechanic will need my car for an hr to diagnose it and see if the fuel pump is really the problem. I explain ive already had a diagnosis elsewhere and im not paying for another diagnosis to tell me the same thing. She says diagnosis is free. So again she says ill need to leave my car there all day. Again im not understanding why all day? She says after they drive my car for an hr and diagnose it they will remove the bad fuel pump from my car and attempt to locate and order the fuel pump and fuel filter, meanwhile my car is just sitting there. So i ask why can u not just order the part and i can bring my car once you have the part and we can do it then. This whole time this lady is arguing with me saying thats not how they do it. They will not order the part until THEIR diagnosis tells them its the fuel pump. I explain thats the only car I have and I wont be able to get back home and back to the shop in layton unless I uber or lyft mind you im in riverdale. I just dont understand why my car has to sit at their shop taken apart for however long it will take them to locate and get the pump in hand and why they have to do their own diagnosis when ive already had one done. Whose to say how long it would even take for them to get the part. So i go ahead and take a chance and hope it doesnt take longer than a day that ill be without my vehicle so i schedule the appt. She calls back 20 mins later and says the guy gave me the wrong price quote that he only quoted me the parts not the labor fee and that the price just went from $259.09 to $5-600. Im like no I asked him for the quote out the door and verbatim he said "pump, filter and labor out the door $259.09" I even explain i have it on recording because of situations like this i have an automatic phone call recorder installed. She began yelling saying too bad that she will not honor that price. So i told her fine, then cancel the appt and I hung up. I have never been so angry and so disrespected by a customer service person in my life. That lady should not work there because she very clearly does not posess professional communication skills. If there was any way I could I would file a huge complaint with management but according to her the shop is run by only 2 guys. I do not recommend that you take your vehicle here. Yes their prices are cheaper however you get what u pay for an apparently cheaper prices with them mean an extremely unprofessional and a very rude customer service experience. Unfortunately i was unable to get any names because they answer the phone simply with "Extreme Auto".

reviews.name: Rebekah Kidder
reviews.text: This guy answered the phone within moments. Was super fast and worked around me being unprepared. He even hung out while we were waiting for the key to the car. And their prices are some of the best in the city!!!!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
Thank you for your review Rebekah . It was my pleasure to tow your vehicle and it was very nice meeting you . If you ever need a tow in the future please give us a call .
Thanks again , Top Notch Towing

reviews.name: Tony S
reviews.text: Great service and prices. I read through the reviews before I called and they lived up to all of the good referrals. They quoted the price over the phone and stuck to the price. It was comforting to use an honest company.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
Thank you for your review . It was my pleasure to tow your vehicle and it was very nice meeting you . If you ever need a tow in the future please give us a call .
Thanks again , Top Notch Towing

reviews.name: Bobbi Sargent
reviews.text:
I had no business with this company, but when one of their drivers passed me aggressively on a snow covered RESIDENTIAL street, I decided to call. "One of the owners" doesn't seem to concerned with his driver. Another "owner" has now called me several times to argue with me and have absolutely no concern for the situation. After I text him not to call me back anymore he calls again to let me know he has my plate number. AND?! IS that a threat sir? What of my plate number? I was already on the phone with #UtahHighwayPatrol when he passed me.
Apparently they will get to you fast and take care of business regardless of the rain, sleet or snow covered street. They care that much! 💙

reviews.name: Cynde Anderson
reviews.text: I broke down hauling horses with my Chevy diesel. I waited at the local Chevy dealership at 8:00 for them to open as it said they were open then online and they didn’t have an answering machine on the phone number listed. When no one showed up to unlock the gates at 8:00 I looked on Yelp and found May Automotive. By 8:15 the guys had me on the books and I was back on the road by 1:00 that afternoon!!! I cannot say enough about how helpful, knowledgeable and friendly this shop is towards stranded travelers.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you so much for this review. It was great meeting you and we were so glad we were able to help you. We hope you make it to destination safely 🙏.

reviews.name: Jessica Denevan
reviews.text: Went to May Automotive to pick a vehicle up from impound, the guys were super easy to work with. Provided them the information needed and got the vehicle with no issues. Super helpful on the phone when trying to get information as to how to go about getting the vehicle out of impound.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Jessica. Always happy to help where we can to try and make a bad situation better as impounds are often not as straight forward as other jobs we do. Glad you made it back safely & Take care.

companies.name: Ford Commercial Service Department - Performance Ford Truck Country

reviews.name: Adali Anderson
reviews.text: Best prices in town! I just junked my car and sold it to them for $300. There was a tow fee of $60 but I've never heard of a tow fee less than $100 so I was happy! Other company's I called around to offered me $150! So definitely the better deal. The only reason I give 3 stars is because the customer service could be better! The person I talked to on the phone sounds like he hates his job! And the tow truck driver was almost an hour late!

reviews.name: Dean Anderson
reviews.text: They had exactly what I needed.  They answered the phone, and verified that they had several of the model and year of car I was looking for.  There was no charge to wander around their lot looking for parts.  Their prices were amazing, and I walked out with exactly what I needed.  I'll definitely go back!

reviews.name: Glenn Day
reviews.text: Never have what is needed ever though they say they do when on phone,,then you go in to them and then find that no parts available..

reviews.name: Denise Perkins
reviews.text: Ricky's towing responded to an accident that my son & I were in. The car was taken to their storage yard. We have been trying to get our car moved since 9/9/20. They refuse to answer the phone @ the tow yard & the body shop! My insurance agent has even gone over to have the car moved. They refused to take an insurance check, personal check or debit card from her, they would only accept cash! It is now 11 days later & we have no idea where our car is! I will never allow Ricky's towing to touch one of my cars ever again!

reviews.name: Zack Grob
reviews.text: Preston Watts does high-quality, professional work while maintaining friendly, personal service. I recently had two windshields replaced by them, and they were fairly priced and did phenomenal work. They are great both over the phone and in person, and I highly recommend them for any glass repair.

reviews.name: Jenny Tanner
reviews.text:
Recently I thoroughly smashed up our new car and shattered the back window by backing up quickly without looking, and hitting another vehicle.  I felt sick and highly stressed at such a foolish mistake, and was full of uncertainty what to even do.  Several long phone calls with the insurance company only heightened my distress, and I began to wonder how we were ever going to figure out the mess I’d made.

I went to Preston Watts Collision and Glass just after the incident simply because they were the closest ones.  It turns out that was a VERY fortunate decision.  Josh immediately assessed the situation and put me thoroughly at ease.  He was sympathetic and knowledgeable and assured me they would be able to work directly with the insurance, which they instantly did, taking a major burden from me.

When he realized I was worried about going without a car until things were sorted out, and not having rental options included in our insurance, he offered temporary solutions so I could drive the car until they could clear the repairs.

He was instantly available whenever I had questions, and the entire office bent over backwards to work with our schedule (as we were out of country during much of the process).  They also were extra sensitive to our wishes and preferences at all times.

Our experience was SO positive and smooth and reassuring, I’ve told everyone I know that we will always go to Preston Watts!!  Their customer service is exceptional and they do exactly what they say they will.  I’m so thankful for their help during a very stressful time.

reviews.name: Bb Gg
reviews.text: Wost tow company in Cache county.  They will tow your car without your permission.  They will then hold it hostage.  Even if you have personal items in the car you want to keep like a keepsake that grandpa gave you before he died they won't let you have it.  They charge excessive towing fees.  It's extortion.  Once they take away your wheels they don't even bother to notify the owner so the fees keep adding up each day.  Beware if these guys they are a bandit tow company.  They take what isn't theirs to take.  They are not AAA nor BBB accredited and approved.  Kery will give you a terrible attitude over the phone even when you are down because a terrible thing just happened to you and you are still recovering from it.  These people are thieves.  Don't let them touch your car and only stick with tow companies that are AAA approved and you'll do fine.  They will tow your car and leave no information about where exactly they are taking it to.  They are not very transparent about their costs, fees, or other options you have.  AAA members get towing for free.  Can you imagine they charged me $175.00 to tow a car a few blocks less than a mile away!!!  That's extortion.  Then they hold the car hostage and everything in it.  In contrast I have my own tow truck driver who only charges $75.00 flat rate anywhere in the valley.  These people are vultures.  Bandits, thieves, thugs, lowlifes, what ever you want to call them they are not of God.  Kery and his gang of tow bandits are greedy low life's that take what isn't theirs to take.  These people need to be shut down.

reviews.name: Shani Dutton
reviews.text: Love the owner but, his employees never answer their phone! 😂
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for your review. We apologize we’ve been hard to contact. There are times we’re busy helping another customer or on a call. We will work on being more available 🙂

reviews.name: Hakan Berke
reviews.text:
I do not disagree with what other customers say about Ballard Auto Wrecking.The Best customer service on the phone and very honest person. Affordable price _very cheap.Thank you guys for helping me out to repair my car.I highly recommend you to go there.
Hawk

reviews.name: F R
reviews.text: Superior A+ Customer service!! Helped me find the parts I was looking for and shipped out same day. Highly recommend even if you are from out of state and placing an order over the phone. Will definitely reach out for more parts. Thank you!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
Wow, F, thanks for spreading the love! It's great to hear you had an A+ experience with our customer service. We pride ourselves on helping people find just the right truck parts, whether they are for salvage trucks or otherwise. Shipping them out the same day is just part of our commitment to ensuring you're back on the road as soon as possible. Regardless of whether you're in state or ordering from further afield, hearing that we come highly recommended for our used parts is music to our ears.

We'd be more than happy to assist you with further parts in the future. Reach out anytime! Thanks, Salvage Express.

reviews.name: Leland Washington
reviews.text: Salvage LLC had a part that me and my mechanic couldn't find. I cannot mention a better experience with a company selling used parts. Raye(?) the office woman on the phone went above and beyond helping ensure I was getting the right part, making sure to send pictures and staying in contact while I waited for approval from my mechanic. She then stayed later to make sure to send the part out as soon as possible since she said the place was on her way home. She was a godsend and this company is great to work with. Thanks again!
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
Hey there Leland! 

We're thrilled to hear that your search for used parts led you to us at Salvage Express, and that the truck parts you needed were available. We take great pride in our extensive selection of salvage trucks and their parts. 

Reading about your interaction with Raye made us smile! She embodies the above-and-beyond service that we strive for and she will certainly appreciate your kind words. It's indeed her passion to make sure our customers get exactly what they need. 

We understand the urgency when it comes to getting your trucks up and running again, and we're glad that our immediate shipping process proved helpful to you. Your positive feedback reaffirms why we do what we do!

Rest assured, we will continue to work hard to make sure your experience with us stays top-notch, helping you locate even the most elusive truck parts. We appreciate your recommendation proof of our commitment to excellent service. Looking forward to assisting you with your future truck part needs! 

Thanks, Salvage Express.

companies.name: Ford Commercial Parts Department - Performance Ford Truck Country

reviews.name: Travis Phillips
reviews.text: Ive been going to TJ'S since they opened in 2007. They have been ABSOLUTELY amazing for 16 years. Ive had the owner and managers phone numbers. They have left weddings in Provo UT and many family events for me and my family in a heartbeat. They are very fast, professional and courtious to everyone I recommend for them. They have went down to the shop on Sundays for me at least 15 times in a heartbeat. The employees are all amazing. But a special shout out to Trent, Doug, Chris, and Garrison. Theyve all been there mostly from day 1. And never let me down! Thanks guys!

reviews.name: matt hodges
reviews.text:
I have never seen such blatant example of trying to take advantage of people and greed. I guess that  happens when you think you’re a YouTube superstar. Well, now I know why there are bidets in the bathroom at a mechanic shop.

I called and spoke to Dave’s automotive today 10/10/25  because I was wanting to purchase the DCR fuel pump to replace the  CP4 on my 2025 F350 6.7 L power stroke.

I know the pump cost $2400 and I called to see what labor would be to have said pump installed. I was quoted at least $6800 to do the job that’s including the price of the pump and it would take at least 3 to 4 days. I was also told they could clean my intake out for a few hundred more bucks. Really you’re charging $4400 in labor and you can’t even clean the intake as part of the package. This is totally asinine. You’re not inventing/engineering anything you’re not rebuilding anything. You’re simply changing out some parts. I was a heavy equipment mechanic for quite a few years, I’ve since moved on to a different line of work, but if I still had a shop I would do the job myself.

I like everybody else have watched the YouTube videos and thought “you know this looks like a very reputable shop. I think I will give them a shot”. Because I travel for work and I’m constantly in the state of Utah getting the truck to them would not be a big deal at all. Yeah I didn’t realize they are so enriched with greed.

After I got off the phone with them, I called 6 other shops In the city I live in
(Rapid City, South Dakota) and the absolute most I was quoted for labor was $2300 and all 6 shops said they would take care of cleaning all soot buildup as part of the install. And nobody quoted 3 to 4 days they all said the same thing 1 to 2 days.

I thought well maybe it’s just a Utah thing And things are more expensive there so I took it one step further and called several shops in several different states around Utah including California and wouldn’t you know it Dave’s it’s still the most expensive.

At the end of the day, I know this review will fall on deaf ears. I just really wanted to let people know what I had experienced. The simple fact is greed cost you a customer. I would’ve been more than happy to buy the pump and pay a fair price for labor.

Enjoy your bidet.

Matt.

reviews.name: JB
reviews.text:
I live 65 miles away. I called and asked for rough estimate on a 2014 F150 to replace the turbo coolant lines and fittings on both sides of the truck.  I'm trying to balance repair versus just getting a new truck. Common issue with the F150 ecoboost.  They tell me no estimate without them seeing the truck. I understand the cost could change when they get the truck for repair.  However, I find it ridiculous that they would not give me a rough cut estimate over the phone.  This is our only vehicle, so I was willing to get a rental car and drop it off. Not now! I guess they don't want the business. BTW, I would have had the brakes done and a few other things!  There is nothing like not understanding a customers situation and being a bit flexible. BTW, I am a former mechanic and mechanical engineer who designed and developed drivetrains for a living.  I can troubleshoot a leaking coolant line just fine.

At the time I gave this review, the shop foreman contacted emailed me and said he would talk with me.  I gave him my phone number. I never received a call, and it's  been many months now. It's clear this business really is customer hostile to those that don't fit their rigid "drop it off" policy and then we'll give you a quote.   It is interesting they try to increase their reach with the social media, yet don't have any special accommodation for people living farther away.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi JB,
We are sorry to hear that our service did not meet expectation.  We do not give quotes over the phone because it may create a price benchmark that is unrealistic upon further inspection of the vehicle. We'd hate for you to drive a long-distance only to arrive and find that the actual work required exceeded the initially quoted price. We understand that this approach can be frustrating. Many potential  customers request "ball-park figures" over the phone and, after 35+ years in the business, we've learned that it is better to inspect and diagnose before making any assumptions around price. We've taken your feedback and are reviewing it with our team. Thanks for reaching out and providing the review.

reviews.name: Scott Robinson
reviews.text:
My experience with Dave’s Complete Auto Service was excellent! I drive a 2022 Chevy Silverado 3500HD L5P Duramax. At 115,000 miles I had Dave’s shop install an Insane Diesel bypass filter and a Banks lower oil pan. It was also time for a coolant flush. I called Dave’s shop on April 29 and spoke with Aubrey. She answered all my questions and treated me with kindness and respect. My appointment was made with the understanding that I was driving in from Denver on Wednesday to drop off my truck Thursday morning. We communicated via txt or phone over the next 4 weeks. Aubrey was patient with my inquiries and provided realistic expectations for additional services I asked about. I was updated frequently on when parts arrived and for my pending appointment date.
The morning of my appointment I checked Apple Maps for how long of a drive it would be and noticed that Yelp had Dave’s Complete Auto Center at a low 2 stars. I looked into the reviews only to quickly see that the customers leaving the poor reviews must have posted their experience on the wrong thread. There is another Dave’s shop in the area. If that wasn’t the case, it was apparent that those that left a poor review had been in a stressful vehicle situation that was easy to blame a mechanic for what was most likely due to a lack of maintenance on the part of the owner. If you don’t brush and floss regularly you can expect the Dentist to report that you have a cavity. Either way, speculation on why poor reviews were reported did not prevent me from taking my truck in for service.
I met Aubrey and finished up the service agreement of the work we previously discussed. I was impressed by Aubrey’s meticulous detail of the notes taken from our conversations. I asked to add a diagnostic boost leak test along with the other services and if it would be possible to show me the location of the AC condenser drain tube. All my questions were answered and I left feeling like I made the right choice of shop for my truck.
Aubrey called me around 2:00pm and asked if I would be able to come see the work completed and to meet Jake to show me where the AC drain tube was located while my truck was up on the lift. Jake showed me his professional work and explained all that was completed. The drain tube was not in a location easily accessible without unnecessary effort. However, Jake had a solution that we agreed would accomplish the task.
A short while later my truck was ready. The price for the work done was fair and reasonable. Quality and expertise comes at a cost that represents the value of the work performed. Dave’s shop provides that quality. And I left knowing it was honest work completed. I would highly recommend Jake for his mechanic skills. Aubrey will no doubt continue to excel in her role as a service advisor. Should my truck require any services in the future, I’ll trust Dave’s Complete Auto Center.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Aubrey is our detail queen. She recently received a promotion and this review more than confirms that she deserved it. Thanks for letting us work on your truck and for shouting out our amazing team members. You were such a great customer. Thanks for trusting us to do the work!

reviews.name: Facekicker
reviews.text:
Called for some info on some maintenance service, got some girl who said she was new and had a sarcastic and rude response to anything I asked, then she claimed the website is inaccurate and doesn't portray the services they actually perform there.

Then there's some guy yelling on the speaker phone from across the room about how they don't perform this service, but I have their web page advertising it and inviting me to call for info.

After being treated like a fool for asking about a service they do in fact perform, I got a quote that bid it as a $2000 job.
Quotes from surrounding shops were $500 and $699.

Dave's clearly is doing so well on tiktok that they don't need to practice competitive pricing or friendly service or actually perform any work for anyone.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the feedback. "Some girl" is a newer employee who was trying her best to handle a more complicated call. Everybody deserves a chance to grow and get mastery of their craft. We've all gotta start somewhere.

reviews.name: jason R
reviews.text: Just called to get an estimate to have my 7.3 rebuilt with speed to air pistons and the complete job. The young lady I spoke to on the phone had the personality of a brick and seem to have the concern of nothing. Almost felt like I was interrupting her while she was trying to eat her breakfast. I can't describe how excited I was to have my 7.3 with 400,000 miles on it rebuilt by Daves shop with speed to air pistons. I'll just go to a Nevada dealer and see if I can get it built in Nevada with the same products. Unsubscribe, unfollow, uninterested now. The sad part is I sent two friends to get their Duramax's done at that shop and they had the best experience of their life. Just sad.
reviews.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Jason,

We are sorry your experience wasn't what you had hoped. We want to make this right. Please call our service number and ask for Donald. We will make sure he knows your call is coming.

reviews.name: Christina Grace
reviews.text:
*Please be aware that this business is under new ownership and I believe the phone number listed here is incorrect.*

We were traveling around Utah and were staying at a place nearby when we noticed our rental car had a flat tire. MOST businesses are closed Saturdays and Sundays in these parts. When we pulled into their parking lot there were two gentlemen doing maintenance on the building. His name was Alaska and he said he had seen the mechanic earlier and would let us know when he got back. About 30 minutes later he texted us that he was back and THANKFULLY he was able to patch the tire up for us. Meanwhile, the daughter of the new owners happened to stop by and my husband chatted with her.

We were so grateful to get the tire fixed up before heading to Salt Lake. And so thankful they happened to be there that Saturday.

reviews.name: Andy Flygare
reviews.text: I have a vintage car, one of the calipers got stuck on the rear tire. These guys came and towed me. The driver told me how they could fix it for less than anyone else. I went against my better judgment and decided to give them a chance. The mechanic told me he'd replace both rear calipers, rotors and brakes, gave me a quote. I called Les Schwab, and Les Schwab was less. Express Auto said they'd match the quote, and I trusted them. When I picked up my car, the first thing I had noticed is their mechanic got grease all over the outside of it, their were finger prints all over. There was also a big greasy foot print on the floor, since they won't take the few cents it costs to put paper down. The biggest issue is they only replaced one of the calipers, instead of both. When I questioned them about this they claim only the bad one needed replaced (which any respectable mechanic will replace both so you don't experience improper brake imbalance). I let them know their mechanic told me both over the phone, and yes, I made the cardinal mistake of not getting it in writing and trusting them by their word, which is what they used against me. So this is how they price match, by not installing everything they said they would. I dealt with Dallas the son of the owner. He then called me names and said I was full of it... the only people full of it are the people that run this place... you've been warned... I would stay away from this place at all costs.

reviews.name: Doyle Jenkins
reviews.text: Lady on the phone was extremely rude and had no intentions of helping.  Trash.

reviews.name: Finnette Cook
reviews.text: I would give this company a minus 5 stars if this app would let me. Their Customer service is terrible. They hardly answer their phone but when they do their snippy and rude . When you ask to talk to the manager he is never in, but some how miraculously appears. They put the wrong tires on our trailer refused to switch them out. We went to Inn and out Tire and they swapped them out and took great care of us when it wasn't even their mistake. Also don't give them the wrong change they can take your money but can't give it back. Go to Inn and out or any other place but here if you want good customer service.

reviews.name: JMB22stars
reviews.text:
When i called Gracie  the receptionist, was exceptionally nice on the phone, quoting me on great prices for used tires. I was running alittle late to get to Express Auto and Tire, so i called and she yold me they would wait for me to get there, begore closing.. when i got there she knew exactly who i was, the cusomer service was absolutly amazing. I had been there maybe 10 min and my car was ready to go!! I was told by another car place that this place wasnt good at all, but honestly, nicest most helpfull people, and at the price, wow.
Thanx Express Auto and Tire!! I will definitly be coming back and will spread the news around!!
